loans.name: Sumrud

texts.en: Sumrud S. owns a couple of cows in the small village of Shahnerzerli, in the Devechi region of Azerbaijan. She is raising cattle to sell for slaughter as well as raising milking cows in order to sell the milk to the merchants in the local markets and bazaar. Sumrud is looking for funding in order to purchase a couple more cows so that she can increase her product output and therefore increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Houn

texts.en: Mrs. Houn R. is 26 years old and operates a small floral shop in Siem Reap, Cambodia.  She can earn about $3/day in this business, while her husband earns $7/day working as a driver for a tourist company.  Together, they support 2 young children.  This loan will be used to purchase flowers for Mrs. Houn R.' shop.  As her business grows, she hopes to buy bicycles for her children to ride to school.

loans.use: To purchase more flowers for her shop

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak married in 1984 and has 7 children. He started his business as a construction contractor more than 20 years ago. He contracts to build houses and other buildings from village to village. He sometimes stays at the construction site.

Vannak's wife, Sok Rady, sews clothes at home. They both only finished primary school. Therefore, they are sending all their children to school in the local schools and of course they encourage their children to pursue higher education.

Vannak is asking for a first loan of US$ 200 from MAXIMA. With this loan, he will repair his house. We feel confident that Vannak has ability to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Repairing house

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a very active and enterprising woman. She is 44 years old and married to Mr. U. with six children.

In order to take care of her family, Florence started her own business selling drinks and palm oil six years ago. She is requesting a loan of $400, which will enable her buy more palm oil and drinks for sale. She plans to repay it in eight months.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and palm oil

loans.name: Dadadjon

texts.ru:
Dadadjon works on the regional market. The goods are delivered to him from the city. He is married and has 3 children. He has been working on the market for the past 8 years. He came to MicroInvest in 2007 asking for a credit that will allow him to increase the size of his business.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Дададжон работает на рынке своего района, ему привозят товар с города. Он семьянин, имеет троих детей и на рынке он около 8 лет. В "Микроинвест" он обратился в 2007 году, что бы расширить бизнес.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and resale on the market

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca F. has worked selling all kinds of food in the city of Chinandega for 18 years now. She is a single mother with a child for whom she is responsible, so she has to ensure he has food and education.

Mrs. F. is an example for many people, because she started her business without capital. She started selling tortillas until she had saved enough to buy merchandise for her business, and nowadays she has seen better results from her business.

It is important to highlight that Ceprodel has supported Mrs. F. through loans, which have allowed her to increase her sales, and most of all, having her own food stand in the city of Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora F. es ejemplo para muchas personas ya que inició su negocio sin tener capital por lo que comenzó a vender tortillas para ahorrar hasta comprar los enseres para su negocio y hoy en día ha visto mejores resultados en su negocio.

Es importante destacar que Ceprodel ha apoyado a la señora F. por medio de créditos a su favor que han hecho que ella pueda aumentar sus ventas y sobre todo tener su propio establecimiento de venta de comida en la ciudad de Chinandega.

loans.use: Buying ingredients (Compra de ingredienes)

loans.name: Oyshajon

texts.ru:
Oyshajon D., who is 50 years old, has a Bachelors degree in Economics, is married, and has 5 children. Oyshajon has been in the business of selling children's toys, glassware, and gifts for the past 15 years. She rents a space on one of the markets in the town of Vahdat. Using the loan she is planning to purchase additional inventory. These funds will help her to increase the assortment of goods and help local residents have access to and ability to purchase a variety of glassware and other goods that she sells. Oyshajon will be paying off the loan withing the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Додочонова Ойшачон, возраст – 50 лет, образование – высшее, по специальности - экономист, замужем, имеет 5-х детей. Ойшачон занимается продажей детских игрушек, посудой и подарками. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 15 лет. Для этого она арендует небольшой магазин на одном из рынков города Вахдата. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести новый товар. Кредит поможет увеличить Ойшачон ассортимент продаваемого товара, а жители района всегда будут иметь возможность прийти к ней в магазин и приобрести, то что им надо из посуды или других вещей, которыми она торгует. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase additional assortment of inventory

loans.name: Kabumbi V C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Moreen N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items. Moreen is 27 years old and is married with a husband, who sells spare parts for work. She has 4 children ranging from age 2 to 10 and her children go to school. Each week, Moreen makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy more business stock. Moreen has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to pay rent for the shop premises and the loan was paid back on time.

Moreen is joined in her small group by Magret N., Josephine N., Mary N., and Jesca N.. Magret N. has a business running a restaurant and wants to purchase more furniture like tables. Josephine N. is currently operating a business in tailoring and wants a loan to buy more cloth material and fabrics. Mary N. operates a business of fresh food sales and wants to purchase more foods to sell. Jesca N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add capital stock.

loans.use: To add more commodities to retail shop

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mr. In T., age 71, is an old man who lives with his wife, age 77 at home and make no income. They have three children, two of whom are farmers and one other who has a business fishing for a living.
To improve the fishing business, the family must purchase more fishing tools like nets and so on. This will allow the son to catch more fish to sustain the family’s income. (Mr. In T. is pictured on the right hand side, his son, the fisherman, is in the middle and the woman on the left  is his daughter)

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tools like nets and so on.

loans.name: Yoeum

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeum A., 27, is married with two little children and works weaving mats to raise her standard of living. A mat-weaving skill has been left and taught by her ancestors. Generally, whenever her outputs are done, the brokers come over and purchase during the day. She can make about $2 each day of net income. Her husband, meanwhile, works as a construction foreman, earning around $5 per day. With the incomes that she and her husband make are basically help to cover her daily expense and her loan repayment. Recently, this couple has taken out a loan to build partly of her house and the rest of the money will be used to reinvest in her mat business. She feels amazed with the loan on her family.

loans.use: to build partly of her house and the rest of the money will be used to reinvest in her mat business

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Jeanne H. was born around 1967 in Porto Novo. A widow responsible for three children (two girls and one boy), she lives in Ekpe in the commune of Seme Podji in the south-east of Benin. Since she lives not far from the Ekpe market which is especially lively at night, Mrs. H. sells prepared food: vegetable sauces, peanut sauces, cornmeal mush, etc. Since her foods are much appreciated, she would like to try out other types of dishes with her very faithful clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

H. Jeanne est née vers les années 1967 à PORTO NOVO. Veuve ayant à sa charge 3 enfants (2 filles et 1 garçon), elle réside à EKPE dans la commune de SEME PODJI au sud-est du BENIN. Ayant son domicile non loin du marché d’EKPE qui s’anime beaucoup plus la nuit, dame H. Jeanne vend du repas prêt à manger: sauce de légume, sauce d’arachide, pâte de maïs, etc. Son repas étant bien apprécier, elle envisage s’essayer à d’autres types de sauces et de pâtes qu’elle soumettra à sa clientèle qui lui est très fidèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of one basket of fresh fish, three baskets of condiments, ½ bag of corn and ½ bag of manioc flour

Achat de 1 panier de poisson frais, 3 paniers de condiments, ½ sac de maïs et ½ sac de farine de manioc.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam S. R., 36, lives in the Kampong Cham province with her husband, Ros Bou Rithy, and their two young children. She sells common Khmer dishes that she cooks, earning US$6 net income each day. She and her husband work together in their business, serving pork and beef with Khmer wine. She has asked for a loan of US$500 to build a separate room for their restaurant business to increase their customer base. Their current business is hampered by a lack of adequate space. In the future, she would like to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: Build a separate room to sell food

loans.name: Pavlo

texts.en:
Pavlo is married. He lives in Khoost and works as a taxi driver. He has been in this business for five years. His monthly income is about $500. One of the most outstanding characteristics of his venture has been its stability and consistent growth.

Pavlo is requesting a loan of 3500 Grivnas to cover expenses connected with paperwork he needs to prepare in order to install a gas equipment system in his vehicle. Pavlo has been planning to make these changes for awhile because he wanted to decrease his fuel costs and make his business more efficient. Pavlo has proved to be a responsible client with Nadiya Ukraine. We believe his drive for success and increased profits will be the best motivation for prompt loan repayment and further development of his business.

loans.use: To get all paperwork and install gas equipment

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is married and has four children. Her children are 16, 19, 21, and 24, respectively, and the older three are married. Cristina's husband works as an agent. Cristina has always liked working in sales, so two years ago she started a perfume business. She sells perfumes to her family, friends, and neighbors. All of her sales are on credit, and sometimes her clients are late on payments. This has led Cristina to give preference to clients who can secure payment.

Cristina needs a loan of $650, which she'll repay in 6 months. She'll use the money to build her inventory of perfumes and to fill the orders that she already has.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina es casada y madre de 4 hijos de 16, 19 21 y 24 años (los tres mayores ya casados), su esposo trabaja como comisionista. Ella inició el negocio ya que siempre le han gustado y se ha dedicado a las ventas, comenzó hace mas de 2 años, tenia un dinero ahorrado y empezó vendiendo perfumes a familiares, amigos y vecinos, todas sus ventas son en pagos, en ocasiones le quedan mal, aun que siempre le pagan pero esto ocasiona que ella se retrace en surtir otros pedidos seguros que tiene.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $650 que pagara en 6 meses para tener inventario extra de perfumes y poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza K. is 41 years old. She is married and has six children. Her husband has no fixed job, so Firuza must work to support her large family's needs. She worked fortwo years in a gift shop, and thanks to her savings, six years ago she was able to start her own business. She now sells clothing for children. She gets help from her children, who take care of the store in the afternoon. Thanks to her hard work, her customers increased and she had to rent the store next door to expand and offer a better variety. She is now requesting a loan of $1000 USD, which she will use to buy new clothing for the autumn season. She commits to repay the loan over a period of 12 months. Firuza is thankful for your generosity and help.

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
Lucinda G. D. L. is a member of community bank Obreras, which means "worker" in Spanish. She is married with four children and lives in Ayacucho. To support her family, Lucinda works as a mid-wife, as well as at an artisan workshop. With the help of her niece and son, she also runs a small kiosk with computers that offer internet services.

With her loan of 1800 soles (~$600 USD), she will invest in her various businesses by purchasing materials for the artisan shop, such as yarn, as well as an oven and more computers for her kiosk. With her savings, she hopes to reach her goal of providing for herself and her husband as they grow older.

loans.use: To purchase yarn for her artisan shop, as well as an oven  for her home and more computers for her internet kiosk business.

loans.name: Afito

texts.fr: Veuve  avec trois personnes à charges, madame Afito A. est née en 1955à Dagué. Elle est populaire dans le village à cause de son dynamisme et de son activité vente de médicaments génériques dans la pharmacie du village. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour approvisionner sa pharmacie en produits pour le bonheur des habitants du village et aussi pour sa propre survie car c’est cette activité qui la fait vivre et fait nourrir les personnes dont elle a la charge et surtout d’assurer la scolarité de ces enfants.
texts.en:
A widow with three people in her care, Ms. Afito A. was born in 1955 in Dagué. She is popular in her village because of her dynamism and her work selling generic medicines in the village pharmacy. She is requesting this loan to supply the pharmacy for the village inhabitants and their happiness and also for her own survival, since it is from this work that she makes a living and feeds those in her care. It also ensures the schooling of these children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell generic medicines

loans.name: Rosa Isela

texts.es: La señora Rosa Isela es ama de casa, esposa, trabajadora y muy pronto madre de un nuevo bebe, ella al igual que su esposo están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de protecciones en puertas y ventanas para mayor seguridad de la familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Isela is a hard-working homemaker and wife and will very soon be the mother of a new baby! She and her husband are requesting this loan to install security devices on their windows and doors in order to have a safer home for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hardware (security devices for windows and doors)

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Luz Maria García A. tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es casada, Doña Luz tiene 4 hijos de los cuales su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 27 años labora por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 26 años también labora por cuenta propia y su otro hijo de 24 años que cursa el 4 año de secundaria ya que tiene que recurrir a clases por la noche debido a que trabaja por la noche y su otra hija que tiene la edad de 17 años, su esposo labora como capataz de campo, los propósitos de Doña Luz son de sacar delante su negocio por lo que tiene que generar ingresos para su familia ya que tiene que buscar el pan de cada día para su familia sus deseos son de vender mercadería al por mayor para suplir las diferentes necesidades que de sus clientes sus sueños son que la situación del país mejore para que los nicaragüense puedan optar por mas trabajos y mejoremos la economía del país.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en el reparto. Ronal Altamirano de la escuela 2c abajo, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 5 años, sus inicios dan comienzo con otro tipo de negocio ella comienza vendiendo refrescos y desayunos a los paileros del Ingenio de Monte Rosa por lo que esta actividad la realiza diario por lo que ella distribuía los productos de comida  y su esposo la ayuda a recolectar el dinero del pago de los clientes y mas tarde decide implementar otra forma de generar ingresos para su familia como lo fue establecer una pulpería por lo que ahora tiene los dos negocios y su objetivo son de mantenerlos para que estos le proporcionen lo necesario para poder vivir por lo que necesita el financiamiento  para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de sus productos como los son granos básicos, pollo, crema y queso ya que tiene que surtir su pulpería para ofertar a sus clientes lo que estos necesitan.
texts.en:
Luz Maria García A. is 51 years old and married. Luz has four children: her eldest son is 27 and self-employed; her second son is 26 and also self-employed; her third son is 24 and studying in his fourth year of high school because he is going to night school as he works at night; her daughter is 17. Her husband works as a field foreman. Luz's goal is to continue in business as she needs the income for her family to put bread on the table. She wants to sell merchandise in bulk to satisfy her clients' demands. She dreams of a better future for her country, with more employment for Nicaraguans and a stronger Nicaraguan economy. Luz has run a grocery for 5 years. She began with a different line of business, selling refreshments and breakfast to the coppersmiths of the Monte Rosa sugar refinery: she would distribute the food daily and her husband helped by collecting the payments from her clients. She later decided to make money for her family by starting a grocery and she now has the two businesses. Her goal is to keep both businesses generating income for the family to live on. She needs this loan for working capital to buy staples such as grains, chicken, cream and cheese as she has to stock her grocery to offer her clients what they need.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley J. is 50 years old, married, and lives in Obay, Polanco Zamboamga del Norte. She has 4 children and 2 are in school. One of them is graduating this coming March. According to her, their life’s journey has been full of challenges.  Her husband works hard as a carpenter, sewer and driver so that he could give the best of things for his family but still it is not enough. To help out, Shirley began selling snacks at school.

Hearing about Paglaum MPC, she joined on May 17, 2006.  Shirley stopped selling snacks in the school and used her first loan was used to open a sari-sari store on their house.  She sells firewood and even fruits in her store. Recently, she asked for a $325 loan to buy merchandise for the sari-sari store & to repair their tricycle for her husband’s income. She hopes for the progress and success of her business so that they could raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for sale & to repair their motorcycle for hire

loans.name: Zinaba

texts.en: Zinaba A. is a single parent and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high. Zinaba sells local dishes known as Kenkey and also fries fish at Kotokoraba in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1999. Zinaba uses her income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses . Zinaba will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more corn to increase the sales of kenkey to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Zinaba plans to save towards acquiring a piece of land for the building of the family house so that they can stop paying rent and also get a comfortable shelter for the family.

loans.use: Zinaba will use the loan as additional capital to enable her to buy more corn to increase the sales of kenkey to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Anim

texts.en:
L., age 56, lives in Siem Reap Province and is taking a loan of US$ 700 to build a new house for herself and her family. She is the mother of three children: all of them are married and live in different houses except the youngest family who own a tourist (12 chairs) transporting service is living with her.

Loeng who works as a local primary teacher is the husband of L.. L. plants bananas and some kinds of vegetables behind her house. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To build a new house for herself and her family

loans.name: Ruziki Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Helene S., age 32, is married with three children (ages 15, 12 and 7). She has a business selling vegetables and fruits in Kigogo Fresh. She started the business 5 years ago and works daily from 6am until 10pm. Helen is able to earn about US$ 62 per month.

This will be Helene's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she is excited to get started! She intends to use the loan to increase her stock and to buy material to make bricks to build her home.

Helene will share this loan with her loan group, Riziki Kigogo. The group has 16 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Helen is the first on the right in the blue dress.

loans.use: buying more vegetables and fruit for re-sale and bricks for her house

loans.name: Fakeye

texts.en: Fakeye D. is 30 years old and married with a child. He sells planks to make a living. He is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more planks to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Adelina Manuel

texts.pt:
Adelina Manuel M. nasceu em xai-xai distrito capital da província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 36 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos, com idade entre o primeiro com 17 o segundo com 13 e o terceiro tem 10 anos respectivamente.

Adelina é estudante da 10ªclasse curso nocturno, mudou se da cidade de xai-xai em 1986 na companhia da sua família onde vieram morar no distrito de Boane, local onde vivem até nesta data.

Adelina é trabalhadora nas bombas da Galpe como cozinheira desde 2000, obedecendo um calendário das 7 as 17h todos os dias excepto segunda-feira , deste emprego é paga um salário mensal de 2450,00mt assim conseguindo poupar mensalmente 500,00mt. Este é o terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, teve 5 vezes na associação Gueguegue, com este pretende comprar material de construção afim de dar continuidade com a sua obra, e futuramente pretende solicitar empréstimo para construção de um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Adelina Manuel M. was born in the Xai-Xai district of Gaza, in Southern Mozambique. She is 36 years-old, married, and the mother of three children, ages 17, 13 and 10. Since 1986 she has been living in the Boane district, with her family. Adelina is currently in 10th Grade, attending night classes. Since 2000 Adelina has been working as a cook at a GALP Gas Station. Working six days a week, from Tuesday-Sunday, 7:00 am until 5:00 pm, she makes a monthly salary of 2450,00mt, which allows her to save 500,00mt/month. This is her third loan with Hluvuku and the first with Kiva (she has had five loans with Associação Gueguegue in the past) . She plans to use this loan to buy construction material to continue building her house. In the future, she hopes to get a loan to invest in building a commercial space.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Nolberta

texts.es:
La señora Nolberta es Socia del banco comunal “Las Fronterizas” en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; de 54 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace 8 años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos y su primer prestamo fue de S/.300 soles, monto que le sirvió para adquirir más mercadería en su tienda de abarrotes.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles podrá adquirir una variedad de productos como arroz, azúcar, conservas, leche, aceite y enlatados. Ello le permitirá tener mejores ingresos y ayudará con los ingresos en su economía familiar
texts.en:
Nolberta is a member of Las Fronterizas Communal Bank in the Desaguadero district of Chucuito in the state of Puno. She is 54 years old, the mother of four children and a high school graduate. For the past eight years she has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement and her first loan was for 300 soles, money she used to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store. With this loan of 2,500 soles she will be able to purchase a variety of products like rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil and canned goods. This will help her to have a better income which contributes to the income of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil and canned goods to sell in a general store

loans.name: Sonomdendev

texts.en: Sonomdendev D. lives with his wife and two teenage daughters in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. His two daughters are in high school. Sonomdendev runs a small retail business selling food products, largely soft drinks, biscuits, and other items. He started his business in 2004 with the help of his wife. He rents a small stall in the local food market and sells the products his wife buys in wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Since launching his business, Sonomdendev has done well, more than quadrupuling his capital. In the future, he hopes to own a stall in the market, rather than rent. He has applied for this loan to buy more items to buy in Ulaanbaatar to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy food products from Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia

loans.name: Monica Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Mónica Elizabeth M. C. tiene 35 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudio secundarios incompletos , tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen de ella económicamente. 
Mónica Elizabeth  se dedica a la preparación de tamales junto con su madre y su padre es el encargado de salir a venderlos por las calles de su distrito.  Ella actualmente ese encuentra laborando en la Municipalidad del Distrito de Salaverry.

Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió del Banco Comunal  “Las Emprendedoras II”, lo invirtió en la compra insumos como harina , aceite . aceitunas para la preparación de su tamales (plato tipico de la región). 
Con la ayuda del préstamo empezó a comprar sus insumos  al por mayor y así poder estar abastecida y generar mayor  ganancia.
Con el crédito de 1.200 soles lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de insumos para la preparación de sus tamales.
También tiene planificado en esta semana comprar productos de limpieza como desinfectantes, lejía. Ácido muriático, etc  los cuales va a ofrecer a sus amistades, compañeros de trabajo, vecinos y familiares.
Mónica tiene como sueño, incrementar su negocio para obtener dinero darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y poder ayudarlos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sra. Monica Elizabeth M. C., 35, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She started high school, but didn't finish. She has 5 children, two of whom still live at home. Monica Elizabeth earns a living making tamales with her mother. Her father is responsible for going out in neighborhood and selling the tamales. She works in the Salaverry district. She used the first loan that she received from Las Emprendedoras II community bank, for 300 soles, to buy supplies such as flour, cooking oil, olives for making tamales (a traditional dish of the region). The loan allowed her to buy supplies in bulk so that she could be well-stocked and increase her earnings. She will use the 1,200 soles loan to buy supplies for making her tamales. She also plans this week to buy cleaning products such as disinfectants, bleach, muriatic acid, etc. which she'll sell to friends, co-workers, neighbors and relatives. Monica dreams of growing her business to get more money and give her children a better quality of life and help with their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus A. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao Camiguin. He is 34 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Jesus operates his own business venture in the services sector. The main source of income for the business comes from providing services such as vulcanization and tire repair. Jesus has been engaged in this business for over 36 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jesus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesus is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase materials and equipment that will improve the services he offers. This will be his first loan from HSPFI, and Jesus plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and equipment that will improve the services offered

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, a mother of seven children, comes from Mumias, a rural area in Kenya. She operates a second-hand clothing business in a small trading center called Harambee. Her business involves buying second-hand clothes from the border town and selling them in an open-air market on Tuesdays and Saturdays. On Saturdays, Amina also travels to Mumias open-air market to sell her merchandise (a distance of about 20 kms).

Amina is a widow and depends on this business to support herself and her children. She is requesting a loan of Ksh 20,000 to enable her to increase her stock in anticipation of the increased demand during the holy month of Ramadhan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Lany

texts.en: Lany E. is from the village of Manticao, Iligan City. She is 46 years old, is widowed, and has four school-aged children. Lany owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Lany joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha C. owns a small store and she has been selling basic goods since 2005. Among of her customers are the neighbors, travelers, and students who whiled away their time in her store during class break. Editha knows that with her husband income, they could hardly support their family. The store is truly helpful in providing their whole family needs.

She would like to request a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to resell. In that way, she could be able to attract more customers and improve her normal sales.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise to resell

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie L., 41 years old is a rice farmer in Sto.Nino South Cotabato in Mindanao. She ahs three children, 22 years old the eldest who inpire her always to work harder to be able to buy the baisc needs at home. It was Octonber of 2006 that she started accessing loans from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She likes the program a lot that is why she stayed as CEVI client until now. 

She would like to request for another loan in CEVI worth Php 15,000. She will use her loan to fund her farm by buying the farming necesities to have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 60 year widowed with two children aged between 5 and 10. All her children go to school .She resides and rents a two roomed house where she stays with five people  Maria takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and no piped water.  Maria works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala.  She is a tailor on Lubaga Road selling airtime cards and the cards from telecommunication firms and so she pays for transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business but as she works from her home. Maria sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale and works six days a week Maria  She has been in this business for nine years and with MCDT for six years servicing her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more airtime cards. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning fa video library and designing shop

loans.use: to buy more airtime cards

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina L. manages a rice farming business in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She has six children, and her eldest is 23 years old. She receives good income from her farm except when it is attacked by pests.

She needs additional capital to help sustain her rice field. She's now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., to purchase farm supplies and to make payment for land preparation. This will help her to finance her business with a low interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is engaged in vending frozen food in the village of Rizal Santiago City. She is thankful because she has her loving husband and children. She is married to Joey, who is a hollow block maker. They have three children: Jhoana Mae, ten years old and an elementary student; Eizelle Ann, five years old; and Bea, two months old. Josephine would like to buy additional frozen foods so that she can sustain the needs of her family.  However, due to insufficient funds, she needs to borrow 4,000 PHP from the KIVA lenders so she can buy more frozen food to sell in order to meet her customers' demands and to make a good profit.

loans.use: To buy more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Ngoja

texts.en:
Ngoja M., 30, has a retail shop selling secondhand bed linens. The shop is located in Kongowea marketplace, a suburb of Mombassa, and sells mattress covers, curtains, bath towels as well as leather shoes. His clientele is primarily women and he has both repeat and walk-in customers. He has been in this business for ten years, previously working in a bed linens shop.

Ngoja is using this KES 40,000 loan to expand his offering to include mosquito nets, comforters and bed covers. He would like to expand and have a second location.

Ngoja is married with one child, 2 1/2 years old. His highest goal is for his family to have a good education. He is hardworking, sells good products, and is honest.

loans.use: To offer a wider inventory including nets, comforters and bed covers

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday is 34 years-old and married without children. He has a pharmacy where he sells medicines at retail prices. The business is very lucrative and he is happy with his business. He hopes to own a maternity home in the future. He is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. Friday is a LAPO client.  LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Africa, particularly Nigeria.  He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase medicines.

loans.name: Anarkul's Group

texts.en:
Anarkul E. is the leader of this group. She is fifty-two years old. Anarkul, being a hardworking woman and having a good husband by her side, has been fortunate as she has easily passed all possible difficulties in her life. Together they have raised six children: the eldest daughter and son are married and live separately with their families; another son also lives separately and works in Bishkek as a driver; the rest of the children still go to school. To help their children successfully finish high school and stand on their own feet, Anarkul and her husband raise cattle. Ten years ago, Anarkul’s and her husband’s parents gave them a cow and ten sheep for breeding. Since then, animal husbandry has been their main source of income and has enabled them to achieve the marriage of their two children. Now, from selling milk and trading in cattle, Anarkul makes $115 a month. Anarkul and her husband have many plans about increasing the total population of their livestock. Now, Anarkul hopes to get this loan as it would enable her to buy two calves to raise and sell. They need to earn extra money so that they can pay for their daughter’s college education, as she is graduating from high school this academic year. Anarkul’s partners are: Venera, 38, has three children. To support her family her husband works as a taxi-driver. Besides that, Venera keeps two calves and works as a logistics manager’s assistant. Venera has applied for this loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition. Gulnara, 46, has three children. Her husband works as a training officer in a vocational school and Gulnara works as a doctor at the same school. After work she sells apples and keeps two calves. Gulnara needs this loan to purchase three sheep for breeding. Anarkul, 44, is divorced and has one son, 25, who works as a builder in a resort. Anarkul keeps a calf, which she is going to sell after raising it. As to her regular job, she is a cook at the vocational school. Anarkul hopes to obtain this loan and buy a foal. ====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.
Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy two calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Milton

texts.es:
Milton es carpintero, y elabora muebles de todo tipo como también arreglos en general, tiene dos hijos pequeños y su esposa realiza labores de casa.
Su taller y casa se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Villa Armonía de la ciudad de la Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la capital de trabajo (compra de madera, venesta, clavos y cola)
Es la Quinta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Milton is a carpenter and makes all kinds of furniture as well as general repairs. He has two small children and his wife maintains the house. His workshop and house are located in the Villa Armonia zone of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used for working capital, including the purchase of wood, plywood, nails, and glue. This is Milton’s fifth loan with Impro, and he has an excellent record in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wood, plywood, nails, glue, etc. for carpentry business

loans.name: Placida Claudia

texts.es:
Placida es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas II.
Placida es casada, tiene 58 años y 7 hijos, Placida junto a sus hijos se dedican a la fabricación D. ladrillos, además Placida se dedica a la compra y venta D. tuna, cochinilla y tara.
Placida necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en el pago D. personal.
Los sueños D. Placida son terminar D. construir su casa y que sus últimos hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Placida, 58, is a member of the Orcasitas II communal bank. Placida is married and has 7 children. Together with her children, Placida manufactures bricks. In addition, Placida sells tuna, cochineal and tara (eco tanning is obtained from the grinding of the tara pod, harvested from a bush with the botanical name Caesalpinea Spinosa. Tara is mainly grown in the higlands of Perú). Placida needs a 900 sol loan, which will be used to pay her employees. Placida's dream is to finish building her house and that her youngest children finish their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay her employees.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel M. M. is twenty four years old, married, and has one six-month-old child. His business is located at Kimbo in Thika town. Thika is the region in Kenya known for its production of pineapples. 

He provides transportation to the local people. He has been in this business for the last two years. He says that this business is profitable but his major challenge is the high cost of maintenance. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 KES to buy a modern motorbike to be able to do his business well. He wants to be the best in terms of customer care to catch a larger market share.

loans.use: Motor bike.

loans.name: Mougnoun Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe Mougnoun sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  ayant en moyenne 37 ans et 4  enfants. Elles  vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Kamalen  Sirakoro, un des villages de la commune de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire.  Tous les prêts  précédents  se sont dénoués. 
Elles font la vente  d’arachide, d’atiecké, de poissons frais, de chaussures et de  pagnes.  
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 150kg  de grains d‘arachides, 100kg d’atiécké, 10kg de poissons, 3 douzaines de paires de chaussures en plastique et  10 pièces de pagnes real. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages avoisinants. Elles vendent aux marchés de Kamalen Sirakoro, de façon ambulante  et à domicile, au comptant et souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four members of the Lafia group are married women who, on the average, are 37 years old and have 4 children, and who mostly live in polygamous marriages in Kamalen Sirakoro, a village in the Sikasso community, the 3rd administrative district of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better satisfy their customers’ demands, and this would be their fourth joint loan. All previous loans have been repaid. They sell peanuts, atiécké (a starchy food made from cassava), fresh fish, shoes and pagnes (a type of West African wrap cloth). With this new loan, they plan to purchase 150 kg ( 330 lbs) of peanuts, 100 kg (220 lbs) of atiecke, 10 kg (22 lbs) of fish, 3 dozen pairs of plastic shoes and 10 sets of pagnes. They purchase their stock in the market of the town of Sikasso and in the nearby villages. They sell their goods at the markets of Kamalen Sirakoro, on the street or at home, for cash and often on credit, to a customer base composed of both men and women. They plan to reach a medium monthly income of approximately 23,500 West African Francs for each member of the group; a part of that income would be used for savings and for their families’ needs, and the rest invested in the business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing various articles for resale

loans.name: Ingrid Violeta

texts.en:
Ingrid is a 35-year-old mother of two who lives with her family in Cartago, a region located in the central valley of Costa Rica.

Ingrid has a business selling clothing for men, women and children including underwear, blouses and sports clothes. On a monthly basis, Ingrid travels by bus to San Jose in order to purchase clothing. When she returns to her community she sells the clothes she has purchased and earns a profit.

Unfortunately, the income Ingrid generates from sales, combined with her husband’s salary (he works as a laborer on a banana plantation), does not provide enough money to finance family expenses; as a result, Ingrid also works as a house cleaner in order to make ends meet.

To say that Ingrid is a hard worker is an understatement: in the mornings she carries out her duties as a domestic worker; in the afternoons, she works selling her products in her community; and whatever time she has left over is dedicated to her own domestic responsibilities.

In 2008, Ingrid had a bad bike accident when a child’s leg got stuck in her wheel; as a result, she had to take time of from her business in order to recover. Now she is healed and looks forward to dedicating herself to the success of her business.

Ingrid has successfully used previous loans to generate income from her business and used the revenues to make home improvements. This will be Ingrid’s sixth loan with Fundación Mujer. The loan consultant that has been working with Ingrid over the years describes her as a responsible, hard-working woman.

Ingrid plans to use this loan to make general investments in the expansion of her clothing sales business. Specifically, this loan will be used to purchase inventory clothing items and perfumes to sell in her community. 

Ingrid’s goal is to use the revenues she earns to improve her standard of living and that of her family. Specifically, she would like to make more home improvements and enable her children to have access to higher education.

Ingrid’s business is successful in the sense that she has a large client base. The problem she faces is a lack of working capital. Ingrid hopes that this loan will enable her to satisfy the needs of her clients by bringing them the products they request.

Ingrid values her business because it provides revenues which are used to finance family expenses and to contribute to her savings.

loans.use: To purchase clothes and perfumes

loans.name: Luy

texts.en: Mrs. Luy S. is 51 years old. She has owned a plot of farmland in Kompong Cham Province since 1980. There she grows all types of crops, which she plants twice a year. Beside her farm work, she has a few sewing machines that she and her husband use to sew the village’s clothes for extra income. Luy S. is a good mother of three children. Two of the children are single and one is married and lives away from home. Luy S. is married to Mr. Meur, 50, who assists her on the farm field. Luy S. has been planning to buy farmland in a good location near her village, but it is not possible because she does not have enough money. Therefore, Luy S. is applying for a loan to purchase a piece of land on which she will plant rice crops. Note: Luy S. was not available when the photo taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es: EL SEÑOR A. ES PROFESOR Y EL SALARIO NO LE AJUSTABA A PAGAR SU TITILO DE UNIVERCIDAD LO CUAL SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO PARA PAGO DE MONOGRAFIA.
texts.en:
EL SEÑOR A. ES PROFESOR Y EL SALARIO NO LE AJUSTABA A PAGAR SU TITILO DE UNIVERCIDAD LO CUAL SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO PARA PAGO DE MONOGRAFIA.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PAGO DE MONOGRAFIA

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 35 years old, married and has three children. She and her husband are both farmers. Janet learned about Kadet through a friend who is a member.  She is applying for her first loan, which she will use to buy seeds to grow corn and beans. She plans to produce a crop which is large enough for her to sell a portion of it in the local market, where she can earn a good profit. In the future, she plans to raise cows and increase her income enough to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy seeds to plant a crop of corn and beans

loans.name: Immacule

texts.en:
Immacule is 50 years old, married with 9 children.  Immacule is commonly known in the business of sewing clothes.  In this business, she employs 5 people from her community as helpers.  So as those employees help her to earn more profits, Immacule is still in the lack of the equipments.  Immacule usually runs her business from 7 am until late in the evening. 

Immacule is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more equipments including clothing items, additional sewing machines, etc.  With the use of this loan, Immacule will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will help her to sort out her family problems.  In addition, she will keep reinvesting for a better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase clothes so that she can make more clothes

loans.name: Mrs. Vanna San Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Ta Reab DoU. Sar village in Kandal province, there is a village bank loan, which consists of 17 people. Mrs. Vanna S. is the village bank president selected by the members. Each of the members will use a small piece of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Vanna S. is 46 years old and her position is a vegetable seller at her local market. Now she is a widow with five children. Two of the children are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is a construction worker, one is a fisherman, and one attends the local public school. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Vanna S. is applying for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. The rest of the loan she will use to fix a fishing boat.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Consesa

texts.en:
Consesa A. is from the village of Sta.Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Consesa is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Consesa owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Consesa is just starting this business and earns 8000 a month.

In 2010, Consesa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consesa is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed. This will be the first loan taken out by Consesa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, de 40 años, es una persona que ante todo primero busca el bienestar de su familia, pues vive con su pareja Mary Luz de 26 años y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. El amor a las tierras que lo vieron nacer ha hecho que Roberto, lleve 8 años dedicado al cultivo de plátanos y café, en sus terrenos propios. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposa, pero en temporada de limpieza y cosecha necesariamente contrata operarios para agilizar dicho trabajo. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar sus frutos principalmente el café, para luego despulparlos y observar la calidad de su producto, que luego los secará para su debida comercialización a los acopiadores, quienes le pagan S/. 8.00 soles por kilo. Para su futuro, planea incrementar su producción de café, renovando sus plantaciones con otra variedad de mejor calidad. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y se muestra entusiasmado de seguir laborando en su grupo comunal, ya que sus compañeros son personas muy alegres y honestas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono, que quiere esparcir sobre sus cultivos para nivelar su producción.
texts.en:
Roberto (40) works - first and foremost - toward the welfare of his family. He lives in his own home with his partner, Mary Luz (26) and their two children. The love he has for the land has pushed Roberto to plant bananas and coffee for the last eight years. Occasionally, Mary Luz helps him, but during clean-up and harvest seasons, he must hire help to get the job done. Roberto greatly enjoys harvesting, especially the coffee. He likes observing the quality of the fruit, which he would eventually dry and then sell to the coffee processors, who will pay him around PEN 8 (US$ 2.75) per kilo. In the future, Roberto would like to increase his coffee production and plant a better coffee variety. This is Roberto's third loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he is excited to continue working with his communal bank and its members, a group of people who are honest and happy. With this loan, he will buy fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Judith Erlinda

texts.es:
Judith Erlinda L. tiene 49 años, su familia la conforman su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos de 20 a 26 años de edad  y vive en el barrio 7 de Abril de la ciudad de  Barranquilla; desde allí se dedica a la comercialización de varios productos alimenticios y no alimenticios como suero, queso, abarcas, mochilas, suéter y ropa interior. Ella proveniente de San Jacinto en el departamento de Bolívar,  desde sus 24 años se vino a Barranquilla y como si quisiera trasladar a esta ciudad  su historia, se trajo en su mente y en su corazón  un poco de su pueblo natal y por eso inició su negocio vendiendo los productos autóctonos de su pueblo: productos no alimenticios bolsos, abarcas y mochilas y alimenticios suero y queso. Hoy después de tanto tiempo recuerda el momento en que llegó de su pueblo buscando nuevos horizontes por eso empezó a trabajar en la  panadería de su tío, pero al casarse se dedicó completamente a su hogar, pero con su capacidad  emprendedora logra desarrollar sus potencialidades mediante su negocio, hasta lo que hoy es y lo que ella proyecta que en un futuros sea.  

Este es el primer crédito que solicita a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el planea continuar conectada a  su ciudad de origen San Jacinto, lugar desde donde comprará  bolsos y mochilas que tiene encargados por los clientes en Barranquilla  y llevará a este mismo pueblo  ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.

Su meta es acceder a varios créditos de la Fundación que le faciliten aumentar sus inventarios para apoyar mucho más los gastos del hogar, así mismo generar mayores utilidades que le permitan ayudar a que su hija termine la universidad  y que su hijo que ya tiene familia construya su hogar de manera  independiente.
texts.en:
Judith Erlinda L. is 49 years old. Her family consists of her husband and three children who are between the ages of 20 and 26. She lives in the April 7th neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. Judith sells various types of food and merchandise such as whey, cheese, sandals, backpacks, sweaters, and undergarments. She is from San Jacinto in the Department of Bolívar, but when she was 24, she moved to Barranquilla because of the city’s history. Thoughts of her hometown remained in her mind and her heart, so she began selling products made by its people such as non-food bags, sandals, backpacks, and foods such as cheese and whey. Even though it has been a long time since she first moved to Barranquilla, Judith still remembers the moment when she arrived in search of new horizons. She began working at uncle’s bakery. After getting married, she became a full-time homemaker but her enterprising spirit pushed her to develop her potential by starting a business. At the moment, Judith intends to keep her business running into the future.

This is the first loan she has requested from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Judith plans to remain connected with her birth city of San Jacinto by purchasing bags and backpacks that are manufactured there and bringing them to her customers in Barranquilla. In addition she will bring back with her clothing for women, men, and children.

Her goal is to obtain several loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to increase her inventory, which will be a great help in paying the household expenses. At the same time, she will be able to generate more income that will allow her daughter to finish university and enable her son to build a home so that his family can live independently.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags, backpacks, and clothing

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi K. is 33 years old. He is a fish monger and a firewood dealer in  Mtwapa. He is  married to Rajab Kikao who supports his income and they have three children. K. has been in this business for the last 10 years and his business is a success.

This marks his first borrowing from  KADET and he plans to add to his stock of fire wood and fish. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. K.’s main clients are the residents of Mtwapa, Mombasa.

In future he wishes to become a wholesale fish monger, dealing in many fish species.

loans.use: to add his stock of firewood and fish

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: La señora Vilma, tiene 41 años por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de tortillas y ropa nueva. Por lo que siempre busca la manera de mejorar sus ingresos,  pues es ella tiene que llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Ella ha enfrentado ciertos problemas como es de salud, a pesar de sus problemas de salud ha salido adelante con el apoyo de su familia. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. El sueño, siempre ha sido tener una tienda grande en donde ofrezca una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Vilma, is 41 years old and she has a business selling tortillas and new clothes. She is always looking for a way of improving her income, as she has to provide for her household on a daily basis. She has faced certain health problems, despite these health probelms she has gotten ahead with the support of her family. She is asking for this financing to purchase raw materials. Her dream, has always been to have a big store where she offers a great variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: La Fortaleza Group

texts.es: Geremias tiene 51 años esta casado y tiene 03 hijos siempre ha sido un padre muy responsable y trabajador  durante mucho tiempo   laboro en el rubro de restaurantes  su trabajo era atención al publico pero siempre estaba atento  para aprender como se preparaban los distintos platos que ofrecían  su meta siempre fue tener su propio negocio de comida a pesar que su familia muchas veces lo desanimo para que no siga  con su proyecto el renuncio a su trabajo y lo hizo realidad  se compro algunos enseres y empezó su negocio, hizo un lugar en la puerta de su casa donde todos los días saca su negocio , tiene mucho éxito con la venta de hamburguesas, pollo Broster,alitas etc. lo que le  diferencia de los demás  es la calidad de productos y la buena atención que ofrece a su clientela, lo que quiere lograr mas adelante es terminar la construcción de su casa  y poner una fuente de soda su préstamo le servirá para surtir su negocio y comprar sus insumos como aceite por galones, hamburguesas, hot dog etc. de esa manera ahorra y sus ganancias mejoran. actualmente es el presidente del grupo “LA FORTALEZA” formado por 12 socios.
texts.en:
Geremias, 51, is married and has three children. He has always been a very responsible father and worker. He has worked in the restaurant sector for a long time and his work has gotten the public's attention as he has always been attentive in learning how to prepare the different dishes that the restaurants offer. His goal has always been to have his own food business even though his family has discouraged him many times to not follow through with this project. He left his job and made his dream a reality by buying some equipment to start his business. He works in his home and every day brings him business. He has had much success with selling hamburgers, chicken wings, etc. What differentiates him from his competitors is the quality of his products and the good service he provides to his customers. What he hopes to accomplish later on is finishing the construction on his house and putting in a soda fountain. His loan will be used to buy products such as oil by the gallon, hamburgers, hot dogs, etc. He hopes to save and increase his profits. Geremias is currently the president of the community bank, La Fortaleza, which includes 12 members.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, hamburgers, hot dogs, etc.

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en:
Batchuluun D. is 53 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province in Mongolia. His oldest daughter lives on her own, his middle daughter is a student and his young son attends a local high school. He and his family have been living at their current home address for the past 28 years. 

He used to operate a public transportation service in his town but, due to his wife's bad health condition, he sold his car that he used in his transportation business in order to cure his wife's disease. He currently works as a bus driver to supplement his family's income. In addition, he purchases machinery spare parts at wholesale prices to sell for profits. 

He used his previous loan profits to pay for his wife's medical treatment. Now he wants to improve his business so he needs to have more funding.  Batchuluun is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase spare parts at wholesale prices from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to resell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 26 años vive con su hija en casa de sus padres, disfrutando de la compañía de ellos. Hace más de 5 años se dedica a la venta de animales, siendo los fines de semana que se dirige a la feria ganadera de su localidad para comercializar el ganado que posee. Sin embargo en los demás días de la semana se dedica a la confección de ropa deportiva, en esta actividad su madre la ayuda en el negocio, siendo la principal diseñadora, por lo que logra siempre cumplir con los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes. María se siente muy satisfecha con las actividades que realiza ya que así puede cubrir las necesidades que tiene en su hogar. Ahora lo que más desea es incrementar su capital de trabajo e intensificarse más en ambos negocios. Es su quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero por ello cumplirá con la cuotas pendientes, por otro lado, le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Ella se siente muy agradecida de aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de cerditos, así como telas para seguir  confeccionando ropa deportiva.
texts.en:
María, 26, lives with her daughter in her parents’ house enjoying their company.  For over 5 years she has sold animals.  It is during the weekends that she heads to the local livestock fairs to sell her cattle.  However, the rest of the week she manufactures sportswear.  Her mother helps her with the latter activity, she’s the main designer, and this insures her always filling her customers’ orders.

María feels very satisfied with the activities she engages in because she’s able to meet household expenses.  What she most wants now is to increase her working capital and become stronger in both businesses.

This is her 5th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and will repay her installments.  On the other hand, she enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.

She thanks all the people who will fund the loan she’s requesting that will be very useful for her business’ progress.

She will use the requested loan to buy piglets as well as fabric to continue making sportswear.

loans.use: To buy piglets.

loans.name: Parque Del Niño (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Parque Del Niño en la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital manabita, conocida desde hace muchos años como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Parque Del Niño. Este es un grupo de señoras que se conocen muy bien ya que este es su quinto ciclo juntas. Ellas se dedican a diferentes actividades tales como, (comercio, ventas, producción y  servicios).

Aquí conversamos con la señora Julissa, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos  de 17 – 16 – 14 y 9 años de edad, los mayores estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su marido es chofer de una volqueta. 

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal y Lebel (productos de belleza y perfumería). Además vende prendas interiores de la marca Leonisa. Trabaja todos los días desde las 15h00 hasta las 19h00, ya que en las mañanas se dedica a atender su  hogar y a sus hijos. La ropa intima es también de catalogo y recibe este producto en una distribuidora en el centro de la ciudad, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que tiene muchos clientes que le realizan sus pedidos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar más mercadería para aumentar sus ventas. En especial los productos de oferta y las prendas íntimas que tienen mucha acogida entre sus clientas. Este es su quinto crédito y le ha gustado por la facilidad para obtener los créditos. Su sueño es tener una boutique o un bazar bien surtido.
texts.en:
The Parque del Niño loan group meets every fortnight in the area known as Parque del Niño in the city of Portoviejo, capital of the Manabi province, which has been known for many years as the City of Royal Tamarindos. The all-female group members know each other very well after five cycles together. They work in different fields (trade, sales, production and services). 

We speak to Julissa, 37, who is married with four children aged 17, 16, 14 and 9. The eldest ones go to secondary school and the youngest girl goes to primary school. Her husband is a truck driver.

She works in trading, selling Yanbal and Lebel beauty products and perfumes. She also sells Leonisa underwear. She works every day from 3pm to 7pm because in the morning she looks after the house and her children. She sells the underwear via catalogue and receives the goods from a distributor in the city centre. She sells on credit and is paid weekly. She says she has a large customer base that places orders with her. 

She is going to use the loan to buy more goods so as to increase sales. Products on special offer and underwear are especially well received by her customers. This is her first loan and she likes the ease of obtaining credit. Her dream is to own a well-stocked shop or store.

loans.use: Buy underwear and cosmetics.

loans.name: Digna Adilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Digna Hernández se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular tiene una pequeñena pulperia, tambien se dedica a la fabricacion de rosquillas.
Digna sigue elaborando rosquillas pero ha bajado en su producción debido a su nuevo negocio ya que anteriormente elaboraba 3 veces por semana y ahora lo hace 2 veces a la semana. 
En su negocio de pulpería se encuentra lo mas necesario para el consumo diario como ser: azúcar, Arroz, espaguetis, salsas, cubitos, etc… y especialmente todo lo relacionado en carnes y lácteos.
Doña Digna esta casada y es madre de cuatro hijos con una bebe de 2 meses de nacido, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería (construcción y reparación de viviendas) 
Digna tomo la decisión de dedicarse al negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de los hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Digna Hernández sells popular consumer products. She has a little grocery store, and she also makes fritters. Digna continues to make fritters, but she has decreased her production because of her new business. In the past, she made them three times a week, and now she makes them twice a week. In her grocery store, she stocks the most necessary items for daily consumer use, such as sugar, rice, pasta, sauces, bouillon cubes, etc., and especially everything related to meat and milk.

Doña Digna is married and is the mother of four children, with a baby two months old. Her husband works as a bricklayer, doing housing construction and repair. Digna decided to work at her business to help her husband with the expenses of their children.

She will use the loan to purchase merchandise to stock her business.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, coffee, milk, bread, crakcers, beans, lard, and oil to stock her store.

loans.name: Villa Primavera Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Villa Primavera, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya están en el 7º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos, que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias en especial.
La Señora Wilma I., trabaja como limpiadora en una casa de familia de la ciudad, además de esta actividad, con su espíritu emprendedor realiza la venta de comidas en los eventos que se realizan en los distintos puntos de la ciudad, y en ferias organizadas por las mismas Señoras en la plaza, o mismo, frente a la oficina de Fundación Paraguaya. 
Manifiestan que gracias a esta oportunidad y forma de trabajo, más las capacitaciones recibidas, han logrado que sus ingresos y el nivel de vida de sus familias mejoren considerablemente.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el pago de unos gastos personales como de alimentación y vestimenta.
texts.en:
This group of women is known as “Villa Primavera” (Spring Village).  The women work together and are united in the program.  They are in their 7th cycle, thanks to their hard work.

Besides running their own businesses, they also work as a group, so that they can raise some funds to have some working capital within the group to mutually support one another in their overall goals, especially that of helping their families financially.

Wilma I. works as a cleaning woman in a private home in town.  Because of her entrepreneurial spirit, she also sells prepared food at the special events in different parts of the city, and at fairs organized by the ladies in the plaza or across from the Fundación Paraguaya office.

They tell us that they have increased their incomes and improved their quality of life for their families substantially; thanks to the new opportunities and training that they have received.  She is asking for this loan for personal expenses, such as food and clothing.

loans.use: Personal expesnses

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old. He is married and has one child. He is the only provider for his family.

Nihad opened his own barber shop after having a long experience in this field. He is well known and has a good reputation in his local area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate his shop. He is planning to grow bigger and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: Renovate his shop

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina P. is from the village of Santa Isabel. She is 50 years old. Angelina is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Angelina owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Angelina has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Angelina is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Angelina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Juana  Ysidora

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MAMA SIMONA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana; ella tiene 53 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de verduras para luego distribuirlos a sus clientes que tiene en el Valle Sagrado (Urubamba,Calca,Ollantaytambo y Chinchero, la socia viaja cada fin de semana o en cada feria que tiene cada provincia, a la vez la socia tiene una empresa de vehículos que brinda servicio público en la ruta Cusco-Curawasi ,siendo su esposo el que administra ese negocio. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más verdura para su negocio y así poder abastecer y distribuir a todos sus clientes 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the "MAMA SIMONA” community bank which is located in Poroy district, in Cusco province and department.

Juana is 53 years old, married, and has 4 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business buying and selling vegetables which she delivers to her customers in Valle Sagrado (Urubamba, Calca, Ollantaytambo and Chinchero).  She travels every weekend or on each province's market day.  She also owns a vehicle company that provides a public service on the Cusco-Curawasi route.  Her husband runs that business.

Juana is requesting this loan to buy more vegetables for her business so that she can stock up and deliver to her customers.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for her business so that she can stock up and make deliveries to all her customers

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina U. is from the village of Poblacion, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Albina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Albina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, detergents & toothpaste in the local community. Albina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Albina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Albina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Albina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Albina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
