Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & snack foods

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with two daughters, aged 11 and 13 years. She runs a teenage clothing sales business at two different markets of Ivano-Frankivsk: Central Marketplace and Novgorodskyi Market. She launched her venture 9 years ago through lending assistance for start-ups. Her monthly income, which is the main source of income for the family, currently amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas.

Ludmila is requesting a loan of 17,500 Grivnyas to increase her assortment of merchandise. She is planning to continue expanding her trade and to open a new vending location in the future. Profits generated will be used to finish construction of her private house, which is still in progress.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Mrs. Bun C. lives in Krang Touch village in Takeo province.  She was born in 1976.  She is a farmer who owns a 6-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family.   Her husband, Mr. Ech Bun, is a construction worker. Through these activities, they support three children --  two  are attending the local public school, and the other is still only 3 years old. 

In the rice field, Mrs. Bun C. has an obstacle because her field has infertile soil.  To improve her rice production, she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.es:
La señora Madeleine es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Edén, del Distrito Yarinacocha, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 42 años de edad y tiene 2 hijow pero solo vive con uno de ellos, está separada de su esposo.
Cuenta con dos motocars, de los cuales recibe a diario una feria (pago por alquiler) por cada motocar, ese mismo dinero es invertido en el mantenimiento de sus vehículos y los gastos de la casa.

Con su nuevo préstamo de s/. 1,700.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 llantas, 2 cámaras, 2 bujías, 2 sistemas de arrastre, 1 intermitente, 4 litros de aceite, ¼ de grasa, cera.
Los vehículos tienen que estar en mantenimiento constante para que no se malogren y puedan trabajar bien,  de esa manera podrá recaudar más dinero.  Quiere seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos para poder comprarse más adelante un nuevo motocar.
texts.en:
Señora Madeleine is a member of the Nuevo Edén (New Eden) Community Bank in Yarinacocha district, Ucayali department. She is 42 years old and has two children, only one of whom lives with her. She is separated from her husband.

Madeleine owns two motocars (motorized rickshaws) which she rents out for a daily fee. This money is then used to maintain the motocars and to cover household expenses.

With this new loan of S/.1,700 soles, Madeleine plans to buy 2 tires, 2 inner tubes, 2 spark plugs, 2 traction systems, an indicator, 4 litres of oil, ¼ litre of grease, and wax polish.

The vehicles have to be kept in good repair so they don’t break down and are in service all the time. Then she will be able to earn more money. Madeleine wishes to continue taking out loans with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos so that in the future she can buy a new motorcar.

loans.use: to buy tires, inner tubes, spark plugs etc.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a single mother with four children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and house rent bills. For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. 

With the 70,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future. Vivian joined Yehu microfinance because of its good reputation in the society.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
Doña Elsa, tiene 52 años de edad, reside en Usulután, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y maicillo, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijas de 20 y 24 años de edad. 
Cultiva la tierra en compañía de su esposo, desde hace 18 años, y en este momento iniciaran los cultivos para lo cual, solicita un préstamo y comprar abonos y demás insumos para la siembra, además de pagar el alquiler del terreno y adquirirá todo lo necesario para el cuido del cultivo.
Su objetivo es mantenerse de estos cultivos, sustentar las necesidades de su familia y continuar año tras año con este trabajo.
texts.en:
Doña Elsa is 52 years old and lives in Usulután with her husband and two daughters, ages 20 and 24.  She grows corn and millet for a living.

With the help of her husband, she has been farming land for 18 years.  They are about to begin the planting season and need a loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies, as well as pay for land rental and crop care products.  

Her goal is to take good care of her crops to provide everything her family needs and to keep on working year after year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies, and pay for land rental

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is currently in the business of selling green vegetables. She is 35 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom go to school. Lucia took out a loan to stock more green vegetables to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Hilder

texts.en:
Hilder, 52, is a mother two children aged 21 and 14. She has been doing poultry farming in Kitale town in Kenya and employs two farmhands, selling her eggs to the local market. 

Hilder has requested a loan of 62,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says she wants to spread her farming risk since poultry diseases have become very rampant leading to great losses. She hopes the income will be enough to cater for the family meals and the children's education. She is focusing on owning a pick-up to help in transportation of her produce as well as do the business by providing transportation to other farmers. 

She notes that transportation costs and poultry diseases are their major threats.

loans.use: to pay for dairy unit construction and to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jose Ramos

texts.es:
José tiene 38  años D. edad, él es casado, con 2 hijos en edad escolar, cuenta con  casa propia ubicada en L. zona rural del distrito D. Mórrope, cuenta con servicios D. agua y luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado D. 200  familias.

José se gana L. vida desD. hace 6 años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en L. parte posterior D. su domicilio, el suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos los alimenta con granos y pastos naturales, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto D. desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan L. zona en donD. vive.
Cuenta con ingresos adicionales producto por actividades relacionadas al jornal en agricultura

José está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 3000 nuevos soles para que pueda invertir en L. compra D. animales para su comercialización y compra D. arroz en verD..  Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización.

José es una persona con muy buenas referencias, sus familiares y amigos lo describen como una persona responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old. He is married and has two school-age children. He has his own home, located in a rural area of the Mórrope district. His small community has water and electricity and is maD. up of about 200 families

José has learned a living since he was 6 years old by raising and selling small animals in corrals in the behind his house. He usually raises cows, pigs, sheep, turkeys and ducks. He feeds them grains and natural grasses. When the animals have reached a good point of development, he offers them for sale to the traders who always visit the area where he lives. José receives additional income from the daily agriculture work he does. 

José is asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of $1100 in order to buy animals to sell and to buy rice seeds. He runs a competent business and also has a big market for his sales.   

José has very good references. His family and friends describe him as a hard-working and responsible person.

loans.use: to purchase animals in order to sell them.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en: Perlita, 56 years old, is married with 8 children, one of whom attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Perlita has operated a cake and pastries business in the Philippines for 10 years. She has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her baking business. In the future, Perlita would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her baking business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 42 years, married, and has four children. She owns a shop in which she sells different kinds of items including matches, soap, sugar, salt, etc. She has been in this business for the past 15 years and she enjoys her work. This business enables her educate and feed her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more items such as sugar, soap, candles, etc. to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to purchase items for her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more eggs for her business.

loans.name: Godeliva

texts.en:
Godeliva, 31, is a Rwandan entrepreneur. She is married to a driver and has three children, aged one to 12, all of whom are in school apart from the youngest.

Since 2003, she has been successfully running a restaurant. She will use this loan to purchase more foodstuffs for her restaurant such as tea, donuts, french fries, meat and other traditional African foods.

With the profits from her restaurant, she hopes to develop herself as a business woman and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 45 años de edad, ella es separada de su esposo, tiene un hijo y vive en la casa de sus padres, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande. Marisol vive en la parte céntrica del distrito y cuenta con los servicios básicos

Marisol cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio  la cual es atendida permanentemente  por ella misma cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona, ella vende básicamente productos de primera necesidad, así como también abarrotes, verduras, carnes y cerveza.

Marisol esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para poder comprar mercadería  como es la compra de abarrotes en cantidad mayor y productos novedosos para sus negocio de esta manera podrá incrementar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos 

Marisol presenta buena voluntad y muchas ganas de salir adelante , de seguir creciendo en su negocio, además las personas que la conocen , la describen como una persona muy trabajadora, responsable  y de buen carácter.
texts.en:
Marisol is 45 years old and separated from her husband. She has a son and lives at the home of her parents, which is located in the District of Tambogrande. Marisol resides in the central part of the district and receives basic services.

She has a store in her home that she manages on a permanent basis. Marisol already has an established customer base in the area. She sells basic necessities, as well as groceries, vegetables, meat, and beer.

Marisol is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that she can buy merchandise, such as groceries in bulk and novelty products, for her business so that she can increase her sales and generate more income.

She has the willingness and desire to move forward and continue growing her business. In addition, the people who know Marisol describe her as a hardworking and responsible person who is of sound character.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is a 50-year-old married man with four children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a milling machine that mills cassava and millet flour and has been in business for 20 years. He faces a problem of limited capital to meet the demands of his customers and his dream is to supply at least 100 bags of flour per month. Solomon needs the loan to buy dry cassava for resale.

loans.use: To buy dry cassava

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 49 years old and married. He is engaged in performing services, particularly in repairing all vehicle tires. He has managed it for fifteen years, and through his patience he was able to set up a small garage to do the services he offers. He has gained a loyal customer base and experience in his field. Aside from the service business, he also raises goats and ducks to gain extra income for his family's needs.

Roberto is requesting a loan amount of Php 20,000 so that he can buy a compressor and a welding machine for his vulcanizing and welding shop business. Through this amount he requested, he will be able to make his work easier. He will be able to do his work more efficiently in less time.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor and a welding machine for his vulcanizing and  welding shop business.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rhoda is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a business buying and selling goats at the market and from home. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her area of operation. Rhoda dreams of expanding her business and establishing a butcher shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase goats for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS FLORES DE YANACONA”; Situado a 10 minutos del mismo poblado de Urubamba, perteneciente al Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Luz Marina; tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 4 hijos de21, 17, 12, 11 años de edad;  La socia se dedica  a la agricultura, la socia tiene sus cultivos de maíz y hortalizas, la socia también siembra cebada, todo lo que ella produce lo lleva a vender,  la socia vende en el mercado de Urubamba verduras, ella lleva  a vender los días sábados y domingos, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de semillas, la socia también requiere contrata un tractos y preparar el terreno para la nueva siembra, la socia invertirá también en la compra de abono para luego ponga al cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas y de abono.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a seguir cumpliendo de manera disciplinada el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Flores de Yanacona” (The Flowers of Yanacona), which is situated 10 minutes away from the village of Urubamba in the Department of Cusco.

She is 38 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children (ages 21, 17, 12, and 11). Luz Marina is a farmer who grows corn and vegetables, as well as barley. She sells everything she produces at the vegetable market in Urubamba on Saturdays and Sundays. Luz Marina wants a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of seeds. She will also rent a tractor so that she can prepare her land for a new planting season. In addition, she will also purchase compost that she will eventually apply on her crops. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds and compost.

Luz Marina appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her monthly payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost.

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié pèer de quatre enfants.Ancien chauffeur de taxi,il a ouvert une cantine de vente de pièces détachéées automobile.En plus, il a acheté un véhicule d'occasion et a recruté un chauffeur pour faire du transport urbain.Avec ces deux activités, il parvient à prendre en charge l'essentiel des besoins de sa famille.Il solicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter un moteur neuf et retaper son taxi.Il ambitionne d'ouvrir d'autres cantines de vente de pièces détachées.
texts.en: The borrower is a married man and the father of four. A former taxi driver, he opened a store to sell spare automobile parts. In addition he bought a used car and hired a driver to provide taxi transportation services in the city. Thanks to these two business activities, he manages to provide for the basic needs of his family. He is requesting a loan of  500000 West African francs in order to buy a new engine and  have his taxi repaired. His goal is to open other stores selling spare parts.

loans.use: to buy a new engine and have his taxi repaired

loans.name: Manuchekhr

texts.ru: Манучехр возраст 21 год, не женат. Манучехр родился в 1990 году 12 октября в семье служащего. В 1997 году он поступил в школу, которую  успешно закончил в 2008 году.  В 2008 году Манучехр поступил в Таджикский  Государственный Университет Коммерции на факультет «финансы и кредит». В настоящее время он учится на третьем курсе. Манучехр очень активный и целеустремленный юноша, участвует во всех молодежных, студенческих мероприятиях, у него  много друзей, среди которых имеет хорошую репутацию. Манучехр  запрашивает займ на сумму 650$ США для  оплаты годового обучения. Он надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Manuchekhr is 21 years old and single.  He was born in October of 1990 into a military family.  He started school in 1997 and successfully graduated from it in 2008.  Manuchekhr was accepted to the finances and credit division of Tajik State Commerce University in 2008.  Currently, he is in his third year of the university.  Manuchekhr is a very active and goal-oriented young man, who participates in all youth, student events and has many friends, among whom he has a good reputation.  Manuchekhr is requesting a loan of $650 to pay for one year of education.  He hopes to receive your support.

loans.use: to pay for university studies

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio is 44 years old and married. He has a 17-year-old child. Florencio is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Florencio also engaged in fishing to augment his income.

Florencio requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and fishing nets. Florencio is hoping to improve his family’s living conditions through his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fishing nets.

loans.name: Neuece

texts.en:
Neuece is a hardworking businesswoman, age 37. She is married and blessed with two children who are in school. 

For the last three years she has been selling clothes to support her family. She has employed two people to help her to manage the business. Neuece has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to add to the stock of clothes for resale. 

In the next five years, she plans to establish a wholesale business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Weyeta Group

texts.en:
Scholastika is the facilitator of the Weyeta group. Scholastika and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Scholastika takes care of one child at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's low prices, to ensure food security for her family, and to educate her child. In the recent 2011 season, Scholastika had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Scholastika was only able to harvest four and a half bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Scholastika and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Scholastika will educate her child and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Weyeta group will each plant maize plots between ½ and one acre of land. 

In the photograph above, Scholastika is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La socia verónica actualmente continua con su negocio y ahora mas que nunca desea invertir en su pequeña tienda en la cual vende todo tipo de golosinas, chocolates, bebidas frias y helados; la socia a trabajado mucho con su pequeño negocio y logro ampliar mas y aumentar productos ahora ella tiene mas clientes y requiere mayor prestamo para implementar us tienda en estas fiestas necesitara aumentar mercadería y continuar con su crecimiento economico. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos como, galletas, chocolates, helados, papas fritas, bocadillos, gaseosas, jugos, panetones, entre otros.
texts.en:
The member, Verónica, currently continues with her business, and now more than ever she wants to invest in her little store where she sells all types of sweets, chocolate, cold drinks, and ice cream.  She has worked a lot with her little business and managed to expand more and increase her products.

Now she has more customers and requires a major loan to set up her store.  In these holidays she will need to increase her merchandise and continue with her financial growth.

She is requesting the loan to buy cookies, chocolate, ice cream, fried potatoes, snacks, sodas, juice, "panetones" [Christmas cakes], and other products.

loans.use: to buy cookies, chocolate, ice cream, fried potatoes, snacks, sodas, juice, panettone, and other products.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is taking another Kiva loan of KES 85,000 to boost her clothes business as she anticipates an increase in demand during the Christmas season. With this loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. The previous loan had a great impact in her business as she realized high profit earnings and was able to provide basic needs to her family.  She thanks Kiva lenders and Yehu for providing her with financial services to improve her business.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Nagham

texts.en:
Nagham ia a 29-year-old married Lebanese woman who lives with her husband and three children, who are in school. Her husband, who has worked on his own as a blacksmith since 1986, is the main income provider in the family. As for Nagham, she works under pressure and doesn’t hesitate to show help whenever the family needs it. 

Nagham has owned a mini market for the past two years and has succeeded at work, especially because she is very welcoming and friendly. She is  requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy supplementary products and to increase her inventory of goods and provisions, in order to grow her business. In the future, she plans to open a fast food snack stand next to her mini market.

loans.use: to buy supplementary products and increase her inventory of goods and provisions.

loans.name: Farida's Group

texts.en:
Farida has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who sells diesel and engine oil. He operates his shop in the market from where he manages his business. With the loan investment, he will buy different brands of engine oils and also diesel in larger quantity which will allow him to sell more and increase his profits.

Farida is a housewife who stays at home and performs her household responsibilities. She is very active and fulfills her responsibilities very well. She has given birth to 2 sons. Her eldest son is married and also operates a diesel selling business while her youngest son is a driver by profession. Farida is hopeful that her husband will make good use of loan and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy engine oil and diesel to sell for profit.

loans.name: Yenny Maribel

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila en Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  Para el Futuro De la Mujer. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yenny, tiene 45 años de edad, está divorciada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad que estudian en escuela. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva cuatro años en el Banco Comunal  y le gusta por la ayuda para poder seguir con su negocio y sacar adelante a su hijo.

Ella para ganar su sustento propio y el de su pequeño hijo se dedica al comercio, hace 8 años junto todos los recursos que tenia arreglo un pequeño local en el cual surtió una pequeña tienda de comestibles para lo cual compro todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, para ofrecer a sus clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Tiene 8 años con su local y nos cuenta que tiene muchos clientes que realizan sus compras diarias en su local.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito y lo va a emplear en surtir aun mas su tienda, va a comprar ciertos artículos de bazar para también vender estos productos, nos cuenta que con los créditos su vida ha mejorado mucho ya que como es separada ella tiene que ver que a su hijo no le falte nada y con su negocio ella lo logra ya que gana lo suficiente para sacar adelante sola a su hijo y sin tener que descuidarlo ya que su negocio está en casa y no tiene que salir para conseguir el dinero. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que a su hijo nunca le falte nada.
texts.en:
In La Pila in the Montecristi canton, the "Para el Futuro De la Mujer " communal bank meets every two weeks. This place is well known in the province and in the country for its rich traditional culture.  Here you can find a great variety of crafts made by the inhabitants, following traditional customs. 

Here we met Yenny. She is 45, divorced and has a ten year-old son who is in school. She lives in her parents' house. She has been in the communal bank for four years, and likes it because it helps her continue with her business and raise her child.

To support herself and her small child, she has a small business. Eight years ago, she put together all the resources she had, and fixed up a small shop  which she stocked as a small grocery store. 

For her store, she bought all types of products, such as rice, sugar, cooking oils, detergents, etc. to sell to her customers. She works everyday from 6:30 am to 9:00pm, and sometimes later. She has had her shop for eight years and tells us that she has a lot of customers who make their daily purchases at her shop.

She is taking out another loan, and is going to use it to stock her store even more. She is going to buy stationery supplies, so that she can also sell these products. 

She tells us that with the loans, her life has improved a lot. As she is separated, she has to see that her child lacks for nothing, and with her business, she is managing to do this. She earns enough to raise her child on her own, and doesn't have to neglect him, since her business is in her home, and she doesn't need to go out to earn money. 

Her goal is to keep moving forward with her business, and for her son to never lack for anything.

loans.use: To buy stationery supplies to sell in her store.

loans.name: Aline

texts.en: Aline aged 27. She is married and has two children between five and eight years old. She owns a boutique which she has been running for the past 15 years. With the loan, she will buy more tomatoes and other items such as soft drinks and rice as well as other items for the boutique.  Aline would like to use the profits from the business to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, soft drinks and and rice to resell.

loans.name: Judithe

texts.en:
Judith aged 37 years. She is married with six children aged between 4 and 17 years. 4 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 20 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to  and to buy a cow. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Adelhelma

texts.en:
Adelhelma, who is in her early 30's and married, has two schooling children. She has been a tailor for eight years now. She works from 8 am to 6:30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Adelhelma's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy sewing equipment and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to repay her loan, to reinvest in her sewing business, to cover household expenses and to pay school fees for her children

She will use this loan to buy sewing products and best materials for making suits and female dresses in the latest style. She dreams of building her own house and expanding her business to the next step.

Adelhelma will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing products and best materials for making suits and ladies' dresses that are in style.

loans.name: Maura Melissa

texts.en:
My name is Maura F., I sell socks, girls' shirts, shirts for adults, blouses, brasieres and hairpins. I have had my business for 3 years, I have numerous customers because I sell in offices and office buildings. My business has given me earnings to support my family and to feed my family. My goal is to expand my inventory in order to increase sales and with the profits, remodel my home and give a quality education to my daughter.

Loan Use: Purchase hairpins, socks, shirts, blouses, brasieres.

Mi nombre es Maura F., me dedico a la venta de calcetines, camisas para niña, camisetas, blusas, brasieres, ganchos para pelo, tengo mi negocio hace 3 años, mis clientes son buenos ya que vendo en oficinas, edificios de trabajo. Mi negocio me genera ingresos para sustentar mi hogar y la alimentacion de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para vender mas y con las ganancias poder remodelar mi casa y darle un buen estudio a mi pequeña hija.

loans.use: Compra de ganchos de pelo, calcetines, camisetas, blusas, brasieres

loans.name: Zemfira

texts.en:
Zemfira was born in 1954 in the Kalbadjar region.  She is married and has 4 children. She saved enough money to set up a business. 
Having borrowed a loan of $400 she bought a calf.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 3 calves. She is optimistic about her future and hopes she can use the extra profits to provide a better living for the children.
Zemfira has run this business for 10 years.

loans.use: To buy 3 calves

loans.name: Huy Vong

texts.en: Huy Vong R. is 33 years old and works in a garment factory earning $2.50/day.  Her husband is a construction worker and earns $10/day.  Together, they have 1 small child.  R. is taking this loan out to buy construction materials for her husband's business.  In the future, they hope to open a shop that sells construction materials so they can raise their standard of living.  They also are confident that it will give them enough income to send their children to university.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Abdul Khalaq

texts.en: Abdul Khalaq lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he lives with all the members of his family. He has 10 years work experience in Iran and he came  from Iran a year ago and started his business In Afghanistan. He is a metal worker and has a metal shop. He wants to expand it so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new machines and extra materials to make a good life for his family.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Channak

texts.en:
Channak married in 1998 and has 2 children. He has been in the farming business for a long time. Since 2002, in his free time from his farm, he works as a barber out of his home. His wife is a garment factory worker in Punhea Leu district.

Channak is asking for a loan from MAXIMA in the amount of US$ 250; he has already repaid a prior loan in a timely fashion. He plans to use part of this loan to add to money he has saved up to buy a motorbike for his wife. He intends to use the rest to repair his rice threshing machine. Chanak feels sure he will able to pay back this loan without any problems.

loans.use: to complete the money he has saved up to buy a motorbike for his wife and also to repair his rice-threshing machine

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein, who is 40 years old, is married and is the father of 3 children.  They live in Baalback, in Bekaa.  He owns a blacksmith shop and fixes everything related to metal.  His clients come from the surrounding neighborhoods and are very pleased with Hussein's work.  Sustainability is what matters to Hussein and in order to keep up on the same level of professionalism he has committed himself to.  He wants to buy more advanced tools for his business. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He heard about the Institution through word of mouth.

loans.use: Buy new tools for his blacksmith shop

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru:
Farida H. was born in 1964. She lives in a village called Karakoyunlu of the Agsu region. She has four children. She has been raising cattle for about ten years now. Since raising cattle is a profitable business in Agsu region, the family decided to expand the business and came to Normicro for help with credit. After receiving the first credit, the family bought several cows. Since Farida's family is rather large, they want to further expand the business and need additional credit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Гасанова Фарида 1964 года рождения.Проживает в село Каракоюнлу. Имеет четверых детей. Около десяти лет занимается скотоводством. Так как в этом регионе скотоводсто прибыльный бизнес, семья решила расширить свой бизнес и поэтому обратилась в Нормикро Ахсуинского филиала .Получив кредит семья купила несколько коров.Поскольку семья у них большая, они хотят расширить свой бизнес они повторно нуждаются в кредите.

loans.use: To increase quantity of animals

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
We find doña Ofelia cleaning her very popular restaurant. She acquired the talent for preparing her delicious stews from her loved mother, who in years past sold her delicious meals in the Tupac Amaru market of the city of Juliaca. When she started her business, the space that she rented to sell her wonderful stews was in very bad condition. However, little by little and after much work, she has been able to improve her place, thus being able to bring more comfort and take better care of her clients.

Doña Ofelia has three children. She wishes to complete the repairs of her house, which after a lot of work, she acquired some time ago. She returns looking for help in the acquisition of a loan to be able to finish her work. “You can make doña Ofelia’s desires a reality, give her your support, she is waiting for you.”

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer. ,p> Encontramos a doña Ofelia, realizando la limpieza de su concurrido restaurante. Ella aprendió y heredó el don de la preparación de sus deliciosos guisos de su querida madre, quien años atrás vendía estos deliciosos potajes en forma ambulatoria en el mercado Túpac Amaru de la ciudad de Juliaca.Cuando inició su negocio, el establecimiento que arrendó para vender sus deliciosos potajes estaba en muy malas condiciones, sin embargo poco a poco y con mucho sacrificio ha logrado mejorar la estructura de su local, brindando así mejor atención y comodidad a sus clientes.El deseo de doña Ofelia, madre de tres niños, es terminar de refaccionar completamente las instalaciones de su casita, que con mucho sacrificio adquirió hace un tiempo atrás.Recurre en busca de tu ayuda para obtener un préstamo con el objetivo de alcanzar sus deseos.“Tu puedes hacer realidad los anhelos de doña Ofelia, apóyala ella espera por ti”

loans.use: Improvement of her small home.

loans.name: Vasyl'

texts.en:
Vasyl’ is divorced with two grown children. He and his family live in Ivano-Frankivsk. Vasyl’ sells slippers and terry-cloth robes in the central city market. He has been in this trade for 3 years. Currently, he has about $4000 in inventory. His monthly income is about $1100.

Vasyl’ would like to receive a loan of $1200 to purchase 150 pairs of slippers, 150 terry-cloth robes and 50 sets of underwear to sell in his kiosk. He would like to invest generated profit in a second vending facility and stock it with inventory. One of his personal goals is to eventually remodel his apartment and improve his living conditions. We believe Vasyl’s focused approach to business and his diligent hard-work will help him repay this loan on time and expand his business as a result.

loans.use: Purchase clothing inventory

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Mrs. Thim S., 51, is a vendor of natural medicines, selling door to door in her village. She normally earns $3 a day.

To increase the family's livelihood, her husband works as a farmer and earns a profit of less than $1 a day.

They have three children. One works collecting recyclable items and resells them to the plant and earns on average around $2 a day. This couple aims to purchase a motorbike to take the recyclable items to the plant. Now the products are transported by bicycle.

This couple hopes to get a loan from Kiva of $600 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: This couple aims to purchase a motorbike to take recyclable items to the plant

loans.name: Iva B Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
For these 6 women of Iva B on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business, maintaining a savings account and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

The women will use their loans to purchase the below items for their taro plantations:

Fiapule M. (43, married, 4 children): weed killing sprayer, pesticides, bush knife, spade and shovel. She also produces bananas and makes fine mats.

Ruta H. (27, married, 3 children): weed killing sprayer, fertilizer, pesticides, bush knife, spade and shovel.

Magalelei O. (43, married, 8 children): fishing boat, flashlight, pesticides, bush knives and a spade. She also sells fish that her husband catches.

Ana G. (59, married, 6 children): weed killing sprayer, pesticides, knife, filing and 2,000 taro roots.

Soloau S. (35, married, 4 children): wire, spade, pesticides and fertilizer. She also raises cattle.

Sesilia L. (55, widowed, 6 children): weed killing sprayer, pesticides, 3 bush knives and a shovel.

loans.use: Purchase weed killing sprayer, pesticides, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 10 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 10 and 15 years old. Fatuma sells clothes. She started in 2003. Every day, she works from 3am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.en:
Gustavo G. is married and has two school-going sons. Gustavo owns two clothing stores in a well-known market in Asunción called “Mercado 4”. The stores are located in a strategic place in the centre of the market. This location attracts many clients. Gustavo dreams of expanding his stores in order to satisfy his clients and to offer a better atmosphere to his employers.

Gustavo wants to repair his house in order to rent out some rooms and thus have another source of income. The money provided by Kiva lenders will be used to purchase construction materials such as cement, lime, sand, stones, bricks and paint so he can make the necessary repairs.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as cement, lime, sand, stones, bricks and paint.

loans.name: Rous

texts.en: Rous S., 48, is a single man, living with his elderly father in the Prey Veng province. He sells ice cream, typically making US$10 each day. He has asked for a loan of US$800 to purchase some farmland to grow rice. Many families in Cambodia have struggled with the rising inflation and are seeking out loans to expand and diversify their sources of income. Rous S. believes that a new rice field will allow him to have two sources of income to support his family. He has seen how profitable rice fields have become in his area and would like the opportunity to increase his daily income and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase farmland to grow rice

loans.name: La Revolucion- Group 1

texts.en:
Jacqueline N. M. is a married mother of three children, ages 8, 10, and 12, who is trying to improve her life for herself and her children through loans from Esperanza. She has been working with loans for about 1½ years now in her business where she runs a small seafood restaurant. Her business specializes in seafood, but when asked what she enjoys eating most she says, “Me gusta toda” (I like everything). She is an avid churchgoer and a firm believer in Christ. In the future, Mrs. N. M. hopes to see her business grow and move forward to provide for herself and her young children.

Mrs. N. M. is a member of a 7 person group, Group 1, which is part of a larger micro-bank called La Revolucion, "The Revolution" in English. In the picture, Mrs. N. M. is in third from the right in the back with a blue shirt on along with members of her group and some others of La Revolucion. Her story is just one of a list of men and women who are improving their quality of life through the help of micro-credit loans of Esperanza. Together, this group has united with a common vision of a better life with faith and hope in their hearts and an unbreakable spirit. The concept of group lending is to have loans paid in a group to reduce the risk of a person defaulting, as others pick up where a person may lag to receive the next loan. Each of the associates in this bank has a similar business such as a restaurant or selling clothing. Thank you for your support and awareness of this issue, and it is your concern and efforts that is able to bring a difference to the lives of people such as Mrs. N. M..

loans.use: This group would like to improve their various businesses, like Jacqueline who would like to improve her restaurant.

loans.name: Waradjan (Grand Lion) Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (4) membres du groupe Waradjan de l’association Benkadi du Bamanankin (quartier des Bambara) sont toutes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent en générale dans des foyers monogamiques dans la sous préfecture de Markala de la région de Ségou (quatrième région économique du Mali).
Lié par des relations de voisinage et de parenté, le groupe Waradjan fait essentiellement le commerce des produits céréaliers, la lingerie et les condiments alimentaires.
Dans le souci d’avoir des ressources financières complémentaires le groupe intégra le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel il vient de bénéficier d’un troisième prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire). Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés sans difficultés.
Le groupe compte acheter, 2 sacs de haricot et une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires (sur place à Markala au marché de Diamarabougou) auprès des forains venant des grandes villes et des villages environnants. En plus les femmes achèteront 25 pièces de pagne fancy à partir de Bamako (capitale de la république de Mali) auprès de grossistes. Les produits sont vendus à domicile, au marché Diamarabougou et dans les foires des villages voisins (Boussin, Seribala et Dougabougou ) à une clientèle généralement féminine.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice de 20.000 FCFA et envisagent acheter une charrette et un âne pour faciliter le transport de leurs marchandises dans les foires.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Waradjan ("Great Lion") of the association Benkadi du Bamanankin (Bambara district) are all married and average 45 years in age and four children. They generally live in monogamous households in the sub-prefecture of Markala in the Ségou region (fourth economic region of Mali). Linked by ties of community and clan, the Waradjan group essentially does commerce in cereal products, lingerie, and condiments. Concerned with acquiring supplementary financial resources, the group joined the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with which they just received a third group loan (solidarity loan). All the preceding loans have been repaid without difficulty. The group intends to buy: 2 sacks of beans and a sizable quantity of condiments (locally in Markala at the Diamarabougou marketplace) from vendors coming from big cities and from the surrounding villages. In addition, the women will buy 25 lengths of Fancy pagnes from Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from wholesalers. The goods are sold out of the home, at the Diamarabougou marketplace, and at the fairs of neighboring villages (Boussin, Seribala and Dougabougou) to a generally female customer base. They each envision realizing a profit of 20,000 francs CFA and envision buying a cart and a donkey to facilitate transporting their merchandise to market.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Fancy pagnes, beans, and condiments

loans.name: Ni Wayan Ganti

texts.id:
Kehidupan keluarga Ni Wayan Ganti dan suaminya sangat sederhana, suaminya yang bekerja sebagai seorang petani terkadang penghasilannya tidak mencukupi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari mereka. Hal ini yang medorong Ni Wayan Ganti sebagai seorang istri untuk membantu suaminya dengan beternak babi. Saat ini  Ni Wayan Ganti memelihara 1 ekor penggemukan dengan waktu pemeliharaan selama 6 bulan. Dalam satu periode pemeliharaan keuntung yang didapat Rp. 300.000,-. Selama menjalankan usahanya Ni Wayan Ganti mengaku sering kekurangan modal untuk membeli pakan dan pengobatan apabila babinya sakit. Melalui program DINARI, Ni Wayan Ganti mendapat pembinaan dan pinjaman modal usaha sebesar Rp. 5.000.000,- yang di pergunakan untuk membeli bibit peggemukan dan pakan untuk mengembangkan usahanya agar bisa meningkatkan penghasilan keluarganya.
Ni Wayan Ganti sangat berharap dengan mendapat pembinaan dari DINARI usahanya bisa lebih berkembang dan keuntungannya juga lebih meningkat dari sebelumnya. Ni Wayan Ganti juga sangat berterimakasih kepeda DINARI yang sudah memberikan kemudahan dengan memberi pinjaman modal usaha  selama 6 bulan yang akan dibayar pada akhir periode pinjaman.
texts.en:
Family life of Ni Wayan Ganti dan husband is simple, her husband works as a farmer, and sometimes his income is not sufficient to pay for their daily expenses. This pushed Ni Wayan Ganti as a wife to help her husband by raising pigs. At this time Ni Wayan Ganti raises 1 fattening piglet for 6 months. In one raising period, she could profit Rp. 300,000,-. (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-10,000.00). During the time of running her business Ni Wayan Ganti admits that often she lack capital to buy feed and medicine, especially if her pig is sick. Through DINARI program, Ni Wayan Ganti obtained development and loan of Rp. 5,000,000,- that was used to buy feedstock and feed to expand her business and increase family income. Ni Wayan Ganti very much hope that from DINARI development, her business could bloom, and profit also increase compared to before. Ni Wayan Ganti is also thankful to DINARI who gave simplicity by giving a loan that will be paid back at the end of the 6 month loan period..

Translated from Indonesian by Gwan Ang, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy piglets (Membeli anak babi)

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther Es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva. Esther es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Esther viaja a diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra quesos, cereales para luego transportarlo a la ciudad de Ayacucho y comercializarlo en los mercados. Además Esther viaja a la ciudad de Andahuaylas en donde compra carbón que luego lo vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho, repartiendo a las pollerias y restaurantes.

Esther necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales. Esther sueña con mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Esther is a member of the Agua Viva Microfinance Institute. Esther is a 34-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 4 children. She travels to different markets in the region to buy cheese and grains, which she then transports the city of Ayacucho to sell in the markets. Esther also travels to the city of Andahuaylas, where she buys charcoal in order to sell it in Ayacucho, distributing it to grilled chicken restaurants and other types of restaurants.

Esther needs a loan of 2,100.00 PEN, which she will invest in purchasing grains. Esther dreams of improving her business and of giving her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains

loans.name: Tweyambe Women's Groupb

texts.en: Eva N. is the leader of Subgroup B in the Tweyambe group. She also has a business of selling used clothes in and around the daily markets in Jinja.  Her range of clothing types include ladies', children's and men’s wear of all kinds, and this diversification has helped her in attracting more customers to her business.  In the photo, Eva is with Harriet K. and Lovinsa D..  They all need loans to boost their businesses just like Eva needs a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for retail.

loans.name: Stalin

texts.es: Stalin tiene 36 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos menores. El viene trabajando como panadero junto a su familia, ya que su pequeño negocio es familiar y se dedica a ello por 5 años, donde comparte junto a sus familiares  momentos de abundancia y escasez, pero lo importante es que le agrada elaborar diversos aperitivos  y riquísimos pasteles, que suele preparar con mucho cuidado  y con mucho gusto. Cave resaltar que gracias a la ausencia de competencia por su zona puede distribuir sus productos a las tiendas y casas, las cuales solicitan los pedidos constantemente. Pero lo difícil es distribuirlos, ya que se gasta en movilidad, y es una inversión adicional. Stalin es puntual en sus pagos, este es su tercer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materia prima en cantidad, como la harina, que es indispensable, pero de alta costo, y ahora por fiestas desea invertir más para ganar más.
texts.en:
Stalin is 36 years old, lives with his wife and their 3 children. He has been working as a baker with his family, as their small business is family run. He has been doing this for 5 years, where he shares with his family moments of abundance and scarcity. What is important is that he is pleased to create diverse appetizers and rich cakes, which he prepares with much care and great pleasure. Due to the lack of competition in their area, he can distribute their products to stores and homes, which are constantly placing orders. However, what is difficult is distributing the products, as money spent on a bus would be an additional investment. Stalin is punctual in his payments. This is his third loan with MFP. With the money requested, he will buy raw materials such as flour (which is essential but high cost) and now for the holidays he wishes to invest more to earn more.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of flour

loans.name: Mrs. Non Sou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank group consists of thirteen people in Prey Sbov village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. Mrs. Non S., a 56-year-old widow with four children,was selected by the members to be village bank president. She is a rice farmer who owns a plot of land. Two of her four children have jobs--one is a cook and the other works for an NGO--and the remaining two work on her farm. Mrs. Non S. now faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed or fertilizer.  She will use her portion of the loan to purchase them, enabling her to cultivate her field.   All the members are shown in the picture, but one is blocked at the back.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Ten members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Maximo Mamerto

texts.es:
Máximo es socio del Banco Comunal Minka que significa Ayuda en quechua.
Máximo es casado, tiene 57 años y 3 hijos, Máximo es panificador, elabora panes típicos llamados chaplas, actividad que realiza junto a su esposa, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado magdalena por las noches.
Máximo necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, azúcar.
Máximo sueña con tener una tienda en su casa e implementar con todas las maquinas necesarias su panadería.
texts.en:
Máximo is a member of the Communal Bank Minka, which means ‘help’ in Quechua. Máximo is married, is 57 years old, and has 3 children. Máximo is a baker, and makes traditional breads called Chaplas, an activity that he carries out with his wife. Their goods are sold in the Magdalena market by night. Maximo needs a loan of 1,600 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of flour and sugar. Maximo dreams of having a store in his home in which he can set up with all the necessary machinery for his bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour and sugar.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia K. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through senior high. Cynthia sells eggs at Pedu near Abura, and has done so for about 12 years now. Her husband is in the telecommunications business. Cynthia uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family’s financial needs. Cynthia will use the loan  as additional capital to enable her to buy more eggs to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cynthia plans to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Cynthia will use the loan  as additional capital to enable her to buy more eggs to increase sales to meet the increase in demand by her costumers.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng  năm nay 30 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương từ năm 2000.  Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi, trồng trọt. Nhờ có thêm nguồn vốn vay của Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư buôn bán thịt lợn. Công việc kinh doanh ngày càng phát triển cho thu nhập đều hàng ngày vì thế kinh tế  gia đình chị Hằng đang ngày càng ổn định hơn.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm thịt lợn về bán.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyen Thi H. is 30 years old. She has joined TYM Fund (Kiva Partner in Vietnam) since 2000. Before joining TYM Fund, her family's main income comes from farming and breeding animals. Mrs. H. uses her loan to invest in buying and selling pork. Her business is doing very well, bringing her a very stable source of income. This time she'd like to borrow 10,000,000 VND (600 USD) to buy more pork.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is forty-five years old and lives in Bourj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Abass has owned a bakery for nine years. He does “saj”and “mankoucheh”. The “saj” is the metal oven where the saj bread is baked. A saj is a traditional Lebanese cooking dome used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections or Mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, the most common toppings being zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. Abass requested a loan of $2000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials like oil, flour, thyme, cheese, coffee, and also a refrigerator. This is the first time that Abass has requested a loan. 
Abass is exceptional in his work because he does it well and his products are known for their good flavor. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had few difficulties because he always wanted to open a bakery. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La Señora Nancy Josefina A. de González de 44 años de edad, es separada, vive en el Barrio Tacumbú de la Ciudad de Asunción, y tiene un hijo mayor de 21 años.

Doña Nancy es Costurera, se dedica hace 2 años a la Confección del Ajuar. Ella lo aprendio en cursos realizados por la Municipalidad de Asunción de Decoración y Bordado de Toallas, Pintura sobre Tela, Fabricación de Lencería Fina para Damas, Confección de Sábanas y Edredones, Pintura sobre telas para Sabanas y Manteles., etc.

Luego de su separación, la Sra. Nancy empezó con esta nueva idea de poner en práctica lo aprendido en los cursos tomados en un principio como aficion. Compró telas y elaboró unas muestras, los llevo a los Ministerios, las Escuelas, y Empresas donde había alguna embarazda. Habló con algunas amigas, y de ese modo emprendido su pequeña empresa en su domicilio.

Asi iban llegando los pedidos de Clienta x Clientas, o modo de reagalo en ocasión de algún Baby Showers.
texts.en:
Nancy Josefina A. de González is 44 years old, separated, and lives in the Tacumbú neighborhood in the city of Asunción; she has one older child who is 21 years old. Nancy is a seamstress, and for the past 2 years has dedicated herself to making household linens. She learned this by taking courses given by the Municipality of Asunción on Decorating and Embroidering Towels, Painting on Fabric, Fabrication of Fine Lingerie for Women, Making Bed Sheets and Comforters, Painting on Fabric for Bed Sheets and Table Cloths, etc. After her separation, Nancy had this new idea of putting into practice what she has learned in the courses that she had taken at first as a hobby. She purchased fabrics and made some samples, which she took to various ministries, schools, and companies where there might be pregnant women. She spoke with some friends, and in that manner launched her small company in her home. Thus the orders began arriving from clients, some of which were meant as gifts for occasions such as baby showers.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To  purchase different materials, such as: fabrics, threads, fittings, large towels, small towels, towels with hoods, and clothing for newborns.

loans.name: Sédé Y. Noellie

texts.fr:
A. Sédé Y. Noellie est née le 31 Décembre 1967 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin; dans le Département du LITTORAL. Noellie est originaire de DANGBO dans le Département de l'OUEME. Noellie est Mariée à MELOME Jean, cuisinier au siège de l'Union Européenne à COTONOU. Noellie est mère de deux (2) filles et deux (2)garçons tous scolarisés. Noellie vit avec sa famille à Gankpodo, un quartier périphérique de la ville de COTONOU. C'est des divers que Noellie vend (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, etc.). Noellie s'approvisionne en ces divers articles à Tokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. C'est le mari de Noellie qui assure les dépenses familiales. Ainsi, Noellie utilise les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. Toutefois, Noellie a besoin de moyens financiers pour amener son activité à un niveau plus élevé afin pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est pourquoi Noellie sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. 


 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
A. Sédé Y. Noellie was born on December 31, 1967 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, in Littoral County. She traces her roots to Dango, in Oueme County. She is married to MELOME Jean, a cook at the office of the European Union in Cotonou. She is the mother of two girls and two boys, all schooled. She lives with her family in Gankpodo, an outlying district of the city of Cotonou.

These are the items that Noellie sells: candy, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, and tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soap for the laundry, dishes, and bath, etc. She gets her supplies of these goods at Tokpa, the grand international market of Benin. Her husband is the one who ensure that family expenses are covered. Thus, Noellie uses the revenues from her business to better it. However, she has need of funding to take her business to a higher level in order to respond better to the demands of her customers. This is why she's requesting a loan from Alidé.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of sugar, soap, canned concentrated milk, canned tomatoes, and pasta

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua A. is thirty-seven years of age and is a married mother of six children – three sons and three daughters. Some of the children are in the senior high school while others are in junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a very busy commercial town called Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Akosua is a trader. She trades in food items such as yams, rice, eggs, oil, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells them on a table top in the market square. Akosua says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children in school to high levels.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol B. is from the village of Danao. She is 33 years old. Mirasol is married. To make a living, Mirasol owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mirasol joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirasol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mirasol from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Yrma Nida

texts.es:
La señora Yrma Nida tiene 71 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Salaverry , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta sexto D. primaria , tiene 5hijos, todos son mayores y no dependen económicamente D. ella.
Yrma  se dedica a la elaboración D. manualidades como bisutería: aretes, cadenas . collares y también a la elaboración D. almohadas.
Con su primer crédito D. 300 soles compro mas materiales como: hilos, telas, alambres, perlas, etc  para que pueda hacer sus manualidades 
Con este crédito D. S/ 1,500 soles, lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra D. mas materiales para sus manualidades.
Yrma  tiene como sueño comprar una vitrina y mostradores para colocarla en la sala D. su casa y exhibir sus productos ya si aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Yrma Nida is 71 years old, and lives in the Salaverry district in the province of Trujillo, in La Libertad department of Peru. The businesswoman studied until the sixth year of primary school, and has 5 children, all of whom are older and do not depend on her economically.

Yrma makes handicrafts such as costume jewelry: earrings, chains, and necklaces. She also makes pillows. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased additional materials such as: thread, fabric, wire, and pearls, to make her handicrafts. She will invest this loan of 1,500 soles in her business, in the purchase of more materials for her handicrafts.

Yrma has a dream to buy a glass showcase and counters to put in a room in her house to exhibit her products and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business, in the purchase of more materials for her handicrafts

loans.name: Alimardon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

  Алимардон Султонов с помощью своей жены Мукаддас, брата Камола и его жены Хуршеды откармливает крупнорогатый скот в домашних условиях. Алимардон ознакомившись с условиями организации, впервые кредитовался  на сумму 1600 сомони. Успешно использовав полученный кредит и примерно его погашая,  он увеличил количество своего скота. 
В данный момент он запрашивает сумму в размере 2000 сомони для откорма скота и переработки молока.
texts.en:
With the help of his wife, Mukaddas, brother, Kamol, and sister-in-law, Hursheda, Alimardon S. raises cattle at home. After familiarizing himself with our organization's conditions, Alimardon obtained his first loan for 1600 somoni. Using that loan successfully and repaying it in a timely manner, he increased the quantity of his livestock. Currently, he is requesting a loan in the sum of 2000 somoni for livestock feeding and milk processing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For livestock feeding and milk processing

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is divorced with a grown son and a daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk where she sells spices, dried mushrooms, seasonings and culinary items in the central food market. She offers a nice selection of these products at affordable and competitive prices. She has been in this trade for twelve years. She owns three vending locations at the same marketplace and, currently, her monthly income is 10,000 Grivnyas.

Nadiya is seeking a loan of 5,500 Grivnyas to purchase assorted spices, sugar powder, instant puddings, etc. She knows market trends really well as she used to work as a market inspector at the same marketplace and gained many useful skills. She is hoping to generate additional funds and make savings to be able to buy her son a separate apartment in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of spices, box mixes and instant puddings

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a 45-year-old father of three who lives and operates his electronics shop in the Mukuru slums of Nairobi. He began his business nine years ago after working in a bar for 12 years. Stanley has applied for a second loan of Ksh. 60,000 after successfully repaying a first loan of Ksh. 30,000. He wants to use the loan to add stock of cables and electrical fittings. He hopes to one day have many branches outside Nairobi and educate his children to the highest level. Stanley describes himself as ambitious, social, friendly and hardworking.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to more than 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Ikuti Group

texts.en:
Antelma is a  member of the Ikuti borrower group in Nzonwe, Mbeya. She is 48 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 33,32,28,20 years old.

Antelma has owned a food business selling eggs for 5 years, she works 10 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Antelma`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more Eggs for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Antelma hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more eggs  for  sale

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
P. generates her daily profit by selling Khmer noodles to her neighbors in the village. She is 34 and is married with three school-aged children.

P.’s husband is a domestic fisherman. Recently, he can't catch as many fish as before because some of his equipment is broken. Thus, P. has decided to seek a loan for her husband to repair his broken equipment, as well as buying additional tools for his fishing.

loans.use: To repair her husband's broken fishing equipment and to buy new equipment

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Susan N. is 25 years old and the leader of her group in Mukono. She is married with two children who are both currently enrolled in primary school. Even though she has only been running her clothing boutique for five months, she already generates from her business 60,000 USH per week. Susan believes her success thus far can be attributed to the excellent level of customer service that she offers to her customers.

Susan would like to use her loan to purchase more clothing for her boutique. Right now she lacks sufficient capital to keep up with high customer demand for her products. She hopes that as her business grows and becomes more profitable she one day will be able to afford building a house for her family.

loans.use: more inventory

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura is the leader of this group. She is thirty-eight years. She has three children. Her eldest son is nineteen and he works as a security guard. Her middle son, who is fifteen, goes to high school. The little daughter is five. 

Ainura and her husband do their best and work hard to support the family. While Ainura’s husband is engaged in farming, Ainura trades in newspapers, magazines and some other minutiae in a small shop. It took Ainura some effort and time until she and her husband were able to save 120$ to purchasing the goods and lease a kiosk.

Nevertheless, their efforts were justified. Ainura’s monthly income is around 325$. She is very enthusiastic about her business, which she started a year ago. Due to her entrepreneurial skills and diligence, she has made permanent customers. Ainura does not want to stop at this. She is full of energy and desires to go forward. She hopes that she will get a loan and be able to purchase soap, detergent, costume jewelry, and women’s underwear. She believes that these selling these goods will attract new customers and increase her turnover. Because winter is approaching, she is preparing to purchase coal and insulate her shop.

Ainura has three partners, Ainura, Dinara and Zalina.

Ainura, age 38, is the mother of five children. Her husband transports goods on his own truck. Ainura farms and sells milk. Ainura decided to apply for this loan to buy fuel for sowing and two tons of coal. 

Dinara, age 29, has three children. Her husband works in police security department. Dinara is a hairdresser. Her monthly income is around 90$. She needs a loan to buy a heater and linoleum for her salon. 

Zalina, age 24, has two children. Her husband looks after the household. Zalina sells women’s underwear. She goes to companies and sells her wares on the spot. She is able to sell more underwear this. She needs a loan to purchase underwear. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy a calf.

loans.use: To buy items for shop so she can insulate her shop and to purchase winter coal

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria D. 37, has been engaged in vegetable vending for almost five years now.  Most of the vegetables that she is vending  come from the farm which is being managed by her husband, Freddie. Their marriage has been  blessed with four children; Jefferson, 15, fourth year high school; Jenard, 11, grade five student; Jamaica, 9, grade four student; and Jema Rose, seven years old, grade two level. The family resides in  the village of Del Corpuz, Cabatuan, Isabela. Gloria usually earns an income of Php350 weekly. She is requesting  a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to Php5,000 for additional capital for her business. Gloria hopes to expand the  business and increase her income.

loans.use: Additional capital for her vegetable vending business

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Z. Antoinette est née vers 1973 à Dangbo dans le département de l’Ouémé au Bénin. Antoinette vit depuis près de 18 ans à Vakon Azohoué non loin de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à NOUNAGNON Alain un soudeur, Antoinette est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Antoinette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari, et supporte avec son mari les charges de la famille. Antoinette n’a pas été à l’école. Pour se prendre en charge, Antoinette vend de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce et du poisson frit) de façon ambulante. C’est au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo que Antoinette s’approvisionne. Antoinette a déjà obtenu de ALIDé, trois crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. C’est pour augmenter son fonds de roulement et accroître son activité que Antoinette sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Z. Antoinette was born in 1973 in Dangbo, in the county of Ouémé in Benin. For the past 18 years, Antoinette has lived in Vakon Azohoué, not far from Porto-Novo, the gorvernment capital of Benin. Antoinette is married to Nounagnon Alain, a welder. She is the mother of four children, all of whom attend school. Antoinette lives with her children and husband. She and her husband take care of the family's expenses. Antoinette did not attend school. In order to take care of the family's needs, Antoinette sells food (rice with sauce and fried fish) throughout town. Antoinette supplies herself in the market of Ouando in Porto-Novo. Antoinette has previously taken three loans with ALIDé, all of which were fully reimbursed. In order to increase the funds for her business and grow her business, Antoinette is requesting a fourth loan with ALIDé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice and sauces (fresh tomatoes, onions, spicy peppers)

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine sells bags of garri (cassava flakes) at wholesale prices to her customers. Garri is an essential commodity in Nigeria and the demands for it are high. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits.

She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Africa, particularly Nigeria.

She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. Maurine is 30 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband is a business man. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell

loans.name: Pastorelas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Pastorela está integrado por cinco mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras. Una de ellas es Milagros L. quien  inicio hace veinte años vendiendo frutas y verduras en la carretera de Tipitapa, municipio de Managua. Actualmente ella por medio de los préstamos ha invertido en otros rubros ofertando carne y hueso.

Rosa Elena Jiménez tiene una pequeña pulpería bien surtida la cual atiende todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Además de ello los fines de semana destaza cerdo y hace sopa de mondongo.
