loans.name: Ismara

texts.es:
Ismara R. is a married woman with two children. Along with her husband she is responsible for her children's education. She started her business selling clothing three years ago with a starting capital of $1500 which she and her husband saved together.

Now Mrs. R. has a location in the central market of Chinandega and she is one of the most efficient sellers and through her dedication and hard work she starts early in the morning and works until dusk. Thanks to her work she has been able to be notably successful in her business.

It is important to mention that Mrs. R. has received 14 loans through CEPRODEL and is a committed worker. She has repaid all of her loans in the time and way agreed. Thanks to these loans she has been able to increase her sales and above all pay for her children's studies. She hopes that one day both of her children will be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Ismara R. es una dama casada y con dos hijos a su cargo el cual junto con su esposo tiene la responsabilidad de velar por su educación. Se dedica a la venta de ropa iniciando este negocio hace tres años con un capital inicial de U$ 1500 obtenido por ahorros de ella y su cónyuge.

Hoy en día la señora R. se encuentra ubicada en un tramo (local) dentro del mercado Central de Chinandega siendo una de las vendedoras mas eficientes ya que por su dedicación y gran esfuerzo inicia su labor desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el anochecer y gracias a esto ha podido superar su negocio de manera notable.

Es de suma necesidad señalar que la señora R. ha obtenido 14 créditos con Ceprodel siendo una fiel trabajadora ya que al tener tres años de recibir estos créditos ha cumplido en tiempo y forma con el pago de estos. Por esta razón es que ha podido notar mejoras en las ventas y sobre todo ha podido pagar los estudios de sus dos infantes que anhela que algún día lleguen a ser hombres profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
Diana, Silvia, and Elma have been members of the community bank “Universo” for a little over one year. In that time they have learned how to improve their health, use their money more effectively, and the importance of saving.

Diana is twenty years old. She buys spices in Ayacucho and then travels around the region and sells them at various local markets. In addition, she is studying economics at the local university.

Silvia is 28 and has two children. She also buys spices in Ayacucho and sells them at various regional markets. She was able to start this business one year ago with her first loan from the community bank. Before that she sold candies, but is able to make a larger profit with her new business.

Elma is 36 and has two teenage children. She buys plastic wares in Ayacucho and then sells them in other markets around the region. She has been running this business for 18 months. In addition, she owns a kiosk where she sells things like magazines and candy.

Diana, Silvia, and Elma need loans of 400, 200, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying spices, and more supplies for their kiosk.

The community bank emphasizes the importance of saving and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Diana, Silvia, and Elma are saving to buy a house, pay for school, and stocking their kiosk. They dream of being an economist, owning a home, developing their business, and seeing their children be successful.

loans.use: Diana, Silvia, and Elma need loans of 400, 200, and 200 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying spices, and more supplies for their kiosk.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.ru:
Guljahon N. lives in Yavan. She is 31 years old, is married and has 2 children. Guljahon has a college education and works as a high school teacher. In addition she raises livestock and owns dairy cows. She uses the milk for her family and for sale to wholesalers. This business allows Guljahon to earn an additional income and to provide markets with fresh milk. She plans to use her loan to buy an addition cow. She will thereby increase milk production and her income. She plans to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Начмиева Гульджахон проживает в городе Яван . Возраст 31 год, замужем имеет 2 детей. Образование высшее, по профессии и работает учителем в средней школе.Кроме того занимается животноводством. Имеет коров для получения молока. Молоко использует для семьи и для продажи. Продает молоко оптовикам. Этот бизнес дает возможность получить дополнительный доход и еще обеспечить рынки свежим молоком.Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы купить еще одну корову. Этим она увеличит объем получаемой продукции, что позволит ей получать дополнительный доход. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Asha's Group

texts.en:
I am Asha M.. I was married 19 years ago and have four children: two boys and two girls. All of them attend school except for my eldest daughter, who works at a beauty salon. My deepest wish is for my children to finish school and prosper in life. My husband creates beautiful dresses for women, which he sells at his ready-made garments store, and I request a loan to enable him to expand the store.

This loan will be shared amongst my group, consisting of: Maya B., who needs a loan for her family’s used items business; Shabana A., who is also borrowing for her ready-made garments trade; Rukhsana Y., who sells cloth, and Najma A.’s son, who has a motorcycle repair workshop.

loans.use: To expand my husband's ready-made garments business

loans.name: Mwanamkasi's Cassanora B Group

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is 33 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages18 and 14 years old. Mwanamkasi sells clothes. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 7am to 4.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Fatuma and Tima, who sell bananas and fish.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis has a project in mind to be able to sell appliances in a stable way. He started his own business a year and a half ago, with the help of one of his brothers, distributing used appliances , principally washing machines and 24 inch televisions, which he fixes and sells at modest prices. He travels to the cities of Lima and Arequipa to sell them but he started to expand his market to other cities such as Nazca and Ica and will soon be able to open a rented space in the city of Lima. Luis follows his dream working hard to fix these appliances, which is the reason for which he is requesting a loan with the goal of investing it in the purchase of a great quantity of parts.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Luis, tiene un proyecto en mente poder vender artefactos de manera estable y emprendió su propio negocio hace un año y medio por medio de uno de sus hermanos que trabaja en una empresa exportadora de artefactos usados, los cuales arregla para luego ofertarlos a módicos precios, principalmente lavadoras y televisores de 24 pulgadas el se va de viaje a las ciudades de Lima y Arequipa para venderlos pero empezó a expandir su mercado a otras ciudades como Nazca e Ica, y próximamente podrá establecerse en un local alquilado en la ciudad de Lima, mientras tanto Luis persigue ese sueño trabajando arduamente en el arreglo a conciencia de estos artefactos y es la razón por la cual ahora solicita un préstamo a fin de invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de repuestos.

loans.use: To buy the parts to continue with the repair of appliances.

loans.name: Teth

texts.en:
Teth N., 24, is a mother of one little child and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She is a garment factory worker and earns around $3.30 each day. Her husband, Seth Visal, has had a business running a motor-taxi since 1999. In one day, he makes $3.50. This couple also takes care of an old father and mother.

To increase their income to help support their extended family, they are requesting a loan to help purchase a small tractor. They will then rent the tractor to other famers.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor for rental.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra has been teaching for 24 years. She is 46 years old, married, her husband is a carpenter and helps with household expenses. She has a son of 9 years of age who is receiving his primary education. Sandra's dream is to be able to finish building her home, and the loan she is looking for is to purchase tiles for her home. Sandra also sells cooked frijoles and popsicles from her home, and in this way is able to earn other income and satisfy the needs of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Sandra desde hace 24 años se dedica a la docencia, tiene 46 años de edad, es casada, su marido es carpintero y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad, quien se encuentra estudiando la educación primaria. El sueño de Doña Sandra es poder terminar de construir su casa de habitación, el préstamo lo está solicitando para la compra de cerámica la cual pondrá en la sala de su vivienda. Doña Sandra también se dedica a la venta de frijoles cocidos y paletas de helado en su casa de habitación, para así poder tener otros ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase tiles for the floor of her home

loans.name: Linda Aracely

texts.es:
Linda started her business in order to obtain a better income, given that her husband's wages are barely enough to pay for utilities. She started 3 years ago with a large mirror and a chair. Afterwards, she bought a highchair in order to give children haircuts. Later, with some financing, she bought what she needed for her beauty salon- a hair dryer, clips, flat iron, thinning scissors, etc. She also started a small shop selling gifts and stuffed animals in her living room, which is the same space she uses for her beauty salon business.

She needs a loan of US $650 to purchase materials for her beauty salon and another sofa. She plans to repay the loan in 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Linda inició el negocio para tener un mejor ingreso, ya que el sueldo de su esposo apenas y les alcanza para pagar los servicios primarios. Comenzó hace 3 años, empezó con un espejo grande y una silla, después compro la periquera para cortar el cabello a niños, después con un financiamiento que obtuvo, compro lo que le hacia falta en su estética como pistola de aire, tenazas, plancha de pelo, tijeras de grafilear, etc., y también inicio en el mismo espacio de la estética, la cual esta instalada en lo que fue la sala de su casa, el negocio de venta de regalos y peluches.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $650 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar material para la estética y otro sillón.

loans.use: Purchase working materials

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.ru:
Сафаровой Гулизор 30 лет и она замужем. После окончания Вуза она захотела открыть свое дело, в котором помогли родители. Она 4 года как занимается торговлей женскими одеждами. Данный момент она арендует лавку на оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе. У нее самые востребованные товары производства Турции.  В ее ассортименте товара можно увидеть махровые и велюровые халаты, хлопчатобумажные и шелковые пижамы и пеньюары, также очень красивые постельные белье и полотенца хорошего качества. Закупает товар у поставщиков из Китая . Для Гулизор качество товара очень важно, может поэтому у нее много постоянных клиентов.  
Гулизор хочет увеличить наименование товара и соответственно увеличить свой товарооборот. С помощью программы Кива она хочет получить займ в сумме 3000 сомони.
texts.en:
Gulizor S. is 30 years old and married. After graduating from university she decided to start her own business in which she got help from her parents. She has been selling women's clothing for four years now. At this time she is renting a space on the Kovron market in the city of Dushanbe. She sells merchandise from Turkey which are in very high demand. Some of the items in her stock include terry and velour robes, cotton and silk pajamas and peignoirs (undergarments), and also very beautiful bedding sets and high quality towels. She buys the items from manufacturers in China. The quality of her merchandise is very important to Gulizor and this is probably why she has so many regular customers.

Gulizor wants to increase the variety of her merchandise and accordingly increase sales and circulation of her inventory. With the help of Kiva she wants to get a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni ($900USD).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy robes

loans.name: Anne Del Carmen

texts.es: La profesora Anne del Carmen, trabaja como docente en el Instituto San Sebastián, de Acoyapa con 23 años de servicio, es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo, como también por sus alumnos, está casada, tiene un hijo de 23 años el cual cursa estudios universitarios. Está solicitando su 5to. crédito el cual utilizará para levantar una pared donde hará una división entre la sala y la cocina. Es una excelente cliente habiendo pagado sus créditos anteriores en las fechas estipuladas en su plan de pago, éstos le han servido para ir mejorando su vivienda y asi poder gozar en su jubilación de una vivienda digna la que siempre soño para ella y su hijo; A pesar de sus 50 años es una profesora dinámica y muy entregada a su labor para formar jóvenes que lleven una base educativa y moral a las universidades.
texts.en:
Teacher Anne del Carmen, works as an instructor at the San Sebastián of Acoyapa Institute, with 23 years of service. She is very well liked by her coworkers, as well as by her students. She is married and has a son of 23 years who studies at the university. She is requesting her 5th loan which she will use to raise a wall where she wants a divider between the living room and the kitchen. She is an excellent client, having paid her previous loans on the dates stipulated in her payment plan. These have served to continue improving her dwelling and in this way to be able to enjoy a worthy home in her retirement; the one that she always dreamed of for her and her son. In spite of her 50 years, she is a dynamic teacher and very devoted to her work of forming young people that bring an educational and moral foundation to the universities.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall between the living room and kitchen in her house.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel O. is a 42-year-old, single man. He lives in Benin City in the Edo State of Nigeria.

To earn a living, he is in the printing business; more specifically, he uses his printer to print designs for his customers. Now, he is requesting a loan in the amount of N70,000 ($600) to purchase a second-hand computer for designing purposes. By doing so, he will be able to reduce his costs because he is currently completing his design jobs elsewhere. In turn, he firmly believes that he will generate an increase in his profits. He thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for design purposes

loans.name: Huerta Ramos

texts.es:
La Señora J. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno. Tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos que aún estudian, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el Valle de Ite, lugar donde siembra ají para luego venderlo, ambos se dedican a ese negocio. 

Con el primer préstamo obtenido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500, compró un chanchito para engorde y luego venderlo para pagar su préstamo. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la compra y venta de ají, el cual compra en Desaguadero y luego lo vende en Moquegua.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 5 cuotas, comprará un quintal de ají.

loans.use: Comprará un quintal de ají.

loans.name: Feagiai

texts.en: Feagiai T., 42, is married with four children. She is starting a taro and vegetable farming business. She sells to the village people two days a week. She is a new member and has received no previous loans with SPBD. Feagiai expects her weekly net cash flow to be 40 Tala (~$12 USD). SPBD loans are Feagiai’s only access to capital because she did not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She would like a loan of $275 to buy fertilizer, spades, and bush knives.

loans.use: To start her vegetable farming business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Río Blanco”, en el sector cuatro, comunidad de Sucano, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; de 36 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, y es madre soltera y posee estudios de secundaria incompleta (cuarto de secundaria).
Trabaja hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos e inicio su negocio de compra y venta de ganado (ovino, vacuno y porcinos), su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles que los invirtió en la compra de mas ganado para poder engordarlo y venderlo.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, monto que destinará a la compra de mas ganado (ovinos, porcinos y vacunos) ya que ella posee pastos cultivados y es mas fácil engordar ganado, su ganado lo vende en pie en la ferias ganaderas de Pilcuyo y en carne en los mercados de Ilave y Puno.  De esta manera contribuirá a mejorar la calidad educativa de sus hijos; asimismo se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of "Las Brisas del Río Blanco" Communal Bank located in sector four of the Sucano community of the Pilcuyo district in El Collao province in the state of Puno. She's 36 years old, has three children, is a single mother and has an incomplete secondary school education (equivalent of the 10th grade). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for three years and started her business buying and selling cattle, sheep and pigs. Her first loan was for 300 soles that she invested in the purchase of more cattle that she could fatten and sell. With this loan of 1,500 soles she will buy cattle, sheep and pigs because she already owns the pasture land and it's easier to raise them. She will sell her animals in the fairs of Pilcuyo and the meat in the markets of Puno. In this way she will contribute to the quality of education of her children. She promises to pay back the loan on time in five monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle, sheep and pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Ahamada's Group

texts.en: Ahamada H. is a member of Akuwa Ekibono group in Jinja. He is a married man with 6 children and he cares for 4 other relatives. Ahamada has been managing his retail shop for 9 years, a shop he created from the profits got from his farming business, and this is now mainly managed by his wife. Apart from building a house for his family, he has also bought another plot of land with the hope of constructing residential houses that will cater for his children’s school fees up to University level. He needs a loan to help with employing labor on his farm to supplement the force employed by his wife, and to buy seedlings. The balance will help to restock his retail shop with more products.

loans.use: Restock his shop, buy seedlings and hire labor for his farm.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary U. sells foodstuffs. She loves this business because she makes a lot of profit. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of $475 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is 38 years old and married with four children. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
Amelia es socia del Banco Comunal La Paz, Amelia vive en la comunidad de Yanama que se ubica a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Amelia es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Amelia se dedica a la venta de golosinas en la puerta del colegio de su comunidad. Además Amelia los días sábados prepara comida, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Amelia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y galletas.
Los sueños de Amelia son tener un negocio grande, surtido y ahorrar lo suficiente para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Amelia is a member of the "La Paz" community bank. Amelia lives in the community of Yanama which is 20 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. Amelia is married; she is 30 years old and has three children. Amelia sells candies at the entryway of her local high school. In addition to this business, Amelia cooks food on Saturdays with her husband's help. Amelia needs a loan of 900 soles to buy soft drinks and cookies. Amelia dreams of having a large store, well-stocked and of saving enough money for her children..

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and cookies

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel O. is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She makes interlocking pavement stones that are used in the fittings of floors. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more materials like bags of cement and granite stones for making more interlocking pavement stones. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials to make pavement stones

loans.name: Nidia Luz

texts.es:
NIDIA LUZ Q. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “DAMAS DEL ORIENTE” vive en la Jr Yarinacocha Nº 201.manantay. Tiene 47 años de edad, 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 de sus hijos están aun estudiando.  Ella y su pareja trabajan juntos.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de artículos de belleza y perfumes, y la venta por catálogos.  El primer préstamo  fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  donde compró una pequeña vitrina para poder mostrarlos, cuenta con clientes fijos y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Hoy, ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio ha mejorado.  Con este  préstamo de S/. 3.000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará perfumes, cosméticos y nuevos productos de belleza.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
NIDIA LUZ Q. S., a member of the Communal Bank “LADIES OF THE EAST," lives at Jr Yarinacocha Nº 201, Manantay. She is 47 years old, and has 5 children, 3 of whom are still in school. She and her partner work together.

She began her business selling beauty products and perfumes, as well as catalog sales. Her first loan was for S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, with which she purchased a small display case to display her products. She relies on regular customers, and her business has continued to grow.

Today, she has moved forward with her family and her business has improved. With this loan of S/. 3.000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will purchase perfumes, cosmetics and new beauty products.

“Manuela Ramos is an NGO that supports many families with small loans that allow the women of this area to start or expand their businesses, and I am happy with this assistance," she said.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perfumes, cosmetics and other beauty products.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. Anibal tiene 36 años y esta casado con la Sra. Rosana Paez.  Ellos tienen 4 hijos, todos en edad escolar.

El Sr. V. es contratista de obra de construccion y esto lo viene realizando desde el año 1996. Este oficio lo aprendio trabajando como jornalero de una empresa constructora.

Este credito lo solicita para comprar materiales para la contruccion de una casa cuyo presupuesto ya fue aceptada por el propietario.

Su objetivo es contar con una camioneta para poder transportar sus equipos y herramientas por que actualmente viene pagando por los servicios de fletes.
texts.en:
Señor Anibal is 36 years of age and married to Señora Rosana Paez. They have four school-age children. Señor V. is a building contractor and he's been doing this since 1996. He learned this trade while working as a day laborer for a construction company. The loan he requests is to buy materials to build a house, the budget for which has now been accepted by the owner. His goal is to obtain a pickup truck so he can transport his equipment and tools because he currently has to pay to hire that.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, lime, bricks, tile, etc.

loans.name: Josefin Manafe

texts.en:
Josefin Manafe - (DNR.M-0692) is a 41 year-old female living in the town of Kaliakah. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Josefin Manafe raises pigs for sale. Josefin Manafe has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 450,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Josefin Manafe joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  Josefin Manafe is requesting a loan from DINARI of 5,000,000 IDR to be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Josefin from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Josefin Manafe - (DNR.M-0692) merupakan 41 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Kaliakah.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 4 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Josefin Manafe memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Josefin Manafe sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 9 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Josefin Manafe menghasilkan sekitar 450,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2008, Josefin Manafe bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Josefin Manafe telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Josefin Manafe berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk meningkatkan/memperluas bisnis peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: La Solucion 3 Group

texts.en:
Evelyn R. approached Esperanza a couple of months ago inquiring about how to receive a loan for her business selling bedspreads, sheets, soap, and other household items. After several meetings explaining the loan terms and putting together a group of five women, she is ready to accept her loan in order to invest in and grow her small business. This is a rare opportunity for someone in her economic status, and she reinforced several times how grateful she was and how she couldn’t wait for her business to grow with this new investment.

Evelyn explained that, with new loan, she would be able to increase her merchandise and also be able to explore new markets for her products. She explained she wants to grow her business in order to hopefully proviD. a better life for her children. She has two boys aged 11 and 3, and she has one daughter aged 15. She speaks very highly of her daughter who is an excellent student who has dreams of attending college and becoming a professional. She explained her boys are typical boys who both love playing baseball.

In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her business through new loans, and her long term dream is to own real estate that she could rent out. She has ambitious goals, but she knows she has to start small in order to fulfill her long term goals.

loans.use: To purchase bedspreads, sheets, soap, and other household items

loans.name: Rotchel

texts.en:
Rotchel R. is from the village of Barangay Poblacion, Iligan City. She is 32 years old. Rotchel is married to Jezer and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rotchel owns & operates a food stall (school canteen). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the school. Rotchel has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In July 2009, Rotchel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rotchel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rotchel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to the supplement income of her family and to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Poblacion, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Laure

texts.fr: A. Laure est née le 23/02/1986 à Lokossa, chef lieu du Département du Mono d'où elle est originaire. Laure est célibataire sans enfant et vit auprès de sa mère à GBEDAGBA un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Laure a démarré son petit commerce, il y a juste un an. Au départ, Laure s'est lancée dans la vente de téléphones mobiles à des employés d'une société de gardiennage : vente à crédit qu'elle récupère à petit coup à la fin de chaque mois.  Aujourd'hui, Laure a associé à la vente de téléphones portables, la vente de tissus. C'est pour renforcer cette dernière activité que Laure sollicite ce premier prêt d’ALIDé dans le but de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s’accroître. Dans un avenir proche, Laure aimerait ouvrir une boutique pour y  exposer ses différents produits (téléphones portables et tissus).
texts.en:
Laure A. was born February 23rd, 1986 in Lokossa, capital of the Mono region. Laure is single and has no children. She lives with her mother in Gbedagba a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Benin Republic. Laure only began her business a year ago. Initially, she sold mobile telephones on credit to a security guard company, and at the end of each month she would collect part of the telephone sale profits.Today, Laure has added the sale of fabrics to her business. She is seeking her first loan from ALIDe so that she might increase her business and meet the growing demand of her clients. In the near future, Laure would like to open a boutique to display her different mobile phones and fabrics.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of six pieces of twelve meter fabric from HITARGET and ten mobile phones.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah J. is from the village of Canubay. She is 27 years old. Leah is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Leah owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Leah has been in business for over nine years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Leah joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leah has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Leah is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 16th loan taken out by Leah from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Mile

texts.en: Mile S. is currently in the business of selling fruits like gavva, ovacado, oranges and many others and is requesting a loan to stock more fruits to sell.  Mile is 28 years old and is Married with a husband that is a soldier. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase fridges for keeping fruits longer BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more fruits to sell

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia D. is from the village of Balanlinao. She is 58 years old. Cresencia is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Cresencia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Cresencia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Cresencia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Cresencia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Otabek

texts.en:
Otabek is a responsible father and loving son. From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Otabek hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.  
 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing the cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Cathérine

texts.fr: F. Cathérine est née en 1971 à Adjohoun dans le Département de l'Ouémé. Cathérine est mariée à DADJA Félix. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés mais, ces enfants ne sont plus à sa charge. La famille vit depuis onze ans à Agbodjèdo à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Cathérine et son mari assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. C'est les produits vivriers(maïs, mil, sorgho, riz, etc.) que Cathérine vend. Cathérine achète ces produits à Kpodji et les vend à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Cathérine a déjà eu trois crédits de ALIDé qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Toujours dans le souci de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle Cathérine sollicite ce quatrième crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Catherine F. was born in 1971 in Adjohoun of the Ouémé region. Catherine is married to Feliz Dadja. The couple have two children, both have been schooled, but they are no longer in their care. For the past eleven years, the family has lived in Agbodjedo, Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Catherine and her husband both contribute to the well-being of their family. Catherine sells food products such as corn, millet, sorghum, rice, etc. Catherine purchases her products in Kpodji and she resells in Dantokpa, the large international market of Benin. Catherine has had three previous loans with Alide (Kiva Field Partner) and she has repaid them all. With them she has been able to improve her business. Always with the goal of meeting client demands, Catherine is requesting a fourth loan from Alide, to supplement her working capital funds.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 100kg sacks of corn.

loans.name: Lovely Ann

texts.en:
Lovely Ann E. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old. Lovely Ann is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Lovely Ann owns and operates a "tricycle" business in the local community. Lovely Ann is just starting this business.

Lovely Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lovely Ann is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lovely Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income for their daily needs. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units, with offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Jenny Jovita

texts.es:
Jenny  M.  es socia del Banco Comunal Picoaza.  Este  banco está conformado por mujeres  de todas las  edades.  Picoaza es un pueblito ubicado a diez  minutos al norte de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí en la región costa de Ecuador, ésta  provincia es  muy  conocida por su gastronomía, las playas y los ceibos (árboles únicos de la región) y ésta localidad no podía ser la excepción pues es un lugar muy comercial, aquí  encontramos muchos  distribuidores de productos agrícolas,  consumo, ropa, etc.

Nuestra socia	es soltera y tiene un niño  de cinco años  de nombre  Steven, su casa es propia y en ella tiene una distribuidora de maquillajes,  perfumes y,  bisutería en general, cuenta  con un buen número de clientes fijos por los productos de buena calidad que distribuye.
 

Jenny  va a usar el credito obtenido para comprar  cremas, maquillajes, bisutería y todo en cosméticos para la época navideña para ofrecer más y mejores productos a sus clientes.  Su sueño es continuar con su negocio para mantener a su familia y para en el futuro mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Jenny M. is a member of the Picoaza communal bank. The bank is made up of women of all ages. Picoaza is a small town located ten minutes north of Portoviejo in the province of Manabí, in the coastal region of Ecuador. This province is well known for its cuisine, beaches and ceibo trees (unique to the region). It is also a commercial center, with many distributors of agricultural products, consumer goods, clothes, etc.

Jenny is single and has a 5-year-old son named Steven. She has her own house from which she operates her business selling makeup, perfumes, and costume jewelry. She has many regular customers because of the high quality of products she sells.

Jenny seeks a loan to purchase creams, makeup, costume jewelry and all types of cosmetics, to be able to offer her clients more and better products for the Christmas season. Her dream is to continue with her business to maintain her family and, in the future, improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase creams, makeup, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Madame Fatou N. est une femme de 52 ans qui habite a Yoff a la cite Apecsy  2.Elle est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis janvier 2007 et a déjà bénéficié  d’un prêt antérieur Elle est mariée  et mère  de 7 enfants dont l’âgé  varie entre 13 et 35 ans C’est  par amour de l’activité  qu’elle s’est adonnée a la vente de petit déjeuner  dans une école  privée  qui se situe non loin de chez elle .Le développement de son activité depuis 2003 lui  permet de prendre  en charge la scolarité  de ses enfants en charge. Par conséquent  elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs dans le but de d’acheter a des prix plus compétitifs  les denrées  qui lui permettent de préparer  son petit déjeuner  et de les stocker.                                                                                                    
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les femmes  a exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou N. is a 52 year old woman who lives in Yoff in the Apecsy 2 city. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC bank since January 2007 and has already received a previous loan. She is married and the mother of seven children between the ages of 13 and 35. It was for the love of business that she took up selling breakfast in a private school located not far from her home. The development of her business since 2003 has allowed her to support the education of the children still under her care. She is therefore seeking a loan of 150,000 frs in order to purchase at more competitive prices the foods that enable her to prepare the breakfasts, as well as to stock the foods.

Always looking to actively participate in the fight against poverty, U-IMCEC - with the positive support of lenders - succeeds in supporting women in revenue-generating activities which promote valuable, socioeconomic development.


Translated from French by Jarred Taylor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase in working capital

loans.name: Liliana Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. Liliana, vive en casa propia, ella al igual de muchas clientes debe de levantarse temprano para llegar a las seis de la mañana al mercado ya que vive en una zona muy alejada de la ciudad de El Alto. es una de las pocas clientes que quedaron de las que se tenian en el Mercado Yungas durante todo el tiempo que ha trabajado con la agenia ha reflejado ser una persona dedicada y responsable no solo con su trabajo sino tambien con su familia, el empeño que le pone a su actividad se refleja en el crecimiento del mismo. La Sra. Liliana invertira el dinero del credito en la refaccion del puesto como ser el pintado de mesas y bancas y el cambio de tazas y jarros que se usan diariamente en el puesto.
texts.en:
Liliana lives in her own house. Like many other Emprender clients, she has to get up early to arrive at the market at 6AM, as she lives in a far neighborhood of El Alto. She is one of the Emprender’s few remaining long-term clients from the Yungas Market.

In all the time she has worked with the agency, she has proved herself to be dedicated and responsible, not only with her work, but also with her family. The determination that she puts into her work is reflected in the growth of her business.

Liliana will use this loan money to refurbish her food stall, including painting the tables and benches, and replacing the cups and jars that are used every day.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish her food stall

loans.name: Yoconda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Fe.
Carmen es casada, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Carmen junto a su esposo tienen una imprenta llamada Multiservicios San José, en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de recordatorios.
Los sueños de Carmen son terminar de construir su casa y aumentar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank "Fe" ["Faith"]. Carmen is married, she is 32 years old and has one son. Carmen and her husband own a printing business called Multiservicios San José ["Multiservices Saint Joseph"], in rented premises located in Ayacucho's city downtown area. Carmen needs a 2,100.00 PEN loan to purchase printed cards given by people to friends and relatives as mementos after baptisms, first communions, weddings and funeral services. Carmen dreams of finishing building her home and increasing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of printed cards

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Mrs. Pat M. and her husband are villagers in Trapeang Khlout village in Takeo province. She is 56 years old. She is a grocer in local village. Mr. Samet Toem, her husband, is a teacher in local school and a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support his family living.  In order to improve condition this family living, Mrs. Pat M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries for re-selling which can gate some profit to support her family. This couple has two children, both of whom help their mother to sell groceries. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for re-selling

loans.name: Norita

texts.en:
Norita is 56 years old and married with three children: two daughters and one son.   She lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines.  Her husband Dante works in the construction business.  To supply additional income for her family, Norita is starting a business selling fried fish.

Norita would like to receive a loan to purchase inventory to launch her business including cardboard boxes as well as fish.  As a new member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Norita is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. 
  
With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her new business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.  Her long-term dreams are to continue supporting her children and grandchildren as well as building a stronger home that can withstand flooding common in her province.

About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase inventory to launch her business

loans.name: Izay

texts.en: Izay I. is a successful father and dedicated husband. Together with his wife he has two kids. Izay began a small grocery store three years ago with a small amount of savings. He is assisted by his wife who helps him serve his clients. Today, his clientele has grown greater and his grocery becomes more popular. He is asking for a loan so that he may expand the variety of goods sold in his store. Izay is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve success in his business through this loan.

loans.use: To expand the variety of good sold in his store.

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Dulce María Hernández Álvarez tiene una pequeña ventecita en su casa de habitación que esta ubicada en el municipio de El viejo. 

Ella va a utilizar el crédito para surtir su  negocio  en la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, etc.
Ella es madre de 3 hijos y vive con ellos y su esposo.
Y hoy en día dice estar agradecida con CEPRODEL, por darle la oportunidad de poder crecer en su negocio así como en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Dulce María Hernández Álvarez has a small store in her home, which is located in the municipality of El Viejo. She will use this loan to restock her business by purchasing rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etc. She is the mother of 3 children and she lives with them and with her husband. Today she says that she is grateful to CEPRODEL for giving her this opportunity to grow her business as well as her personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products to sell such as rice, beans, bread, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Fasilat

texts.en:
Fasilat is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are both doing fine. Her husband is an electrician and they live together in Lagos, Nigeria.
Fasilat owns a shop where she sells groceries and foodstuffs. The shop is at the front of her house and this enables her to open the shop from very early in the morning to late in the evening, every day of the week. The shop serves as her means of livelihood, and she has been in this business for the past four years.
Fasilat is determined and optimistic about the growth of her business and the prosperity of her family. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for this wonderful initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina T. owns and operates a dressmaking business in her community. She has been in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a week. With additional working capital, Josefina’s business will continue to expand and she will be capable of offering satisfactory service to her customers.

In 2006, Josefina joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in entrepreneurial business activities. She and her husband, Armando, have successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI. Josefina requests a loan of 25,000 PHP so that she can support the expansion of her dressmaking business and be able to meet the growing demands of her customers. The loan fund will be used to pay for an additional aging overlock sewing machine. The additional equipment for her business will provide more efficient and better service to her regular and extended customers. 

Having the opportunity of a loan from Kiva through ASHI will provide Josefina a chance to accomplish her goals in life: to build a profitable dressmaking business, send all of her children to college, and invest in her home. She also hopes to see her family soon change their standard of living and get out from beneath the umbrella of poverty.

loans.use: To pay for an additional aging overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Dirisa

texts.en:
M. Dirisa is a hard-working business man of thirty, married with five children. He owns a retail shop located in Bulakati main market, Juma cell, Lukaya town council. His shop mainly deals with essential things like sugar, rice, maize flour, passion fruit and various others. He is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, rice, millet flour, maize flour, passion fruit, etc. for resale so as to expand his business. 

His future hope is to expand his business, accumulate more profits, and use the accumulated profits to further improve his farming and give his children a better education and a better life.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, rice, millet flour, maize flour, etc. for resale

loans.name: Marcelle

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Calavi, K. Marcelle est mariée à LANKPOKINTO Oumbabè, et est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Marcelle s'est installée avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Agongbomey à Cotonou (capitale économique du Bénin), depuis près de quinze ans. Marcelle vient en aide à son mari et supporte avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Marcelle vend depuis environs vingt ans, des détergeants (savons, dentifrices, etc.) à la devanture de sa maison. Marcelle s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Marcelle a déjà obtenu trois crédits de ALIDé, qu'elle a bien remboursés. Dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'accroître sa clientèle et par ricochet son revenu, Marcelle sollicite un autre prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Calavi, Marcelle K. is married to Oumbabè LANKPOKINTO and is the mother of three school-attending children. For 15 years, she's been living with her husband and children in the Agongbomey neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Marcelle helps her husband with the various expenses of the family. To provide for herself, Marcelle has been selling detergents, soaps, toothpaste, etc in front of her house for approximately 20 years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. She already benefited from three loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, that were all repaid without problems. With the goal of bolstering her working capital and increasing her clientele and, as a result, her income, Marcelle is seeking another loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of soaps and toothpaste

loans.name: Mien

texts.en:
Mien H., 26, is a low-income person currently living in Siem Reap Province. To earn a living, she sells vegetables that she grows herself on her own farmland; additionally, she buys fresh fish in bulk to sell retail. Typically, she earns an average of $2 a day as support for her family.

Mien H.’s husband is currently selling firewood that he obtains from the forest. However, he faces the fact that he doesn’t have a cart to transport his firewood from the forest. In order to solve this problem, Mien H. requests a loan to purchase a cart her husband can attach to a horse to use to pick up the wood.

This young couple has been married for years, but they do not have any children.

loans.use: To purchase a cart for her husband's business

loans.name: Rudelina

texts.en:
Rudelina P. is from the village of  Villa Verde, Iligan City. She is 38 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rudelina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Rudelina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rudelina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rudelina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Rudelina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Victor Bacilio

texts.es: Víctor Bacilio es un hombre trabajador, el señor tiene dos trabajos, en la noche trabaja en una maquiladora como  operador y en el día atiende su negocio de venta de abarrotes, el señor requiere de este prestamos para invertir en la compra de mas cosas para la tienda. Y así incrementar sus ventas y ganancias. El señor víctor siempre se ah preocupado por la educación de sus hijos es por eso que el necesita de su apoyo para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor educación y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Víctor Bacilio is a hard-working man. He has two jobs: at night, he works in a factory as a machine operator, and during the day, he runs his own business selling groceries. He needs this loan in order to invest in buying more goods for his store, in order to increase his sales and his earnings. Victor has always been concerned about his children's education, and for this reason he needs your support, so that he can give his children a better education and an improved quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in his business

loans.name: Chimgee

texts.en:
Chimgee T. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and son in Hovd province, western Mongolia. She and her family have been living in their own house for three years. Her son goes to a local kindergarten, while her husband Ganchudur helps with her business.

Chimgee and her husband began their business in 2005 and now they are planning on expanding their business by adding more computers so that they can accommodate more customers. Chimgee is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more computers for the PC game center.

loans.use: To purchase computers for her business.

loans.name: Benkadi 2 (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 2  est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de WARASSO dans l’ex l’arrondissement de Kimparana, du cercle de SAN, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, avec en moyenne 35 ans et au moins 7 enfants.
Elles cultivent  de l’arachide et du maïs. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso cette année. 
KADIA S. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels agricoles et des intrants,  au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 25 000 à 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 2 (entente, or "unity") group consists of married women from the village of Warasso in the in the ex neighborhood of Kimparana in the district of San in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali) They live in traditional families, are on the average 35 years of age and have seven children. They grow peanuts and corn. In order to ensure that their agricultural activities are profitable, earlier this year they have decided to take advantage of the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. Kadia S. plans to use her part of the loan to purchase ample supply of peanut seeds, small tools and agricultural inputs at the big market of Kimparana. After the winter season, the harvest is stocked for a while until it goes up in price before being resold at the big market of Kimparana and at the nearby market, retail (often wholesale too), for cash to a customer base mainly coming from large towns. After this agricultural season, the group members plan to obtain a revenue ranging from 25,000 to 35,000 West African francs each, to be used for repaying the loan interests as well as for the everyday family expenses.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing agricultural inputs, seeds and small tools

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.es:
Este cliente es originario del poblado de telica , actualmente se dedica a la actividad comercial ,  la que ha ejercido por espacio de 10 años, donde ha tenido 9 créditos, con   nuestra empresa para diferentes rubros, prevaleciendo las del rubro vivienda, que  donde están mejorando por lo que se dedican a otra actividad 
El núcleo familiar está compuesta por  3 hijos los que están adultos y son profesionales solo uno está casado, que es varón y están solteros siendo 1 varón y 1 mujer, son una familia bien unida, y se dedican a hacer las actividades en conjuntos incluyendo a su marido quien tiene un taller de  vulcanización en el empalme de ansca.
texts.en:
This individual is originally from the village of Telica and she has been a small business owner for the past 10 years. She has had 9 past loans for varying purposes. She has invested in the improvement of their home, and she would like to invest again in that initiative. Her immediate family is made up of 3 grown children. They all have careers and only one is married. Her other son and her daughter are still single. They are a very close family unit and they participate in everything together. Her husband has a vulcanization shop in the village of Ansca.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to remodel her home.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites T. is from the village of Macanhan, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macanhan, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila L. manages a small rice farm. This is where she has spent her entire life. The income, which she and her husband are able to generate, helps a lot in providing for the daily needs of her family. 

Mila has children and she has dreams for them. She has been working so hard to be able to provide for their needs. For her it’s a big challenge, especially when her kids will ask for something about school. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers. In that way, she will be able to increase her harvest and her income.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 41 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Vellecito del distrito D. TambogranD., una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia D. Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más D. tres horas y media D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno, ella  aprovecha la leche que producen para comercializarla en la zona y también venD. sus animales a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donD. vive. Adicionalmente trabaja junto a su esposo en la agricultura: ambos poseen un pequeño terreno D. cultivo en donD. suelen sembrar limón y mango, los cuales ofrecen en venta a las plantas procesadoras D. la zona. Con los ingresos que perciben D. estas actividades ellos se encargan D. solventar la economía D. su familia.

Rosa desea brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos, asimismo desea invertir en la compra D. alimento balanceado para mejorar la producción D. sus animales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora. Junto a su esposo se esfuerzan diariamente para progresar y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and children in the Vellecito area of the TambogranD. district. It is an agricultural area located in the province of Piura, in the region of the same name. It's a little more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

She raises cattle and uses the milk they produce to sell in the area. She also sells her animals to the merchants who frequent the area where she lives. In addition, she works farming with her husband. They both own a small lot of cropland where they grow lemons and mangos. They sell these to the area processing plants. With he income they receive from these activities she manage the family budget.   

Rosa wants to maintain her crops. She also wants to invest in the purchase of balanced feed to improve her animal's production. For this, she has decided it's best to ask Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles.

Rosa is a hardworking woman who is a fighter. Together with her husband she works hard every day to progress and get her children ahead.

loans.use: To buy balanced feed for her animals and to pay for repair expenses for her mango and lemon crops.

loans.name: To

texts.en: Mr. To V., 35, is a fisherman and single father living in Kompon Tom Province. He was married years ago but divorced. Mr. V. typically spends eight hours a day fishing in and around Tunle Sap River. He catches about 15 kilos of fish per day and sells them in bulk to his customers, who are retail sellers in the market. Currently, Mr. V. is living with his four children, all of whom are single. Three of his children are students and one is a local fish seller. Mr. V. will use his loan to purchase fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Maria Antonieta; tiene 36 años de edad, y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta y compra de ropa y también vende zapatos y zapatillas y las trae de la ciudad de Tacna y de Desaguadero, ella vende en forma independiente y los lleva a lugares como Urubamba y Anta, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender la mercadería. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como zapatos, zapatillas y ropa al por mayor.


La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Mosoc Ruina” Community bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the Cusco province in the district of Cusco.
This member, Mrs. Maria Antonieta, is 36 years old, and single with two children. She splits her daily activities between buying and selling clothes and selling shoes and sandals. She brings her products from the cities of Tacna and Desaguadero. She sells them herself in places like Urubamba and Anta. She would like to have a store from which to sell her merchandise. She is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise such as shoes, sandals and clothes in general.
She is thankful for the loan that she is asking for and she promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: This member is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as shoes, sandals and clothing in general.

loans.name: Por Una Vida Digna Group

texts.es: Un grupo D. mujeres  que con entusiasmo y mucha dedicación sale adelante cada día. Así son las integrantes D. la alcancía comunal Por un Vida Digna conformado por 8 socias, que tiene un solo objetivo, el D. salir adelante sin importar los obstáculos que se les presentan a lo largo D. la vida. Tal es a si el caso D. la señora Ninfa E. D. 51 años D. edad casada y madre D. 3 hijos. Que en busca D. una mejora económica D. su hogar deciD. abrir una bodega en su casa hace más D. 9 años, esta fuente D. ingresos le ha generado muchas satisfacciones como son los estudios D. sus hijos y la implementación D. muebles para su hogar, en conjunto con su esposo a sabido sobresalir y mejorar su estilo D. vida y D. su familia. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en compras D. mercadería para esta campaña naviD.ña. Como la señora Ninfa E. cada integrante D. esta alcancía tiene un historia en particular pero, todas coinciden en un solo objetivo que es el D. salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación, para el bienestar D. sus hogares.
texts.en:
A group of women who with enthusiasm and much dedication, forge ahead every day.  That describes the  8 members of the “Por Una Vida Digna” (For a Life with Dignity) Communal Bank, who have one sole objective – to get ahead no matter the obstacles they face throughout their lives.

That's also the case of Ninfa, who is 51 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. In search of a better life, she decided to open a general store in her house some 9 years ago.  This source of income has generated much satisfaction, as have her children's studies and the acquisition of furniture for her home.  Together with her husband, she has learned how to overcome and to improve her life style and that of her family.

This new loan will be invested in buying merchandise to sell this Christmas season.  Like Ninfa, each member of the bank has a history in particular, but they all coinciD. in one sole objective, which is to get ahead through much effort and dedication, for the wellbeing of their homes.

loans.use: TO BUY MERCHANDISE FOR CHRISTMAS SALES

loans.name: Musaya Musyoki

texts.en:
Musaya is 54 years old and married to Musyoki, who contributes to the family's income. She owns a retail shop where she sells assorted cereals, flour, soaps, and detergent. She has been in this business for about eleven years and earns an income of about 4,400 KES per month.

She has a very good history with Kadet. This is her third loan. She has successfully repaid the previous two loans. With this loan, she intends to buy more inventory such as mung beans, maize, and beans. She hopes to own a wholesale store in the future.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen P. is from the village of Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Karen is married and has an infant. To make a living, Karen owns and operates a motorcycle-transport service. Karen has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Karen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Karen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Karen is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Karen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Naema

texts.en:
Naema is the mother of three sons and an employee of the Ministry of Justice. She is married to Ibrahim, who owns a construction supplies workshop in the city of Ramallah. Naema's husband needs a metal cutting machine, so she came to FATEN and got a $3,000 loan to purchase the needed machine.

Naema is a working mother who wants to help her husband who appears in the photo in the location where he buys metal construction bars.

loans.use: to purchase a metal cutting machine

loans.name: Marn

texts.en: Marn K., 38, is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. K. sells groceries, earning an income of USD 7 per day. Her husband grows rice to sell for an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 63 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 25 years old and has owned his general store for 4 years. He employs 2 people and is open between 6am and 11 pm. His store is relatively new and well-organised.

Jean Damascene will use his loan to purchase more products for his store. He would like to use any profits to start building a house.

loans.use: to purchase more products for his general store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda T. is from the town of Surallah. She is 59 years old. Erlinda is married and has 8 children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice, vegetables and fruits for sale. Erlinda works hard for her chlildren. She said she wants to secure their future.

Erlinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Carlos Fernando

texts.es:
Carlos Fernando S. G. tiene 51 años, es casado vive  con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 9 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, café y naranja. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos de cacao, café y naranja.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno y hacer producir.
