Le gusta hacer deporte, jugar carnaval y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Fernando S. García, 51, is married living with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has two children.

The JUNTOS TRABAJADORES AGRICOLAS (Agricultural Workers Together) communal bank is located in Matilde Esther which is part of Chillanes canton.  It has nine members who are cocoa bean, coffee and orange farmers.

Carlos grows cocoa beans, coffee and oranges.  He buys his supplies in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells at the Chillanes Sunday farmers market.

He is asking for a loan to buy supplies for his cocoa bean, coffee and orange crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  The challenges he faces are infestations, illnesses and weather variations.  His dream is to buy a field and make it productive.

He enjoys sports, playing, Carnival and spending time with the family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for cocoa bean, coffee and orange crops.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a widow with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a firewood business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a coconut selling business, her other source of income. Mwanahamisi faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood and sacks of coconuts for sale. Mwanahamisi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of firewood and sacks of coconuts  for sale.

loans.name: Rosa Yanira

texts.es:
Rosa, resiD. en la ciudad D. San Miguel, se dedica a la venta D. frutas, verduras y ropa, tiene 32 años D. edad, actualmente vive con su hijo.
El negocio D. la fruta y verdura lo venD. en un vehículo, D. lunes a viernes, los fines D. semana los dedica a vender ropa, por las tardes venD. papas fritas, ella es muy trabajadora, su dificultad es no tener lo suficiente para invertir en el negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería, ayudando así a aumentar el negocio, que sus ventas sean mejores y que continúe trabajando por su familia.
Su aspiración es poseer varias rutas D. atención, con otros vehículos llenos D. mercadería.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the city of San Miguel.  Her business is selling fruit, vegetables and clothes.  She is 32 years old and currently lives with her son.

Rosa makes her fruit and vegetable sales from a vehicle, from Monday to Friday.  On weekends, she sells clothes.  In the afternoons, she sells French fries.  Rosa is very hard working.  Her difficulty is that she doesn't have enough money to invest in her business.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan with which she can buy merchandise.  This will help her to increase her business, will improve her sales and will allow her to keep working for her family.

Rosa's aspiration is to work several routes with other vehicles full of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Ema

texts.en: Ema is currently in the business of selling sweet potatoes. She is 23 years old and married with two children, neither of whom goes to school. Ema borrowed a loan to stock more sweet potatoes to sell. She hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She is living with her parents and three siblings. In 2008, she started running her own business working as a hairdresser receiving clients at her house. She has worked in this domain for five years.

She is well known in her town. From time to time, and especially on occasions, this young woman receives lots of customers so she gets help from a part-time employee in order to satisfy all of them. Her work is very important because she helps her father with the family expenses. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new hairdressing tools and beauty products. At this period and until the end of the summer season, she will have lots of events, especially weddings, so she needs to be prepared. In the future, she hopes to open a formA. beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase new hairdressing tools and beauty products

loans.name: Epifanio

texts.en:
Epifanio is from the village of Mabuhay, Valencia City, Bukidnon. He is 55 years old. Epifanio is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Epifanio owns & operates a business raising egg-laying quails. Epifanio has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Epifanio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Epifanio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase quails to raise for selling their eggs in the future. Epifanio is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase quail feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Epifanio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase quail feed & other supplies

loans.name: Mary Wambui

texts.en:
Mary Wambui is 65 years old and married to Josheph, a farmer who contributes to the family income. She has been rearing rabbits for 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000.

This is Mary Wambui's second loan from KADET LTD, having repaid the previous one successfully. She wants this loan to expand her rabbit pen and to buy more rabbit feed. She hopes to settle in rabbit keeping and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy rabbit feed and expand the rabbit pen.

loans.name: Garcelis William

texts.es:
Garcelis tiene  31 años de edad, ella vive con su esposa y con sus 2 hijos, el cuenta con casa propia, la cual está ubicada en una zona rural en un caserío Pedregal Bajo en el distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de Piura.

Garcelis se dedica a la venta de pescado la cual la realiza todos los días recorriendo en la zona donde vive donde tiene clientela conocida,  además vende en su domicilio, ya que para este negocio cuenta con varios años de experiencia. Su esposa lo ayuda criando y vendiendo aves de corral .ambos se apoyan para seguir adelante existe una buena relación familiar, para seguir creciendo en su negocio

Garcelis está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para que pueda comprar pescado y de esta manera pueda atender a sus cliente y así logra incrementar los ventas lo cual le permitirá mejores ingresos para su hogar.

Garcelis es una persona tranquila y bastante entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Garcelis is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and children. He has his own house. It is located in a rural area called Pedregal Bajo, in the Tambogrande district located in the Piura department. 

Garcelis sells fish which he gets every day in the area around where he lives. He has a regular customers and he sells his products from his home. He now has had several years of experience with his business. His wife helps to raise and sell poultry. They support each other in order to make progress. They have a good relationship and they can continue growing their business. 

Garcelis is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 Nuevos Soles to buy fish. This way he can serve his customers and increase his sales and earn a better income for his home. 

Garcelis is a calm person and he is quite dedicated to his family. The people who know him consider him to be an entrepreneurial person who wants to move forward.

loans.use: buy fish in large quantities in order to increase his profit margin

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор проживает в Хамадонинском районе. Возраст 30 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. У неё среднее образование. Более пяти лет Гулбахор занимается торговлей овощей на центральном рынке района. Кредит берет для покупки овощей. Она хочет расширить ассортиментов своего товара.
texts.en: Gulbahor lives in Hamadoni.  She is 30 years old, married, and has four children. She has a secondary education. For more than five years, Gulbahor has traded in vegetables in the region's central market. She is taking out a loan to buy vegetables. She wants to offer a greater variety of goods.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a boutique business selling handbags and shoes. She faces the major challenges of seasonality, especially during the rainy season, and the high cost of transportation. She dreams of establishing a beauty salon in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of handbags and shoes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of hand bags and shoes to sell

loans.name: Armando Rigoberto

texts.es:
Armando Rigoberto  tiene 30 años de edad, es casado, vive con su esposa y su hijo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	JESUS NOS AMA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Los Amarillos, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul.

Armando  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol Gandul. Compra sus productos en Agroquímicos Briones y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.
 
Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos.   El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos como cinta roja en el maíz. Su sueño es comprarse una finca. 

Le gusta estudiar y hacer deporte.
texts.en: Armando Rigoberto is 30, married, and lives with his wife and son in Ventanas, Ríos Province.  He works in agriculture and grows corn, rice and gandul beans.  He buys products from Agroquímicos Briones and sells them on the local wholesale market.  The local communal lender is called "Jesus Nos Ama," in Recinto Los Amarillos, Ventanas, and many members are farmers, growing cash crops such as corn, rice and beans.  Armando  seeks this credit in order to plant corn and to buy needed fertilizer, which will help him increase production and profits. His farm is challenged by crop diseases such as corn rust among others. Armando enjoys sports and studying, and dreams one day of buying his own property.

loans.use: to plant corn and buy crop fertilizer

loans.name: Cruz Mariana

texts.es:
Cruz de 36 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en edad escolar en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Desde algunos años Cruz se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra al por mayor y menor (material recliclable), actividad que actualmente se a incrementado por su rentabilidad, durante todo el día trata de recolectar lo necesario para clasificarlo y luego venderlo, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá cubrir sus obligaciones familiares.

Para poder seguir realizando la misma actividad ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para seguir comprando chatarra y realizar algunos arreglos en casa.  Cruz es una persona responsable y trabajadora que lo único que desea es que su familia se supere y salga adelante, en especial su hijo.
texts.en:
Cruz is 36 years old. She lives with her husband and school aged son in her own house. It only has electricity and is located in the district of Olmos, which belongs to the department of Lambayeque. This area is characterized by its farming and cattle activity.  

For some years Cruz has bought and sold scrap metal (recyclable material)  wholesale and retail. She has increased the activity now due to its profitability. All day long, she tries to collect what she needs to classify it and then sell it. With the income she earns, she will be able to cover her family's obligations.  

In order to keep doing the same activity, she has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. With it, she will be able to continue buying scrap metal and make some repairs on her house. Cruz is a responsible and hardworking person and the only thing she wants is for his family to get ahead, especially her son.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal for her business.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida lives in Uganda. She is single and has five children, all of whom are in school. Hamida has a restaurant. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Hamida sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. 

Hamida has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, sweet beef and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Hamida include seasonality and the increasing prices of foodstuffs.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow bigger to a fully stocked restaurant and to educate her children up to university. Hamida lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Halima dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN D. YUNCAYPATA”; este banco muy simpático está ubicado a 30 minutos D. la Ciudad del Cusco en el poblado llamado Yuncaypata, este es un típico pueblito en el que se conserva toda la herencia andina pura, y viven todos en comunidad apoyándose en la época D. siembra y cosecha, cuidando a sus hijos y a sus animales, es un pueblo muy bonito y es quechua hablante, está en el departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Epifania; la socia tiene 45 años D. edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. 23, 22, 20, 19 años D. edad;  la socia trabaja en agricultura  y también tiene animales menores, la socia tiene cuyes, pollos, gallinas, chanchos, ovejas, y la socia viaja a Urubamba a 1 hora y 30 desD. su comunidad llevando verduras en especial asnapa que es un grupo D. especias frescas en las cuales contiene, perejil, culantro, asnapa, orégano y estas hierbas dan un riquísimo sabor a los diversos platos a la hora D. cocina, la socia también venD. la otra parte al por mayor en la ciudad D. Cusco en otro mercado granD.. La socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. semillas para la nueva etapa D. sembrío, la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, pagar el tractoreo, y abonar.
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente como lo ha ido haciendo con sus anteriores créditos.
texts.en: Epifania belongs to the "Virgen Del Carmen D. Yuncaypata" community bank located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco in a village called Yuncaypata. This typical village maintains its pure Andean heritage, and the entire community supports each other during the planting and harvest seasons, caring for children and animals. It's a very beautiful place where Quechua is spoken, and it's located in the department of Cusco. Epifania is 45, married and has four children, ages 23, 22, 20 and 19. She works in agriculture and also raises small animals like guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and sheep. She travels an hour and a half to Urubamba carrying her vegetable products, especially fresh spices like parsley, cilantro, oregano and other herbs that add rich flavors to food. She sells the other half of her products wholesale in the city of Cusco in another big marketplace. Epifania is requesting the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for the new planting season, and to pay for a tractor. She feels grateful and values loans from this medium, and she promises to be as disciplined with her payments as she has been with her past loans.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for the new planting season, and to pay for a tractor.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
LA SRA  Katiuska de 30 años de edad, conviniente, tiene dos hijos menores de edad en etapa escolar. Ella es una mujer luchadora por salir adelante  con su familia, actualmente se dedica a la  confección y venta de peluches artesanos, estos productos los vende a sus amistades, vecinos  que los vende un buen precio ya que son elaborados con materiales de calidad.
Solicita este préstamo para poder incrementar su negocio y así poder brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida .Desearía para el futuro poder tener un local  en el centro de  Huancayo .Kattyusca en la foto  tiene cargada a su menor hijo, viste una chompa color marrón y verde, buzo color plomo, Kattyusca se encuentra ubicada a lado derecho de la socia que viste una chompa color rosado
texts.en:
Katiuska is 30 years old, lives with her partner, and has two school-age children who are still dependent on her.  She is a tenacious woman who works to get her family ahead in life.  Her current business is hand-making and selling cuddly toys.  She sells these products to her friends and neighbors.  She sells them for a good price because they are made with good-quality materials.

Katiuska is requesting this loan so that she can increase her business and thereby provide her children with a better quality of life.  In the future, she would like to be able to own business premises in the center of Huancayo.  In the photo, Katiuska is holding her youngest son, wearing a brown and green sweater and gray tracksuit.  She is to the left of the member who is wearing a pink-colored sweater.

loans.use: to stock her business

loans.name: Reema

texts.en:
Reema is a 43-year-old woman from Baqa'a, Jordan, who is a mother of four. 

Reema has a home-based project in which she makes henna "a kind of traditional paint used to make tattoos on hands and the body, used the most at wedding parties, especially for the bride" in addition to sewing wedding gowns. 

Reemah is requesting a loan of 600 Jordanian Dinar (JOD) to purchase more materials for her project, such as henna ingredients and some cloth for the gowns. 

Reema is looking to increase her family's living standard so that she can finance the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for her project such as henna ingredients and some cloth for gowns

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилджон умный и ответственный человек. Он женат и любящий отец троих детей. Он занимается услугами маршрутного такси более трех лет и имеет хорошего опыта в данном бизнесе. Комилджон также занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, а также скотоводством. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свою прибыль. Комилджон хотел бы получит займ в размере 2500$ США. Часть займа он хочет использовать для ремонта своего автомобиля, а другую часть для покупки крупного рогатого скота, а также корм для них.
texts.en: Komiljon is a smart and responsible person.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  He has been involved in providing a taxi service along a specific route for over three years and has a good experience in this business.  Komiljon is also involved in growing agricultural crops and animal husbandry.  He wants to expand his business and maximize his profit.  Komiljon wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2500.  He wants to use a portion of the loan to make repairs to his car, and the other portion to buy cattle and fodder for it.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car, buy livestock and fodder for it

loans.name: Maryam's Group

texts.en:
Maryam is a 43-year-old widow. Her husband died a few years ago leaving her alone with 2 children. Maryam never lost hope and worked very hard to raise her children. Due to poor financial conditions, she couldn’t educate her youngest son. Only her eldest son is able to continue his studies and studying in 12th standard. Her nephew also lives with her and operates a Punjabi food restaurant through which he sells a variety of food to his customers. 

Maryam is a seamstress, sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete orders on time and earn more profit.  

She is confident that after the loan investment, she will be able to increase her income and provide better living facilities to her family.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for expansion of her sewing business.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El Señor Hugo, es una persona de 30 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, y no cuenta con dependientes económicos a cargo. La actividad económica del cliente es netamente la producción agrícola y los principales productos que cultiva y comercializa son la papa, trigo, cebada y maíz grano; la siembra de estos cultivos los realiza aproximadamente en una superficie cultivable de 2.5 Has. en sus propias parcelas y en compañía (es decir en terrenos de otra persona la misma dispone el terreno y los clientes la mano de obra, parte insumos agrícolas y al final se dividen en partes iguales el rendimiento), que se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Churo Bajo del municipio de Tíraque que esta distante a unos 65 Km. desde la ciudad de Cochabamba. El señor Hugo manifiesta ser una persona trabajadora y responsable que quiere superarse e incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de abono de gallinaza (abono organico) y semilla de papa y de tal forma poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Hugo is 30 years old, single, and completed his primary school education.  He does not have any financial dependents.  His business activity is in the agricultural sector and the main crops that he grows and sells are potatoes, wheat, barley, and corn.  The crops are grown on approximately 2.5 hectares of land that either he owns or belongs to someone else.  (On the land that does not belong to him, the labor is already provided.  Hugo covers part of the farming supplies and then splits the harvest equally with the other party.)  The land is situated in the community of Churo Bajo in the town of Tiraque, which is approximately 65 km from the city of Cochabamba.  

Sr. Hugo says that he is a hardworking and responsible person who wants to succeed and increase his crop production.  In order to achieve this result, he needs to request capital for investment so that he can buy chicken manure (organic fertilizer) and potato seedlings, which will help him improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and potato seedlings.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

Imelda has been in this business for 15 years.

Imelda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замирахон замужем и у нее трое детей. Муж занимается разным бизнесом и одновременно работает в рыболовном хозяйстве.Он содержит семью, а Замирахон занимается торговлей детской одеждой. Это приносит дополнительный доход, который она тратит на своих детей. Она начала свой биснес в 2003 году. С нашей организацией сотрудничает более 6-ти лет. Первая сумма кредита составляла 300 сомони и с каждым разом расширяя свой бизнес у нее увеличивалась и сумма кредита. Последняя сумма кредита составляло 1000 сомони. На эту сумму она планирует закупить зимний ассортимент.
texts.en: Zamirahon is married and has three children.  Her husband is involved in various type of business and works in the fishing sector at the same time.  He support the family, and Zamirahon is involved in sales of children's clothing.  This brings in an additional income, which she spends on her children.  She started her business in 2003.  Zamirahon has been working with our organization for over six years.  Her first loan was 300 somoni, and as her business grew with every loan, so did the loan amount.  Her last loan was 1000 somoni.  She plans to use this loan to purchase a winter selection of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase a winter selection of merchandise

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en:
Khamis is a 50-year-old dairy farmer in the Mariakani area. He is a married father of four children who has been doing this business for the last ten years and he is doing great. 

He was introduced to KADET and this marks his second borrowing to finance his business. He plans to purchase feed for his cattle and use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

He hopes to lead a good, settled life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is 29 years old and a businesswoman.  She is married to Cornelius, and they are blessed with two children. She has been farming vegetables and fruit for three years with a monthly income of KES 10,000 that she uses to support her family.

She is applying for a second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Milkah will use the loan to grow more green vegetables and fruit for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a bigger piece of land and open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables and fruits for her business

loans.name: Juner

texts.en:
Juner is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has one child.
 
Juner provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for eight years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Juner is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Juner hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 61 years old and lives in Bintana Tangub City. Rosalina is married with 3 children. 

Rosalina has a shop that sells different types of products. Rosalina has had this business for 5 years years. Rosalina has requested a loan to have additional capital.

Rosalina has been a member of PMPC for 8 months.  In the future, Rosalina hopes to have a groceries.

loans.use: to have additional capital for her shop.

loans.name: Zelma

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Zelma from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with three children between the ages of 4 and 15 years. Two of her children are currently attending school. 

Zelma runs a general store business; she sells soft drinks, mayonnaise, biscuits, and sweets. She has been running this business for 15 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day. Zelma says that at present her business is doing well.

Zelma has requested a loan in order to purchase soft drinks, mayonnaise, biscuits, and sweets for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her childrens' school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, mayonnaise, biscuits, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Cris Katherin

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS EMPRENDEDORES, la socia Cris tiene 25 años de edad y es soltera ,la socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando en una empresa privada,la socia trabaja durante el dia en su trabajo, la socia suele viajar cada cierto tiempo en sus vacaciones a diferentes ciudades del pais lo cual le divierte mucho,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicandose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante,la socia es ingeniera de profesion.

La socia solicito el credito para sus ahorros y una laptop.


La socia se siente agradecida por el  crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Cris is 25 years old, single and a member of the community bank Los Emprendedores. She is an engineer by training. She balances her daily activities with working for a private company. Cris says she has been doing this work for a while, and she thinks she does well because of the effort she puts into the business every day. She would like to continue working to get ahead. 

Cris is requesting this loan to []. She says she is grateful for the loan, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: para sus ahorros y una laptop.

loans.name: Vivogbe Group

texts.fr: VIVOGBE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la cinquième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Judith (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 27 ans. Judith est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de Xavier. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Judith vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Judith vend des produits cosmétiques, du maïs et de la farine de manioc (gari) à son domicile depuis huit ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Judith s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Judith sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe VIVOGBE, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques, du maïs et gari.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more machines

loans.name: Alida

texts.en:
Alida is 33 years old, an IDP Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, settled in the Absheron region. She is married and has 3 children.

Alida has a small store where she sells agricultural produce.  She has had this business for 2 years. 
In the beginning of her business she borrowed $400 and bought agricultural produce.
The second loan of $800 she spent to start sale of industry goods in additions to agricultural produce.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to repair her shop and to buy additional equipment.

She is optimistic that her business will succeed as she will be able to supply different types of customers daily.

loans.use: To repair her shop and to buy additional equipment

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge is a public service transporter (taxi driver). He is unmarried, and lives with his three daughters, ages 19, 18, and 7 years. The oldest suffers from a mental illness and for that reason cannot participate in any educational institution. The family lives in the home of Jorge's parents in the Alto Tejar neighborhood of the city of La Paz. The income generated by the taxi permits him to support the family.

The destination of this credit will be the repair (repainting and plating) of his vehicle, which is the tool of his trade and which permits him to work in the whole city of La Paz and El Alto.

This is Jorge's third credit. His good record with our organization allows him to request another loan, which will enable him to keep the tool of his trade in good working condition.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old and works as a mechanic in the north of Kirkuk. He wants to borrow $1000 from AL-Aman to develop his garage and hire three unemployed people and purchase new equipment. He is working to earn more money to develop himself and his family. He is expecting his first child in the next month and therefore wants to prepare for him.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new equipment

loans.name: Cristian David

texts.en:
Cristian is a 20-year old young entrepreneur. He married a year ago and started his own business selling ice cream and snacks to cover living expenses. He used to work for a similar company and has used that experience, along with his good service and high quality products, to quickly expand his business. His desire to provide for his family motivates him to work hard each day.

He is requesting a loan of $200, to be repaid over 4 months, to buy additional merchandise for his business. Your support will be instrumental in helping Cristian's business expand.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristian tiene 20 años, es un joven emprendedor, hace un año se casó y para cubrir todos los gastos de su hogar inició su propio negocio con la venta de helados y snack, anteriormente laboraba en una empresa similar y ahí adquirió la experiencia que le ha permitido crecer rápidamente, ofreciendo un muy buen servicio y productos de excelente calidad. El deseo de contar con un patrimonio para sus futuros hijos, lo motiva a esforzarse más cada día.

Para surtir mejor su negocio y cubrir las demandas de sus clientes Cristian está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares, mismos que se compromete a regresar en 4 meses. Tú puedes ser parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y mejorar la vida de esta familia, decídete y apoya a Cristian.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Luci

texts.en: Luci E. is a 24-year-old mother of one, with a number of other family dependents. She is a resident of Dar es Salaam and an up-and-coming businesswoman. Luci works indefatigably to look after her family  and currently runs a charcoal business that has been growing steadily. She would like to expand her business to sell other goods and would like a loan of $300 to achieve this goal.

loans.use: To expand her charcoal business and begin selling other goods

loans.name: Candina

texts.es:
Señora Candina is 41 years old and she lives in the Sector América of Moche in Trujillo, La Libertad. She only went to school for a year and does not know how to read or write; she provides for her 4 children. Señora Candina raises pigs and hogs and knits shawls, bags, etc. and sells them in the mountain part of Huamachuco. She from that part of the Sierra de La Libertad, but several years ago her children took her to live near the coast since she was having problems with her husband. One of her neighbors asked her to join the Mientras Tanto Group "San Borja." She joined but was wary at first. However, she is very grateful now and recognizes that the loans she has received have really helped improve her business. Her first loan was for S/.100.00 (about $34) and she used it to by yarn for making shawls. With the most recent loan from Manuela Ramos, S/.100.00 (roughly $201) with a four month pay period, she bought skeins of wool and feed for her animals. Señora Candina dreams of having a house in downtown Moche since the place where she lives now is very removed from the city.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

La señora Candina tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el Sector América en el distrito de Moche provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad. Solo tiene un año de estudio pero no sabe leer ni escribir; tiene 4 hijos los que aun dependen de ella. La señora Candina se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, cuyes y al tejido de chalinas, bolsas, chompas y los vende en la parte de la sierra en Huamachuco. Ella es de esta parte de la Sierra de La Libertad, pero hace varios años que sus hijos la trajeron a vivir a la costa debido a que tenía problemas con su esposo. Una vecina le invitó a formar parte del Grupo Mientras Tanto “San Borja” ingresó con mucha desconfianza pero ahora está muy agradecida y reconoce que los préstamos recibidos le han sido de mucha ayuda para mejorar en su negocio. Con el primer préstamo que obtuvo de S/.100.00 (aproximadamente $34) compró lana para tejer chompas y chalinas. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.600.00 (aproximadamente $201) para pagar en un plazo de 4 meses, compró madejas de lana para poder tejer, y alimento para sus animales. La señora Candina sueña con tener su casa en la ciudad de Moche ya que el lugar donde actualmente vive está muy retirado de la ciudad.

loans.use:
Purchase of food for her animals. Purchase of wool for fabric.

Compra de alimento para animales caseros. Compra de lana para tejido.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a diligent mother of two small children. For six years, she has worked hard to sell coats. She brings the merchandise from the city of Desaguadero (on the border of Bolivia) and sells them in the San José markets of her hometown, Juliaca. She started out by selling small articles of clothing but as she garnered knowledge and experience, she decided to make an incursion into the coat business. Due to its novelties, variety of colors, designs, and especially competitive prices that she offers to the general population, she faces a great demand for her products. That is why she wishes to borrow a loan, which will be well invested. It will be used to grow her business and above all, offer security and well-being to her lovely children who are the motivation for her daily efforts. Your generous support will help materialize her plans in a short time.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Yolanda, es una diligente madre de dos pequeños niños. Desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de casacas, mercadería que trae de la ciudad de Desaguadero ( Frontera con Bolivia) y las vende en el mercado San José de su ciudad natal, Juliaca.Ella empezó ofreciendo pequeñas prendas de vestir, pero conforme fue adquiriendo mayor conocimiento y experiencia decidió incursionar en la venta de casacas, gracias a las novedades, variedad de colores, modelos y sobre todo a los precios económicos con los que oferta su mercadería a la población en general, está obteniendo gran demanda, por eso desea obtener un préstamo de dinero que será muy bien invertido en las manos de Yolanda, permitiéndole así crecer en su negocio y sobre todo ofrecerles bienestar y seguridad a sus queridos hijos quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo día a día .Con tu desinteresado apoyo podrá concretar sus planes en corto tiempo.

loans.use: to buy clothing at wholesale

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel comes from a family of carpenters. Ever since he was young, he helped his father with carpentry. Little by little, he learned the fundamentals of making furniture. 25 years ago, after he married, he went out on his own. At first, it was difficult but, little by little, through his good work, Israel began to gain recognition from his customers, who recommended him to others.

Currently, Israel makes ironing boards and practical furniture to sell to furniture shops thereby earning him income faster. Nevertheless, right now, Israel does not have sufficient material to make his products. As a result, he is soliciting a credit of US $575 which he will repay within 6 months. With this money, Israel can begin to buy what he needs to make his products. With your help, Israel can get his family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Israel viene de una familia de carpinteros, desde que comenzó a crecer le ayudó a su papá en la carpintería. Poco a poco fue aprendiendo todo lo necesario para poder fabricar un mueble. Hace 25 años, después de que se casó, se independizó al inicio fue muy difícil pero poco a poco Israel con su buen trabajo como carta de presentación, fue haciéndose reconocido entre sus clientes quienes poco a poco lo recomendaban a otras personas.

Actualmente Israel fabrica muebles para planchar, y cómodas para venderla a mueblerías y así obtener ganancias más rápido. Sin embargo en este momento Israel no cuenta con material suficiente para elaborar sus productos. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Israel podrá comprar mercancía para así poder elaborar sus productos. Con tu ayuda Israel podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase materials.

loans.name: Thérese Afoua

texts.fr:
Born in Lomé on July 14, 1975, Mrs. Thérèse Afoua B. is divorced and is responsible for six persons. She trained as a seamstress but she does not have an appropriate workshop where she can do her sewing, so she is asking for a small loan. This will allow her to purchase a new sewing machine and rent a workshop. The very positive evolution of her business venture makes it necessary for Mrs. B. to have more capital at her disposition. This plan will bring in supplementary income so that she will be better able to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Lomé le 14 Juillet 1975, Madame B. Afoua Thérèse est divorcée et à en charge six (6) personnes. Couturière de formation, elle ne dispose pas d’un atelier de couture approprié pour exercer son métier et sollicite donc un financement sous forme de crédit. Ce fonds lui permettra d’une part à acquérir une nouvelle machine à coudre et louer un atelier. L’évolution très positive de ses activités oblige Madame B. à disposer plus de moyens financiers et ce projet lui apportera un revenu supplémentaire pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of a sewing machine and rental of a workshop

Achat de machine a coudre et location d'atelier

loans.name: Joseph B.

texts.en:
Joseph owns a small pharmacy in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. Joseph is 46 years old and married with 4 children. His business is the main source of income for the family. Joseph supplies many small pharmacies and individuals. Recently, various non-governmental organizations (NGOs) requested that he supply them with medicines in their clinics, but Joseph did not have enough capital to do that. He is requesting a loan of Le.3, 500,000 to meet his customers' demands.

Joseph has a great opportunity to work with local NGO's in his area. He needs to be able to supply them with an adequate amount of the medicines they need.

loans.use: To increase his stock of medicine to supply the NGOs in his area

loans.name: Theour Kheom Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Theour K. was born in 1954 and now lives in Banh Chhkol village. She is the group leader in a group of four women members of the village. She is a pots and firewood seller. She is married with four children, one of whom is working in a garment factory, while the others are studying in state school. Her husband, Mr. Eourn Kong, owns a husbandry business. He looks after cows, which he then sells for a profit. Additionally, he helps his wife when he has free time from his work.

Mrs. Theour K. has already requested a loan from AMK in the past to buy firewood to re-sell in the village. Presently, she wants to expand her business so she has asked for a loan. With part of it, she will buy more firewood to sell. With the rest of the money, she would like to buy a piece of land and re-sell it for a profit.

loans.use: To buy the land and firewood.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith is an excellent farmer. In the company of her beloved husband, she is dedicated to sowing potatoes, maize, and oca (an Andean root vegetable) in her fertile land. Additionally, she also is devoted to rearing pigs, which she sells in her city's market, and recently to selling grain. She began these last two activities with the intent to improve her beloved family's quality of life. She wishes to continue to generate income for her children's development and, for this reason, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Edith, es una excelente agricultora; en compañía de su amado esposo se dedica a sembrar papa, maíz y oca en sus fértiles tierras, de manera adicional también se dedica a la crianza de cerditos para ofertarlos en las ferias de su ciudad y recientemente a la venta de granos, éstas dos últimas actividades con el deseo de mejorar la calidad de vida de su amada familia.Desea seguir generando ingresos para el desarrollo de sus pequeños y a esa razón atiende su petición.

loans.use: Capital so that she may continue developing her farming activities.

loans.name: Nandu

texts.fr:
Mrs. Nandu L. is married to Richard Mensah and is the mother of three children of whom two are twins. She was born around 1976 in Togo. She has lived for 8 years in Xwlacodji, a very densely populated area of Cotonou, and ran a business selling corn porridge and charcoal. Since she had the impression that her fellow citizens needed a place to obtain peanut oil, she came to Alidé to request her first loan which was to allow her to begin selling a third product, peanut oil. She is presently requesting her fourth loan in the amount of US$ 250 to further bolster her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva voluneer

Mariée à MENSAH Richard, dame L. Nandu est mère de trois enfants dont deux jumeaux. Elle est née vers les années 1976 dans la république du TOGO. Elle réside à Xwlacodji un quartier populaire de COTONOU depuis 8ans et exerce l’activité de vente de bouillie faite à base de maïs et de charbon. Lorsqu'elle a senti que ses cohabitants avaient des besoins en huile d’arachide ; elle s’est adressée à ALIDé pour obtenir son premier crédit afin de créer sa troisième activité qu'est la vente d’huile d’arachide. Elle vient solliciter son quatrième crédit d’un montant de 100000F CFA pour renforcer son activité.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 sacks of charcoal, 50 liters of peanut oil, and 25 kg of corn

Achat de 10 sacs de charbon, de 50 litres d’huile d’arachide, de 25kg de maïs.

loans.name: Sheika's Group

texts.en:
These soldiers working in Makeni are Sheika B., Adama M., Gbassay K., and Victor M.. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,5000,000. This is their first loan from SMT. With this loan, they'll be able to engage in either agriculture or in a business that will earn them some money to complement their salaries.

Sheika B., the leader of this group, would like to give his wife the loan so she can start selling cosmetics. This was a long-held dream of theirs, but Sheika's salary was too small to enable his wife to start a business, considering their numerous other needs. With a loan from SMT, Sheika can now give his wife the required capital she needs to start a small business. Sheika is 36, and he was born in Kailahun in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married with 2 children.

loans.use: Start businesses to supplement their salaries

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa started her business because she's always liked sales and she wants a better future for her children. Rosa wants to provide them with a good education, and her husband's salary alone was not enough to do this. Rosa began in February of 2002, first by selling meals from her home. At first the business went very well, but as time passed Rosa's sales declined considerably. In response, she tried other sectors and a neighbor encouraged her to sell beauty products by catalog. Rosa has done very well in this business, and she's also begun to sell shoes of all types.

Rosa needs a loan of $1,000, which she'll repay in 6 months. She'll use the loan to buy merchandise, meeting her clients' demand for beauty products and shoes, and providing them with good service.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa inicio el negocio porque siempre le han gustado las ventas y por el deseo de que sus hijos tuvieran un futuro mejor y una buena preparación y para eso no era suficiente con el sueldo de su esposo. Comenzó en Febrero de 2002 , primero comenzó vendiendo comidas en la parte de enfrente de su casa, al principio le fue muy bien pero con el paso del tiempo sus ventas bajaron considerablemente, por lo que probó con otras opciones y una vecina se animó para que vendiera productos de belleza por catálogo con lo cual le ha ido muy bien y últimamente también ha comenzado a vender zapatos para toda la familia.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $1000 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia lo que le va a permitir surtir los pedidos de productos de belleza y calzado ya que tiene clientes pendientes para seguir dándoles un buen servicio

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina runs a small business, selling clothing items in Melitopol's busy central market. She is a widow with a son who is still in college. Marina has been self-employed in clothing sales for 13 years and is the sole breadwinner for her family.

Marina is a very determined woman, and she is serious about her business. These characteristics have helped her promptly repay all her loans from Nadiya Ukraine during her four years of partnership with our organization. Maintaining a reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service have always been priorities in Marina's work and have ensured the success of her business. Presently, she has about $1,000 of working capital and a monthly net profit of $600. Marina is asking for a loan of 3000 Grivnas ($625 USD) to increase her assortment of clothing products. She is hoping to use the extra financial support to stock up on more merchandise. The loan will not only be beneficial for Marina's business, but it will also help her meet her household expenses and to set aside some savings for future needs.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo Sánchez R. tiene 51 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valerosas II y vive en la calle Francisco de Miranda 2037 del distrito Esperanza Alta de la provincia de Trujillo departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió primaria completa pero no continuó estudiando por falta de medios económicos y porque era costumbre para los padres que solamente tenían deber de estudiar los hijos hombres.
Se casó a los 20 años pero no se comprendió con su pareja por lo que se separó, se volvió a casar con José Carbajal y tiene 6 hijos, 4 hombres y 2 mujeres, de los cuales solo dos dependen de ella.
Hizo una junta con sus familiares y compraron una máquina para perfilar calzado, actualmente tiene otras máquinas, tiene un pequeño taller donde trabajan con su esposo, es una sociedad familiar.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles devuelto en 4 cuotas compró material.
Con este crédito de 1000 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará pegamentos, cueros, hilos y otros materiales.
Sueña con tener un gran taller y dar empleo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Consuelo S. R. is 51 years old, belongs to the Communal Bank of Valorous Women II, and lives at 2037 Francisco de Miranda Street in the district Esperanza Alata in the province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad Peru. She finished primary school, but didn't continue studying because of a lack of economic means, and because it was a custom for the parents that only male children had to study. She got married at age 20 but her and her husband didn't understand each other, which is why they separated, she came to marry Jose Carbajal and has six children, four men and two women, of which only two depend on her. She made a bond with her family and they bought a machine to make foot ware, and she actually has other machines, she has a small workshop where she works with her husband, it's a family society. With the first loan of 300 soles returned in 4 payments, she bought material. With this loan of 1000 soles which will be repaid in six payments she will buy cements, leather, thread, and other materials. She hopes to have a large workshop and employ other people.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying materials: cements, leather, and thread.

loans.name: Genera

texts.es:
Genara pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso del distrito y provincia D. Yungay, departamento D. Ancash.

Tiene 48 años D. edad y D. su matrimonio ha tenido 5 hijos. Con el apoyo D. su esposo, que es empleado público, también ha podido educar a sus hijos e iniciar su negocio. Debido a que su mayor dificultad fue no tener un trabajo con el cual pudiera apoyar a su esposo, inició un negocio en el campo ferial D. Yungay, en el stand Nº 13, lugar donD. día a día venD. sus productos D. ferretería. Comenta que ha crecido mucho porque inició su negocio con S/.10,000 y ahora comenta que tiene invertido en toda su ferretería un monto aproximado D. S/ 100,000. Viaja hasta la ciudad D. Lima para poder abastecerse D. los productos o D. lo contrario hace los pedidos desD. la ciudad capital.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual será cancelado en 8 meses, comprará tubos, chapas, candados y accesorios D. agua y desagüe.

Genera menciona que le gustaría capacitarse en cuestiones D. crecimiento D. negocio, así mismo agradece al movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberla apoyado en el crecimiento D. su negocio.
texts.en:
Genera belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres al Progreso” (“Women Progressing”), located in the Yungay province of Ancash. She is 48 years old and has five children from her marriage. With the support of her husband, who is a public worker, she has also been able to educate her children and start her business. Given that her biggest difficulty was not finding employment to help her husband, she started her business at the Yungay fairgrounds, Stand #13, where day by day she sells hardware supplies. She tells us that the business has grown a great deal because she started with 10,000.00 soles, and now she has about 100,000.00 soles invested in her hardware store. She travels all the way to Lima to be able to stock up on her products or, otherwise, she places orders from the capital city. With this loan of 3,000.00 soles, to be repaid in 8 months, she will buy tubing, sheeting, padlocks, and plumbing accessories. Genera mentions that she would like to learn more about expanding the business and, in addition, she thanks the Manuela Ramos movement for having supported her in the growth of her enterprise.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tubing, sheeting, padlocks, and plumbing accessories.

loans.name: Magda

texts.es: Magda tiene 31 años, vive en una casa alquilada, con su pequeña hija. Ella elabora faldas para mujeres desde hace 6 años, iniciándose desde que nació su pequeña hija. Esta actividad no solo le es muy útil para solventar los gastos de educación de su hija, sino para también se sienta realizada, ya que el bordado  es lo que le apasiona realizar, además es muy rentable, por la demanda que hay en las ferias y los pedidos que tiene cada mes, lo cual eleva su nivel de trabajo y dedicación, por lo que solicita  ayuda de jóvenes para cumplir sus pedidos. Es su primer  préstamo con MFP. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de telas  para  elaborar las faldas, además, comprará adornos que requiere para el acabado de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Magda is 31 years old and lives in a rented house with her young daughter. She has made skirts for women for the past 6 years, beginning when her young daughter was born. This activity is not only useful to her to pay for the educational expenses of her daughter, but also for personal fulfillment, since she is passionate about embroidery. Moreover, it is very profitable because of the demand there is in the fairs and the orders she gets each month, which increase her level of work and dedication. She solicits the help of young people to meet her orders. This is her first loan with MFP. She will use the money from this loan to buy fabrics to make the skirts and to buy the decorations that she needs to complete the finished product.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric for the creation of her embroidered skirts

loans.name: Puleono

texts.en: Puleono E., 29, is married with 3 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the fish and seafood business. She sells to the village people and public 3 days per week. She is a new member, and has taken just one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Samoan Tala ($24 US).  SPBD loans are Puleono’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband is a fisherman who is helping her with the business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and equipments to replace the old ones to maintain her fishing business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” Provincia Juli, Departamento de Puno; de  42 años de edad, conviviente, dos hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace nueve años, dejo dos ciclos luego retomo con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, posee un negocio de artesanía; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para comprar materiales como lana de distintos colores, bayetas y otros.
Ella piensa mejorar su negocio de artesanía y quiere también tener negocio de una bodega y restaurante, Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles para comprar al por mayor lana de distintos colores y bayetas y otros materiales, de esta manera obtener mas ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su hogar, finalmente se compromete a pagar puntualmente su  préstamo en seis cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of La Juleñita Community Bank in Juli, Peru. She is a 42-year-old mother of two, lives with her partner and has a high school degree. She has been working with her craft business for nine years and took two off before returning to work with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos. Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she used to purchase materials. She plans to improve her craft business and also wants to start a bodega and restaurant business. With the loan of 1,000 soles she's requesting, she plans to purchase at wholesale wool of distinct colors, baize and other items. In this way she will earn more income and improve the quality of life for household. She plans to repay the loan punctually in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase at wholesale wool of distinct colors, baize and other items

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. is widow and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. She sells groceries like biscuits, canned products and other food supplies at Tatermu near Elmina, which she has done since not too long ago. Ama uses her income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Ama will use the loan as additional capital to enable her increase the sale of groceries to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to reinvest for the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Lach L. is 71 years old and resides in the Kampong Cham province with her husband and three of her children. She sells rice noodles and grocery items from her home and is able to make US$5 every day. Her husband sells corn and earns approximately US$4 per day. They are also supported by two children who work as mechanics and garment factory workers. Lach L. would like to take out a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more items to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To expand a grocery store.

loans.name: Broulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur B. Diarra est un célibataire de 21 ans qui  vit chez son père  dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Monsieur B. Diarra a très tôt abandonné l’école au profit du commerce qui ses parents menaient.
Pendant des années Monsieur B. Diarra a mené l’activité d’achat et de vente de céréales au marché de Bougouni, mais cela ne lui a pas réussi.
C’est ainsi qu’il décida  de s’éssaya  à l’activité d’achat et de  vente de pièces détachées et de lubrifiants  auprès de son grand frère.
Avec 2 années d’expérience, Monsieur B. Diarra maitrise bien son activité et très réputé dans ce créneau qui lui réussi bien. Il est à son premier prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso et compte acheter 20 cartons de 5 bidons à huile moteur et des petites pièces détachées.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur B. Diarra compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui lui permettra d’agrandir son entreprise et de rembourser les intérêts du prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. B. Diarra, age 21, lives at his father's house in the Hérémakono Centre neighborhood in Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Mr. B. Diarra dropped out of school at an early age, to help his parents with their business. For years, Mr. B. Diarra bought and sold cereals at the Bougouni market, but this business was not successful. He thus decided to try another business, namely buying and selling spare parts and lubricants with his elder brother. Having two years of experience, Mr. B. Diarra masters his business and is well-renowned in this field, where he's doing well. He's seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and intends to buy 20 boxes of 5 cans of motor oil, as well as small spare parts. He gets his supplies in Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali. With this loan, Mr. B. Diarra foresees turning a monthly profit of XOF 60'000 (ca US$ 120), which will enable him to expand his business and repay the loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 boxes of 5 cans of motor oil and small spare parts

loans.name: Hothia

texts.fr: Hothia D. est un commerçant basé au quartier Santhiaba. Ce pére de famille vend du matériel électroménager (frigo etc). Il solicite ce crédit pour renforcer son fond de roulement afin d'assurer une meilleure rentabilité de son activité.
texts.en:
Hothia D. is a merchant based in the neighbourhood of Santhiaba. This father sells home appliances such as refrigerators and so on. He is asking for this loan in order to increase his working capital so as to ensure a better profit from his business.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell household appliances

loans.name: Fransisca Del Socorro

texts.es: Francisca del Socorro Flete tiene la edad de 55 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Francisca tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Francisca es la elaboración y venta de repostería. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio, pero es importante resaltar que es un negocio que surgió por la falta de empleo, ya que este negocio surge por su Mama. Y por medio de los financiamientos ha logrado salir adelante con su negocio. Ya que el propósito de Francisca es de obtener cada día mas recursos para la compra de los productos y lograr una excelente elaboración de su repostería. El financiamiento es destinado para capita de trabajo y comprar productos como mantequilla, huevo, harina entre otros productos. El sueño de Francisca es establecer una panadería en su casa ya que actualmente se encarga de la elaboración y mas tarde las distribuye de forma ambulante.
texts.en:
Francisca del Socorro Flete, 55, is civilly married. Ms. Francisca has two kids, both of whom study. Her job is making and selling pastries. She's dedicated herself to this for 16 years, but it's important to stress that it's a business that emerged through a lack of employment, since this business comes down to her from her mom. And through her finances she's been able to get ahead with her business. Since Francisca's goal is to earn more resources every day to buy products and improve the quality of her pastries, the loan is to buy products like butter, eggs, and flour, among other things. Francisca's dream is to establish a bakery in her home, since currently she makes her pastries and sells them in the street.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Resources for work

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is married and has four dependents. She completed schooling through senior high school and has sold filtered water in Elmina since 2006. Her husband is a trader whose income is too small to provide for the family. Florence uses all her income to support her husband in paying their children's school fees.

Florence will use this loan to purchase more filtered water to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence plans to save and reinvest back into her trade.

loans.use: To purchase more filtered water.

loans.name: Torpekay Group

texts.en:
Torpekay is the group leader of Torpekay group. They live in the 17th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. The group members want to take a group loan of 40,000 Afghani. Each of the group members wants to take a loan for his/her business progress.

Torpekay wants to take a loan for her brother’s business: general store. Nazefa wants to take a loan for her sewing business. A. Mahmod wants to take a loan for his retail shop. And Nafas Jan wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving.

They all would like to expand their businesses through the loan they want to take, and support their families as well.

loans.use: expanding their small businesses

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar R. P. is a member (and the official secretary) of the communal bank “Manos Maravillosas” (Marvelous Hands) and lives in the city of Pucallpa. Pilar sells cooked food at a seasonal restaurant next to the sawmills located along the Ucayali River, which flows past the city. During the winter months, when the water level rises with the frequent rains, Pilar must move her restaurant further inland. Pilar sells soups, grilled meat and fish, stews and other local dishes. Many of her customers are the men who work at the sawmills.

Pilar has been working with Manuela Ramos for five years and used her very first loan to purchase items for a small shop that she had at that time. Pilar will use this loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles to purchase food items such as rice, sugar, oil and meats for her restaurant.

Pilar is married and has three children, aged 17, 15 and 12. She works hard to save money through Manuela Ramos’s mandatory savings program. Her primary motivation for working and saving is the improvement of her children’s future.

According to Pilar, Manuela Ramos has been a great help. Loans from Manuela Ramos allow women like her to invest in activities they know how to do and earn money—without this capital, many would not be able to work.

loans.use: To buy food items for her restaurant

loans.name: Kibwabwa Group

texts.en:
Jojina is a member of the Kibwabwa borrower group in Ruaha, Iringa. She is a 33-year-old woman, married, and mother of 2 children. Her children are ages 4 and 16.

Jojina has had her own shop for 5 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 250,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Jojina’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 300,000 TZS in order to buy more items for her shop, like rice and oil. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Jojina hopes to do repairs, to get more food for her family, to pay school fees, and to expand her business.

Romana, another member of the Kibwabwa borrower group, has also requested 200,000 TZS in order to support her own shop business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her shop

loans.name: Trésor Plus Group

texts.fr:
« Trésor Plus » est un groupe constitué de 26 membres des membres solidairement unis pour recevoir des prêts de Kiva à travers Hope RDC. Michel D. O. est dirigeant cette Banque Communautaire. 
Son activité consiste à vendre des habits et des sachets dans son quartier périphérique et le plus peuplé de la ville situé au nord de Kinshasa. Il a acquit une expérience solide en exerçant cette activité pendant plusieurs années. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un deuxième point de vente en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Michel a reçu 4 fois les crédits de Hope qu’il a remboursé correctement. Le prochain prêt lui permettra de diversifier son affaire en y ajoutant des épices dans le souci d’augmenter le bénéfice. Actuellement, son activité lui génère $90 par semaine. Il est âgé de 48 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants dont trois d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
“Trésor Plus” is a group composed of 26 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans through Hope RDC. Michel D. O. is the leader of this Banque Communautaire. His business involves selling clothing and sachets in his outlying district, the mostly highly populated in the city and located north of Kinshasa. He has acquired solid experience operating this business over several years. His ambition is to open a second outlet with the aim of growing his revenues. Michel has received four loans with Hope and has repaid them correctly. The next loan will enable him to diversify his business by including spices, for increasing his profit. Currently, his business generates $90 a week for him. He is 48 years old, married, and the father of six children. Three of them go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify his business by adding spices for sale

loans.name: Berna

texts.en:
Berna is a 36-year old married woman with five children. She owns a four-room house that she lives in with five people. Her home has electricity but no piped water. Berna takes care of her children as well as additional family members. The family gets three meals a day. Berna works seven days a week.

Berna sells retail merchandise to about 30 customers a day. Her customers are from all walks of life. Berna buys her merchandise twice a week at Kampala city shops. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her business, plus medication. Berna lives and works in a semi-urban area, so she doesn’t incur extra transportation costs going to and from work. She wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as sugar, soap, salt, and other home-use products for resale.

Berna has been in this business for the last ten years. She has been with MCDT for five years. This is her tenth loan, working with the same people. Berna aspires to grow her business into a solid, permanent enterprise.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Bakary

texts.fr:
Né vers 1961 à Socourani dans la préfecture Sikasso, Monsieur Bakary Berthé est un polygame qui a 2 épouses et est père de huit enfants. Il réside avec sa famille à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école, il s’est vite initié aux activités génératrices de revenus en l’occurrence l’achat et la vente des engrais, pesticides et insecticides il y a maintenant plus de vingt  ans. Avec ses deux décennies d’expérience dans ce domaine, il réjouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut, il décida ainsi d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à deuxième prêt individuel. Le précédent a été bien remboursé.
Il sollicite ce prêt pour d’acheter, 10 sacs d’urées, 10 sacs de complexes maïs, 8 sacs de complexes coton, 4 cartons d’insecticides et pesticides. Il s’approvisionne auprès du représentant de TOGUNA (une usine de fabrique d’engrais) à Sikasso et effectue ses ventes dans son magasin au nouveau marché de Médine Sikasso. Avec une clientèle composée  essentiellement d’agriculteurs certains de ses clients payent au comptant, d’autre à crédits.
 Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1961 in Socourani in the prefecture of Sikasso, Mr. Bakary Berthé is a polygamous man who has two wives.  He is the father of eight children.  He resides with this family in Hamdallaye, a working-class district in the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Not having had the chance to go to school, he was soon introduced to revenue-generating work, in this case, buying and selling fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides now over 20 years ago.  With his two decades of experience in this domain, he enjoys a solid reputation and accommodates many orders.  But the resources necessary for satisfying these demands are lacking.  Thus, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  He is now on his second individual loan with it.  The previous one was repaid.  He's requesting this loan to buy ten sacks of urea, ten sacks of fertilizer mix for corn, eight sacks of a fertilizer mix for cotton, and four boxes of insecticides and pesticides.  Supplies are gotten from the representative of TOGUNA (a factory making fertilizers) in Sikasso. And sales are made in his store at the new marketplace of Médine Sikasso.  His customer base is composed essentially of farmers.  Some of them pay in cash, others on credit.  With this loan, he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA.  With the profits gained, he plans to meet the bulk of his expenses and his family's too and to cover the loan interest.  The rest will be invested in his business.  

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and insecticides

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en:
Mrs. Zoraida E. is 34 years of age and a resident of Purok 3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is a mother of five children, mostly at their minor stage. Zoraida is married to Alfredo E. Sr., who is presently employed as a mechanic at RN Builders. He has worked there for five years and earns a meager income.

Zoraida's family is experiencing financial hardship in meeting all its needs. Two years ago, Zoraida decided to engage in a ready-to-wear clothes dealing business. A year ago, she also started a business selling lumpia (a type of spring roll) and longganisa (a type of Filipino sausage). Now she is earning an average net income of 4,500 PHP a month, which is of great help to her family. As a new member just this month of Kiva partner PMPC, she has been given the privilege of applying for her first loan of 7,000 PHP as capital for her existing business activities. She is very happy and thankful for the trust given to her. Her future plan is to expand her business activities into other areas.

loans.use: As additional capital for her existing businesses

location.town: Tangub-P3 Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Bahari Group

texts.en:
Dismas C., age 27, is single.  He has a general store which he started in 2004. At the store, he sells rice, sugar, beans, and also items like cups and utensils. He works daily from 6am until 11pm. He is able to earn a monthly profit of around $152. 

This will be Dismas’s 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the stock of his general store and has paid them back successfully.  He hopes for a new loan to increase the size of his business. 
	
Dismas will share this loan with his loan group, Bahari, which totals 21 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Dismas is 1st on the right, back row, with a red cap.

loans.use: increasing the stock of his general store

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a loving mother of four children. She is from the village of San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela. Her husband, named Leopoldo, is a family driver. Lolita is 53 years old and engaged in direct selling business of AVON cosmetic products and tending a "sari-sari" store (community based store).  She has been in this business for three years.  Some of her children are studying and she hopes that they finish their studies.  

Since her income is insufficient, she would like to borrow a loan of PHP15,000 from the KIVA lenders.  This amount will assist her in making her business grow and profitable.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

location.town: San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita L. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao. She is 56 years old. Rosita is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells fish and shrimp in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchased additional fish and shrimp for vending. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.
