It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional  fish and shrimp for vending

loans.name: El Cruce Hacia El Futuro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Cruce, se encuentra en el barrio del Cruce, perteneciente a la parroquia  de Sinincay en la ciudad de Cuenca, Sinincay se encuentra al noroeste de la ciudad, sus atractivos turísticos son su Templo Colonia, el Cerro de Cabagana, la Laguna de Pizarro, etc., sus habitantes han aprovechado los recursos de la naturaleza como son los yacimientos de arcillosos que son la materia prima para la fabricación de teja y ladrillo, su gente es cálida siempre quieren salir en adelante y buscan la mejor manera de trabajar para darles un futuro mejor a su familia.

La Sra. Elsa M. es socia del banco comunal El Cruce, perteneciente a la parroquia de Sinincay, tiene 45 años de edad, se encuentra divorciada hace 16 años tomando la decisión porque su esposo viajo al extranjero para darles un mejor futuro pero jamás regreso, ha procreado 4 hijos de 27, 25, 23 y 14 años de edad, su primer y tercer hijo se encuentran casados y uno de ellos aun vive en su casa ayudando económicamente, su segundo hijo trabaja y le ayuda en su casa, su ultima hija estudia en el colegio Ciudad de Cuenca, fruto del esfuerzo de su trabaja a podido construir su casa.

Elsa tiene un negocio de venta de almuerzos, lleva trabajando 2 años vende en la comunidad y también cuenta con una clientela trabaja desde muy temprano para poder tener su producto listo al medio día, tiene una gran amistad con todas las compañeras del banco comunal, se encuentra en el ciclo 14 trabajando con su bankito y nos comenta que le han ayudado mucho para superase con su familia y en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que le entrega la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR, va a invertir en su negocio comprando productos para la elaboración de sus almuerzos, su meta es  llegar a tener una tienda de víveres en su casa. 

La Sra. Rosa P. es socia del banco comunal El Cruce, vive en la comunidad del Cruce del Carmen, perteneciente a la parroquia de Sinincay, tiene 42 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha procreado 6 hijos de 27, 25, 21, 13, 12 y 3 años de edad, su primara hija se encuentra casada y vive independientemente, su segundo y tercer hijo trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su cuarta hija estudia en el colegio Ecuador, su quinto hijo estudia en el colegio Monsalve Pozo, su esposo trabaja en la construcción, siendo merecido el esfuerzo de varios años de trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia.

Rosa trabaja desde hace 2 meses en el bar del colegio Monsalve Pozo y nos comenta que le va  bien, tiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras del banco comunal, se encuentra en el ciclo 14 trabajando con los prestamos de la fundación y comenta le han beneficiado en la superación de su hogar, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR, le hace entrega va a invertir en su hogar, su meta es de llegar a arreglar mejor a su casa.

La Sra. Gladys Ullaguari es socia del banco comunal El Cruce, vive en el barrio Santa Ana del Cruce que es perteneciente a la parroquia de Sinincay, tiene 57 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha procreado 7 hijos de quienes no se acuerda las edades, sus cuatro primeros hijos se encuentran casados tres de ellos viven independientemente, solo una hija casada vive en su casa pero aparte, dos de sus hijos estudian en el CECAP, un hijo trabaja y le ayuda para el pago de agua y luz, su esposo trabaja en la construcción, con el esfuerzo de muchos años de trabajo han logrado construir su casa propia aunque nos comenta que es pequeña pero muy cálida.

Gladys trabaja en su negocio vendiendo frutas, tiene un puesto propio en el mercado, lleva trabajando en su negocio hace 2 años y nos dice  que hay semanas buenas y malas pero siempre hay una pequeña ganancia para llevar el pan a su hogar, su horario de trabajo es de 8 a.m. a 5 p.m., tiene una gran amistad con todas sus compañeras del bankito, se encuentra en el cuarto ciclo y nos comenta que los prestamos le han beneficiado en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR, le entregará va a invertir en su negocio y para ayudar a su familia, su meta es de llegar a arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "El Cruce" is located in the neighborhood of El Cruce, which belongs to the parish of Sinincay in the city of Cuenca. Sinincay is in the northeast part of the city. Its tourist attractions are the Colonial Temple, the Cabagana hill, the Pizarro lagoon, etc. It's inhabitants have made the most of the natural resources here like the clay deposits that are the raw material for making tile and bricks. The people here are warm and always wnat to get ahead and look for the best way of working to give their families a better future.

Señora Elsa M. is a member of the communal bank, "El Cruce," which belongs to the Sinincay parish. She is 45 and has been divorced for 16 years. She made this decision because her husband traveled abroad to give them a better future and never came back. She has 4 children who are 27, 25, 23, and 14. Her first and third sons are married and one of them still lives in her home and helps her financially. Her second son works and helps her at home. Her youngest daughter goes to the high school in the city of Cuenca. As a fruit of her labor, she has been able to build her home.

Elsa has a business selling lunches, and she has sold them for 2 years in her community. She also has a clientele and works starting very early to be able to have her lunches ready at noon. She has great friendships with all of the members of her communal bank. They are on their 14th loan, and she tells us that it has helped them get ahead with their families and their businesses. With the new loan that Fundación Espoir is offering her, she will invest in her business by buying products to make her lunches. Her goal is to start a grocery store in her home.

Señora Rosa P. is a member of the communal bank, "El Cruce," and lives in the community called Cruce del Carmen. It belongs to the parish of Sinincay. She is 42; married; and has 6 kids who are 27, 25, 21, 13, 12, and 3. Her first daughter is married and lives independently. Her second and third sons work and help her financially. Her fourth daughter studies at Ecuador high school. Her fifth son studies at the Monsalve Pozo high school. Her husband works in construction, and because of his years of hard work, they have managed to build their own home.

Rosa has worked for two years at the snack bar of the Monsalve Pozo high school, and she tells us that it is going well for her. She has a great friendship with all of the members of her commmunal bank. They are on their 14th laon and she tells us that it has helped her improve her home. With this new loan from Fundación Espoir, she will invest in her home. Her goal is to make some repairs to her home.

Señora Gladys Ullaguari is a member of the communal bank, "El Cruce" and lives in the Santa Ana del Cruce neighborhood, which belongs to the Sinincay parish. She is 57, married, and has 7 children whose ages she doesn't remember. Her first four children are married and three of them live independently. Only one of her married daughters lives in her house but she lives in a separate area. Two of her children study at CECAP, and one son works to help her pay the water and light bill. Her husband works in construction. Through many years of work, they have managed to build their own home. She tells us that it is small but very warm.

Gladys has a business where she works selling fruit. She has her own stand in a market. She has done this for 2 years, and she tells us that there are good weeks and bad weeks, but there is always a little profit so she can take food to her home. Her work schedule is from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. She has a great friendship with all of the members of her bank. This is her fourth loan, and she tells us that her loans have benefitted her business. With this new loan from Fundación Espoir, she will invest in her business to help her family. Her goal is to make some repairs to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, meat, apples, oranges, and food in general

loans.name: Elliot

texts.en: Elliot is a hard-working young man. He is 39 years old, married with a child. His child is 5 years old and attends a government primary school in Delta state. Elliot is a farmer; he owns a piggery farm where he raises and sells pigs to make a living.  He has been in this business for four years. He hopes to expand this business and this requires a lot of money. He is requesting the loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more piglets to raise and sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Simona De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Sra. Simona tiene 50 años de edad, casada habitante del Bº 380, con dos hijos un joven de 17 años y una niña de 14 años los dos estudiantes de secundaria. La Sra. A. es una mujer muy trabajadora lava y plancha a domicilio ya tiene 3 años realizando esta labor ya que se vio en la necesidad de obtener un poco mas de ingresos para llevar el sustento de cada día a su hogar, su esposo se encuentra trabajando en Costa Rica y cuando recoge le manda dinero por medio de remesas y de esta manera le ayuda con los gastos de su hogar, su sueño a sido terminar de construir su casa y poder darles una vivienda mas digna a sus hijos así como una educación superior. Solicito un préstamo con AFODENIC, para construir un muro de concreto que divida su terreno con el vecino y así poder tener más seguridad en su vivienda. Se siente muy agradecida con la institución ya que le apoyado en sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Simona, 50, is married and lives at B° 380 with her two children. Her son is 17, and her daughter is 14. They are both in high school. Señora A. is a very hard-working woman. She washes and irons from home. She has been doing this work for three years because she saw the need to get a little more income for the everyday support of her household. Her husband works in Costa Rica. When he collects, he sends money as remittances. That way he is able to help with the household expenses. Her dream has been to finish building her house. She wants to be able to give her children a more decent house and a post high school education. She asked AFODENIC for a loan to build a concrete wall that divides her land from her neighbor’s. This way her house will have more security. She is very grateful to the institution because it has helped her with the projects in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cement, rocks, and iron

loans.name: Willam

texts.es:
William, de 42 años, es un padre muy trabajador y sincero, vive en un cuarto alquilado junto a su querido hijo Raúl, de 8 años, y lo que más quiere es darle unos buenos estudios.
La actividad a la que William se dedica es la elaboración y venta de CDs educativos. En un pequeño taller, implementado en su cuarto, graba los discos, diseña la tapa y la caja donde irán, y así tiene listo todo el producto. Todas las mañanas sube a los autobuses interprovinciales con destino a la ciudad de Azangaro y vende su novedosa y educativa mercadería
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es realizar el estampado a los CDs, pues como él mismo dice “le pone su sello personal”. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que conseguir los discos educativos, ya que últimamente están muy escasos. 
Para más adelante, espera tener una tienda donde pueda vender con más comodidad sus productos.

Este es el primer préstamo de William con MFP y está muy feliz de la oportunidad, por lo que está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es muy querido. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará mayor cantidad de material para la elaboración de sus CDs.
texts.en:
William, 42, is a hard-working and sincere father. He lives in a rented room with his dear son, eight year old Raúl. What he wants most of all is to give him a good education. William makes and sells educational CDs. In a small workshop, which is set up in his room, he records discs and designs the covers and the cases where they go. That way he has the whole product ready. Every morning he gets on the inter-provincial buses headed to the city of Azangaro, and he sells his original and educational merchandise. What he likes most about the work he does is making the design for the CDs. As he says, “he adds his personal stamp”. He has been doing this for eight years. The most difficult part is having to get the educational discs because they are very scarce lately. Later, he hopes to have a store where he can sell his products more comfortably. This is William’s first loan with MFP. He is very happy for the opportunity of the loan, and he is prepared to make his payments on time. He is much loved in his communal bank. He will use the 1,000 PEN he is requesting to buy a greater quantity of material to make his CDs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to make his educational CDs

loans.name: Srey Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Touch N. is 27 years old and lives in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, while the others are too young to study or work. Srey Touch sells fish, and her husband, Mr. Sey Tha Khey, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice to support his family.

In order to improve the family’s living conditions, Srey Touch is requesting a loan to buy more fish to sell because it is now the high season for fish.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 40 years old and married with three children.  Her two eldest children are currently in high school while her youngest is attending elementary school.  Rosario lives in the province of Rizal in the Philippines with her husband, Manolo. To supply additional income for her family, Rosario is interested in launching her own fishing business.

Rosario would like to receive a loan to purchase raw materials like nets, bamboo, and a new fish cage.  As a new member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Rosario is thankful for access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams.  Her long-term goals are to build a profitable fishing business, send all of her children to college, and invest in her home.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is dedicated to launching a new business and determined to achieve financial stability for her family.


About ASHI: Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank Approach (GBA) to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models in credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like nets, bamboo, and a new fish cage.

loans.name: Marcia Eralda

texts.es:
Marcia M. de 41 años, vive en una zona periurbana en Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y si cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos. 

Marcia inicio vendiendo dulces y snack en su casa. Pasaron uno pocos años para que ella surtiera mejor su tienda.

Ahora ella trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 23h00, vende enlatados, bebidas, arroz, azúcar etc. En ocasiones sus hijos le ayudan en la tienda. Con las lluvias que hay ahora los ingresos de la tienda han decaído un poco. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener otra tienda para que sus hijos la administren.
texts.en:
41-year old Marcia M. lives in the suburb of Paraíso de Guayaquil in a cement-block house which has basic services. She is the single mother of three children. Marcia started out selling candy and snacks from her house. Several years went by as she built up the stock in the store. She now works there every day from 6 in the morning until 11 at night selling canned products, drinks, rice, sugar etc. Her children sometimes help in the store. Because of the current rainy season, income from the store has dropped a little. With the loan Marcia wants to buy rice, sugar, and oil for the store. Some time in the future she would like to have another store for her children to operate.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Cesar Gustavo

texts.es:
El Sr. Cesar es Carpintero  hace varios años, es casado con la Sra. Mirta tienen 2 hijos menores que aún van a la escuela primaria.
El tiene su propia carpintería donde fabrica los muebles, el vende a personas que se dedican a vender muebles a cuota.
El se Inicio en este negocio trabajando como ayudante de un tío que realizaba la misma actividad. 
Hoy día el es dueño de su propia carpintería. El Sr. Cesar solo genera los ingresos para llevar adelante los gastos de la casa y los estudios de sus hijos para darles una mejor vida.
, El motivo del préstamo es para la compra de una camioneta para poder trasladar mejor sus mercaderías y así poder así brindarle mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Hemos confiado en  el por ser una persona muy trabajadora y responsable a sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Cesar has been a carpenter for several years. He is married to Mirta and they have two minor children who are still in primary school. He has his own workshop where he makes furniture. He sells to people who sell furniture with financing. He started in this business as an assistant to an uncle who did this activity. Today he is the owner of his own workshop. Cesar only makes enough income to cover the household expenses and his children's education to give them a better life. The reason for the loan is to buy a pick up truck to be able to transport his merchandise in a better way and thus offer a better service to his customers. We have trusted him because he is a hardworking person and responsible with his commitments.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Gulu Development Of Mukono Group

texts.en:
Enormous expenditures of 26-year-old N. Sylvia’s energies have all been centered on expanding her small retail business which she opened three years ago in Ggulu, Mukono district. Though the competition to establish a niche in the market has been tough, she has managed to get into her business groove over the last two years.

The reliable stock in trade Sylvia has used in her business to lure customers, by her own admission, is her easygoing and friendly nature. These attributes have worked in Sylvia’s favor and, in the wake of this, she has managed to consistently balance her modest profits.

In a week, this mother of two reportedly makes close to 50,000 shillings a week. This is little money by any standards to solidify a growing business. As such, she is in need of a loan to aid her in buying more merchandise for her retail shop.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of merchandise such as cosmetics, clothes, shoes and mobile phones and their accessories

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a business woman in Hoima, Uganda, dealing in cloth sales. She has been in business for 12 years and over the years she says she has seen the challenges of the business but still maintains it’s a profitable one. Florence is married to a driver and they have six children, a family size that is challenging to meet its needs and requirements in a country like Uganda. 

With that in mind, Florence says it has driven her to persist with hard work in her business and she hopes to see the business grow in size. This is her sixth loan, intended to enable her to buy cloth for reselling at her stall in the market.

loans.use: buying cloth for resale

loans.name: Kapangua Ole

texts.en:
Kapangua Ole K. is 24 years old. He a single young farmer who has been farming for the last three years. 

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan with which he is planning to plant four acres of wheat which normally does well in his area due to good climatic conditions. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his wheat production.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a still bigger piece of land. Kapangua is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: To plant four acres of wheat on his farm

loans.name: Marie's Group

texts.en:
These are members of “Marie’s Group”, small-scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 each. With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses and make more sales and better profits. Consequently, their living standards will improve; they will be able to at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills if any of them fall sick.

Marie C. is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni. She is 35 years of age, married to an architect, and they have four children – two in primary school, one in secondary school and one not of school-going age.

Marie C. sells market-food – rice, pepper, Maggi (used to give sauces a sweet taste), onions, oil, etc. With the help of this loan, she will buy more of the above mentioned items wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice, pepper, Maggi, onions, oil, etc., to sell

loans.name: Sabougnouma Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMA II sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 38ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à DANGUELEDOUGOU un des villages de la commune de KADIOLO préfecture  de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaborations avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Les spéculations cultivées sont :le riz,  l’arachide (par MINIGNA K.), mil et maïs. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, MINIGNA K. compte acheter des intrants et des petits matériels pour entretenir 1Hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de KADIOLO et de ZEGOUA après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85.500 FCFA après la campagne, qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de scolarité des enfants et les soins de santé de la  famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of SABOUGNOUMA II group are married women who on average are 38 years old and have 3 children. Most of them live in polygamous families at DANGUELEDOUGOU one of the villages in the commune of KADIOLO which is in the prefecture of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to bring their agricutural activities to fruition during the winter period.They are on their fourth collaboration with the institution,the previous loans ended well. The products cultivated are: rice, groundnut (by MINIGNA K.), millet and maize. With her new loan, MINIGNA K. hopes to buy farming supplies (seeds,fertiliser and other products) and small machinery for maintaining 1 Hectare. After the harvest the goods are sold in the village and at KADIOLO and ZEGOUA markets to a clientele of men and women. She hopes to make an average profit of 85.500 FCFA after cultivation, which will be used to support school fees for the children and health care costs for the family.

Translated from French by Barbara Belli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds,fertiliser etc. and small farm machinery.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.en:
Paulino U. is from the village of Sagay in Camiguin Province. He is 55 years old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Paulino owns & operates a bakeshop, and he sells his bread through peddling using his motorcycle. Paulino has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Paulino joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which he used to  purchase additional cooking ingredients. Paulino is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Paulino from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of his child. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a business transport vehicle.

loans.name: Kimhour

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimhour K., is a widow and has three sons and two daughters. She lives on an Island in Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Kimhour has been a farmer for more than twenty years. She grows corn, tomato and mushrooms on her farmland in the village. Some parts of her house break down and she wants to repair it, but Kimhour doesn’t have money. That’s why she is requesting a loan of $700, in order to make the repairs.

loans.use: To repair the house where she is living.

loans.name: Evelia Veneranda M

texts.es:
Evelia Hernández D. Y. es una gran modista que ha logrado no solo confeccionar ropa  sino también venderla   en su miscelánea, también  ubicada en la ciudadela 20 D. Julio, cerca al Estadio Metropolitano D. Barranquilla, epicentro D. donD. han salido muchos jugadores D. futbol representativos del armónico futbol que se juega en Colombia.
Evelia inició su actividad en el año 1999, antes D. este tiempo trabajaba como auxiliar D. enfermería pero desD. que se pensionó hace 3 años se ha convertido en una gran confeccionista y comerciante a la vez, trabaja diariamente por mas D. 8 horas y su clientela la conforman justamente excompañeros D. trabajo, vecinos familiares y referidos D. personas que conocen la calidad en su diseños y a las que le proporciona un plan D. pagos adecuado a sus necesidades.
Este es su tercer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización a la que está vinculada desD. hace mas  tres años, es decir desD. que empezó a desarrollar su capacidad emprendedora.
Su meta es y siempre ha sido contribuir en mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia y ascender en la escalera del éxito en su negocio que es lo que le ayudaría en este propósito. 
Con su credikiva comprará tela e hilos y también invertirá en mercancías como juegos D. sabanas, papelería y juguetería con el fin D. surtir su miscelánea para el segundo semestre del año que es D. mucho movimiento comercial.
texts.en:
Evelia Hernández D. Y. is a great stylist who not only makes clothing but also sells it in her general store, located in the "Ciudadela 20 D. Julio" neighborhood near the metropolitan stadium of Barranquilla, a sports center where there have been many soccer players representative of the high level of soccer played in Colombia. Evelia started her business in 1999. Before that she worked as a nursing assistant, but since she retired 3 years ago she has become a great garment producer and, at the same time, a great retailer. She works each day for more than 8 hours, and her customers incluD. her old work colleagues, neighbors, and people referred to her by those who know the quality of her designs. She provides her customers with a payment plan that meets their needs. This is her 3rd loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She became affiliated with this organization about 3 years ago, which is when she started to develop her capacity as a businesswoman. Her goal is and has always been to make a contribution to improve the quality of life for her family, and to climb the ladder of success in her business, which is what helps her to achieve the first goal. With her loan from Kiva, she will buy fabric and thread, and will also invest in merchandise such as bed sheets, stationery and toys to restock her general store for the second half of the year when there is a lot of commercial activity.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy fabric and thread, and will also invest in merchandise such as sets of bed sheets, stationery and toys to restock her general store

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia es socia del Banco Comunal Lila y lo que mas le agrada son los prestamos fáciles y las capacitaciones.
Aurelia es casada y tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 6 estudian, Aurelia sueña con que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean profesionales.
Aurelia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región dos veces por semana, en donde vende ropa variada, los demás días se encarga de sus hijos. Solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de faldas y chompas.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a member of the communal bank Lila. She is very grateful for the easy loans and the training classes. Aurelia is married and has 7 children, 6 of whom are in school. She dreams that her children will be able to finish school and become professionals. Aurelia travels to the different fairs in the region two times a week where she sells various types of clothing. The other days she cares for her children. She is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) to buy skirts and sweaters.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase skirts and sweaters

loans.name: Aitgul

texts.en:
Aitgul O. is a young woman who runs her business in trade. She began this activity nine years ago, when she rented a sales venue at the local market. With the capital of 7,000 KGS, she began her business selling foodstuffs. Her activity started to bring in profit and the number of her customers increased. During her most recent years of selling groceries at the market, Aitgul has managed to raise her circulating capital to 80,000 KGS and purchase a small store. 

At the beginning of 2010, Aitgul obtained her first loan of 50,000 KGS from "Bai Tushum and Partners". She used it to enlarge the assortment of goods in her store. The loan was used as intended and repaid without any delays. Since the store has become a family business, her 10-year-old son wants to follow in his mother's footsteps and engage in trade. 

Aitgul will use this new loan of 50,000 KGS to broaden the range of food products of her store. With the revenue, she plans to give a good education to her son. Also, Aitgul intends to get a driving license this year.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma B. is from the village of Taytay, El Salvador City, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Vilma is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Vilma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products including fish in the local community. Vilma has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Vilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita F., 50 years old, is a mother of 3 children. She is a hardworking mother and a very active member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.- a partner MFI of KIVA in the Philippines since 2001. Managing a store has been her main source of income since joining the program. From this business she was able to generate a profit and support her family for their financial needs. Again, she is applying for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy additional stock for her store. She will use the income from this additional capital to improve her store. She is planning to develop her store to accommodate more inventory and to add convenience for her buyers and future customers. Her future business plan is to buy a jeepney, or motorcycle, that they can use for deliveries. For her family, she dreams of her children finishing a degree and securing stable jobs. She is thankful to KIVA lenders for supporting her goals in life.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery products.

loans.name: Erli Ysacc

texts.en:
Erli Ysacc V. D. is 41 years old. He lives with his partner and two young children in the town of Sandial, which is in the district of Pitipo in the province of Ferreñafe. It is a small rural community outside the cities of Chiclayo and Ferreñafe, which grows a wide range of products including corn, rice and sugar cane.

For more that six years Erli has grown crops in the area. He is very experienced and his level of production earns him a certain respect in the area. He currently has a good crop of hard yellow corn that is in the process of maturing. As of the date of disbursement of funds, the corn had forty days of growth.

Erli needs the loan in order to purchase fertilizers and pesticides that he will use to ensure the best growth of his crop. He hopes to be able to apply urea as a fertilizer and then fumigate the area in order to prevent the entry of bugs and other pests.

Erli has taken loans from our institution in the past. He has good references from both other businesses and friends. He greatly appreciates access to credit in this moment in order to promote the growth of his crops, and he is thankful for the lower cost product that he is able to obtain as a result of the Kiva funding. He is always striving to better the lifestyle of his family and provide for his children. He hopes that this will be one small step further in the right direction.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Tourn

texts.en: Tourn K., 49, is married. She resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. K. weaves Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1.5 per day. K. has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 65 on other necessary expenses every month. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more raw silk to produce silk products

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elvira; tiene 45 años de edad, y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de azúcar y arroz, ella tiene una tienda donde vende azúcar y arroz al por mayor y luego lo distribuye a las diferentes tiendas, la socia también tiene un cafetín en un colegio particular, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de arroz y azúcar. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz y azúcar al por mayor.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Elvira belongs to the Mosoc Runa ["New People" in Quechua] communal bank, which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of the same name.

Elvira is 45 years old and is married with two children. Each day she tends to her chores and also runs a business selling sugar and rice. She has a store where she sells these items wholesale, and distributes them to various stores. Elvira also runs a small food stand at a local school. She wants to improve her sugar and rice selling business, and is asking for the loan to buy large quantities of rice and sugar.

Elvira is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments within the established time period.

loans.use: To buy large quantities of rice and sugar

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “Azangarinas al Progreso”  ubicado en el distrito Azángaro,  provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la señora estudió solo hasta la secundaria.

Viene  trabajando con  el Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos desde hace 02 años, su primer préstamo  fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  utilizó para  incrementar el capital de  su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de quesos y pan.

Alejandrina solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que  invertirá en la compra de quesos para su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una tienda de abarrotes y tener un carro.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the communal bank "Azangarinas al Progreso" located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, Puno department.  She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage and has 2 children.  She went to school through high school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 2 years.  Her first loan was of 5,000 nuevos soles, money she used to increase the income from her business.  She works selling cheeses and bread.

Alejandrina is asking for a new loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, money that she will use to buy cheeses for her business.

Her dream for the future is to have a grocery store and a car.

The thing she likes most about her communal bank is the training she receives.

loans.use: Purchase of cheese wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, meat, fish, cooking oil, onion, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Ki

texts.en:
Ki S., 25, is a farmer and produces traditional baskets, earning an income of $2 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend $60 on food, $10 on electricity supply and $10 on other necessary expenses every month. 

Her husband is a tuk-tuk (a motorized, three-wheeled taxi) driver, earning an income of $3 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase business hours at the airport to provide transportation services. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy the business hours at the airport to provide transportation services

loans.name: Flordelisa

texts.en:
Flordelisa V. is from the village of Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 37 years old. Flordelisa is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Flordelisa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Flordelisa is just starting this business.

In 2007, Flordelisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flordelisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Flordelisa is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Flordelisa from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ismat

texts.en: Ismat is a mother of six children: four daughters and two sons. Ismat and her husband are employees with a decent salary. Therefore, they have decided to start a business that would add to their income and secure a better life and education for their six children. Ismat and her husband started a small animal farm that is growing slowly. To enlarge the farm, they took out a loan from FATEN to purchase more goats to raise to produce milk and make cheese to sell. Ismat's husband appears in the picture here, as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to enlarge the farm

loans.name: Agnès

texts.fr: N.  Agnès  est   commerçante en province de l’ ouest (Rutsiro ) elle a 49 ans, elle est marié ,elle a 7 enfants, entre 25 et 11,ans  6 de ces enfants vont à l’ école , elle est née au Rwanda,  son  niveau d’étude est primaire . Elle a une expérience  de remboursement des prêts  car le cycle actuel de  prêt  qu’elle   sollicite est  quatrième, ave ce prêt, elle va acheter 2 sacs du riz ,20l d’huile, acheter  les chaises  et autres  pour a son restaurant.    Sa stratégie pour la croissance  de l’affaire de développer  son    business de restaurant en augmenter  la capacité et pour aider ses enfants à terminer ses études et pour le bien être de sa famille dans le temps à venir.
texts.en: Agnès N. is an entrepreneur from the West province (Rutsiro). She is 49 years old, married, and has seven children between 25 and 11 years of age. Six of her children are in school. She is born in Rwanda and has received primary education. She has experience repaying her loan as she is now on her fourths cycle. With this new loan, she will buy two bags of rice, 20 liters of oil, chairs and other items for her restaurant. Her business strategy is to keep her restaurant going by increasing its capacity. She would like to help her children finish their studies and ensure the future well-being of her family.

loans.use: Purchasing two bags of rice, 20 l of oil, chairs, etc

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru: Хайдаров Абдурахим проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ему 37 лет. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. У него среднее образование. Он занимается животноводством. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Разводит скот у себя дома. В этой области уже 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Abdurahim H. lives in the J.Rumi region. He is 37 years old. He is married and has four children. He has secondary education. He has been doing animal husbandry and making a living by breeding large cattle. He does this at home. He has been in this business for six years. He needs the loan to buy large cattle.

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. prepares smoked fish for sale at Takoradi. Mary is married and has 7 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Mary has been selling smoked fish for 20 years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children. 
She is showing a piece of the fish she will be smoking.

loans.use: to buy more fish to smoke for sale.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta forma parte del banco comunal “Mapuamulen” perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Ella se dedica al rubro de amasandería desde hace 3 años, específicamente venta de empanadas, pastel de choclo y pan amasado. Violeta sale a vender sus productos a trabajadores de comercio establecido y barcos que llegan a la zona costera. Sin embargo la venta de sus productos bajó éstas semanas, debido a las replicas de tsunami de Japón, ya que también afectó las costas chilenas, específicamente Dichato. 
Su horario es totalmente flexible, ya que ella maneja su tiempo laboral. Su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras. Recibe ayuda de su hijo, para el traslado de sus productos de amasandería y mercadería.
Con el préstamo comprará una congeladora, un horno pequeño e ingredientes para sus productos de amasandería.
Su sueño es tener una panadería, para trabajar desde su casa, además de una revolvedora de masas, ya que el resto de maquinarias las tiene, gracias a los créditos obtenidos por Fondo esperanza. Respecto a sus sueños a nivel personal, estos son obtener su vivienda propia, ya que en la actualidad se encuentra viviendo en una casa que obtuvo de la Municipalidad de Concepción, a causa del terremoto del 27 febrero del año 2010. Por lo que sus motivaciones de continuar en el negocio son específicamente para concretar sus sueños, de ésta manera poder brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar.
Violeta está muy agradecida de los créditos otorgados por Fondo Esperanza, ya que estos le han servido para invertir en su negocio. Respecto a las capacitaciones ella está muy contenta, ya que ha aprendido a distribuir mejor sus ingresos. 
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Violeta is a member of the communal bank “Mapuamulen” in the city of Concepción. She has been working as a baker for 3 years, specifically selling empanadas, corn cake, and kneaded bread. Violeta goes out and sells her products to commercial workers and ship workers who arrive in the coastal area. However her sales have dropped in the past few weeks due to the aftershocks of the tsunami in Japan, which also effected the Chilean coasts, specifically Dichato. Her schedule is totally flexible because she sets her own hours. She buys her merchandise from distributors. She receives help from her son, who moves her bakery products and merchandise.

With this loan she will buy a freezer, a small oven, and ingredients for her bakery products. Her dream is to have a bakery, work from home, and, additionally, to own a dough turner because she has the rest of the machines thanks to the loans she's received from Fondo esperanza. As far as her personal dreams, she's like to own her own home because at the moment she lives in a house that she got from the municipality of Concepción because of the earthquake of February 27, 2010. The realization of her dreams and offering her family better well being keep her motivated to work,

Violeta is very thankful for the credits she's received from Fondo Esperanza because they have helped her invest in her business. With respect to the training, she's very happy because she's learned how to better distribute her income.

Concepción is situated at the mouth of the Bíobío river, one of the biggest in the country, in the south of Chile, in the region of Bíobío. It has played an important role in the history of Chile, being the site of many important battles and relevant settlements, especially during the Arauco war because it's on the border with the Mapuche territory. Currently the city posses an important economic and demographic development, becoming known as one of the urban, demographic, administrative, financial and commercial centers in Chile, after Santiago and Valparaíso.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, small oven, and ingredients for her baked goods

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 32 años vive en compañía de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde su niñez aprendió todo lo necesario para desarrollar la agricultura, los años transcurrieron y con los terrenos que heredó de sus padres puede sembrar papa, maíz, olluco, habas, trigo entre otros.  Estos productos tienen mucha demanda en el mercado, por eso cuando lo cosecha lo lleva directo al mercado mas cercano de su comunidad, de esa manera pueda ofrecer una estabilidad económica a su familia. En ocasiones la inestabilidad de los precios suelen perjudicarle en las ventas, sin embargo ha ido superando esta dificultad buscando otras opciones para vender. Tiene planes a futuro, como el de desempeñar otra actividad comercial  para crecer más su economía. Es su primera vez que solicita un crédito con MFP,  esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un respaldo económico y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, le servirá para mejorar su actividad agrícola con la compra de más sacos de abono.
texts.en: Luz is 32 years old and lives in her own home with her three children.  Since she was a little girl, she learned everything she needed to know about agriculture.  In time she began planting potatoes, corn, beans, ulluco, wheat, and other things on the land she inherited from her parents.  These products are in great demand in the marketplace, so she harvests them and takes them directly to the market near her home.  In this way she can provide financial stability to her family.  Sometimes the varying prices hurt her sales, but she has managed to overcome these difficulties by finding other ways to sell.  She plans to start another venture in the future in order to grow more financially.  This will be her first loan through MFP and she is very happy to have financial backing.  She is committed to making her payments on time.  She will use the money from this loan to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Geresa

texts.en: Geresa J. is 30 years old, married, with 8 children. 6 of them go to school. Geresa currently is in a business of selling tomatoes. She is asking for a loan lo to stock more tomatoes to sell. Geresa hopes to expand in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.ar: يوسف عمره26 سنة اعزب يعمل في بيع وصيانة المولدات الكهربائيةو مقويات الكهرباء الاتوماتكيةله في عمله سنتين يحب عمله ويريد التطور دائما به من خلال تجديد المحل وصيانته وشراء بضاعة جديدة يريد ان يؤمن مستقبله حتى يتمكن من بناء عائلة وخاصة انه متكفل بوالده ووالدته فهو محب للعائلة انساني وطموح بأن تفضل عائلته متماسكة انه انسان يحب العمل ويريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة جديدة وتركيب زجاج المينيوم للمحل يتميز عمله بالدقة والجودة والانفراد في المحيط حيث انه يريد ايضا ان يزيد من مدخوله حتى يتمكن من بيع ايضا الغسالات والبرادات وتصليح الادوات الكهربائية له زبائن من المحيط والجيران وهو يحب هذا العمل منذ صغره ويطمح بأن يمتلك محل اوسع ويصبح مؤسسة تجارية
texts.en: Youssef is 26 years old and unmarried. He works in the sale and maintenance of electricity generators and automatic generators. He has been doing this for 2 years. He works hard and with precision, and his business is unique in his local area. He wants to develop his business by renewing his shop and by purchasing new stock. He wants to secure a good future for himself so that he is able to settle down with his own family. He is also supports his parents as he is caring and and comes from a close-knit family. He loves his work and with this loan he wants to purchase new stock and renovate his shop. He wants to increase his income so that he can purchase washing machines, refrigerators, and repair electrical appliances. He has customers from amongst his neighbours and his local area. He has loved this line of work since he was young and aspires to own a bigger store and become a commercial enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase new stock and renovate his shop

loans.name: Valerik

texts.en:
Valerik was born in 1953. He lives in Jujevan village, Tavush Marz. Valerik is married and has two sons who are already married. His younger son’s family lives with Valerik.
 
Over 33 years Valerik has been worked at Jujevan village’s school and simultaneously he has been engaged in farming and shopkeeping. In his shop he sells foods and household goods. Valerik’s family helps him to manage farming and trading and thereby they meet their needs.
 
Valerik is seeking a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy food items such as a large amount of flour, sugar, etc., and some household goods for his shop.
 
This is Valerik’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon and he has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To buy large amount of flour, sugar, etc. and some household goods to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Drocella

texts.en:
Drocella is 30 years old and is married with four children between the ages 3 and 10 years old. Her business is well-organized and she sells beans in her business. Drocella employees two people to help her and she has four years of experience.

Drocella has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more beans to sell. With these profits, Drocella will reinvest in her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy eggs, bread, beans, rice, coffee and corn.

loans.name: Puca Puca Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Puca Puca, inicia su ciclo 6 con 13 socias las cuales tienen diversos negocios como la venta D.: cereales, ropa, anticuchos, comida, verduras, carne, leña y otras se dedican a la carpinteria.
Jesusa, es la Presidenta para el presente ciclo, tiene una carpintería, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D.: madera, cola y clavos. 
Jesusa trabaja con la ayuda D. su hijo, fabrican mesas, sillas, puertas, ventanas, roperos, reposteros, pasamanos, etc. Está en FINCA Perú, desD. hace 4 ciclos, le agrada por la facilidad con que recibe los préstamos, se trabaja a base D. confianza, ingresó por la invitación D. su hermana con cierta duda, pero ahora está feliz, gracias a sus ahorros y semillita se pudo comprar un máquina sepilladora para su carpintería, ahora está ahorrando para comprarse otras máquinas.
texts.en:
The Puca Puca community bank has started their sixth loan with 13 members who have a variety of businesses including the sale of grain, clothing, kebab, food, vegetables, meat and firewood. Others make a living in carpentry. 

Jesusa is the president for the current loan and she has a carpentry workshop. She will invest the requested loan into the purchase of wood, glue and nails.

Jesusa works with the help of her son. They make tables, chairs, windows, wardrobes, pantries, banisters, etc. She has participated in FINCA Perú for the past four loans. She appreciates the ease with which she receives the loans, working with trust. She entered the group through an invitation from her sister, hesitantly at first, but now she is happy. Thanks to her savings and the loan she was able to buy a wood planning machine for her workshop. Now she is saving to purchase other machines.

loans.use: to buy wood, glue and nails.

loans.name: Caurie Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 18 mai 2007. Il est  composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Mama qui est assise  à la droite de la photo sur la chaise verte est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge quatre autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de poissons frais. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle  pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (scolarité, nourriture, etc.…)
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on May 18, 2007. It is composed of fifteen women who live in the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Mama, who is seated in a green chair at the right in the photo, is the group's official. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She also supports four other children who are entrusted to her by her parents. She is active in selling fresh fish and has good experience in this business domain for having worked in it for several years. 

This loan will enable her to boost her capital and to develop her business further. The profits will allow her to improve her family’s situation (schooling, food, etc.)

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Basti

texts.es: Basti tiene 28 años, viven en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 9 y 1 año, sus dos sobrinos y su esposo con quien trabaja mucho para poder dar una buena educacio0n a sus hijos y sobrinos, ya que ella considera muy importante para el futuro de ellos. Basti se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo y cuando hay oportunidad de poder entrar en un nuevo negocio dice si al reto e incursiona en el que ella cree conveniente y le generará ganancias. Entre las demás actividades que realiza esta el de vender zapatos y ropa, los productos que vende los ofrece entre sus conocidos y familiares, y eso le genera muy buena ganancia ya que se necesita de poca inversión y comisiona un buen porcentaje. Pero la ganancia de Basti esta mas en comprar productos en oferta y luego venderlos en precio normal generándole un porcentaje muy alto. Ahora ella junto a su esposa están incursionando en los venta de alimentos y esta próxima a aperturar una polleria el cual espera le vaya bien como le ha ido hasta ahora en sus demás actividades. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP y se siente cómoda trabajando con la institución ya que en el grupo en el que está es un grupo unido y todos se llevan bien. Con los 1000 soles que solicita, comprará zapatos y productos de catalogo, entre ellos artículos para el hogar, que están de oferta para que pueda tener en stock.
texts.en:
Basti, 28, lives in her own house with her two children who are 9 and 1 years old, her two nephews and her husband with whom she works hard to provide good education for her children and nephews because she considers that very important for their future.

Basti sells merchandise via catalogue and when the opportunity to go into a new area presents itself she says yes to the challenge and goes into whatever she considers convenient that will generate profits.  Among the many activities she carries out is the sale of shoes and clothes.  She sells these products among her acquaintances and family members and this generates good profits since the investment needed is small and commissions are a good percentage.  However, Basti’s profits depend more on her being able to buy products that are on special and then reselling them at regular prices thus generating a very high percentage profit.   She and her husband are now going to go into food sales and are about to open a chicken shop where she hopes she will do as well as she’s done in her other activities.

This is the 6th MFP loan and she feels comfortable working with the institution because the group she’s in is a very united group and they all get along very well with each other.  She will use the requested 1000 soles to buy shoes and catalog items, among them items for the home, that are on sale to have in stock.

loans.use: to buy shoes and articles for the home.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William, tiene la edad 32 de  años, está casado y vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito comprar insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal este próximo año. El lo que va comprar específicamente es el abono y productos para aplicar al cultivo para mejorar la calidad de las matas y así aumentar la cosecha próxima. El cuenta con el terreno establecido ya desde varios años atrás y con una plantación en condiciones regulares por lo cual quiere asistirlo y mejorarlo. El tiene como meta aumentar las cosechas y generar mayores ingresos económicos para darle a su familia cada día una mejor calidad de vida. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
William, aged 32, is married and lives with his 2 children and his wife, who are his highest priority. 

He intends to use the loan to buy supplies for tending to his coffee plantation for the coming year.  Specifically, he is going to buy manure and products to apply to the crop to improve the quality of the plants, and so increase his next harvest.  He can count on land that has already been already established for several years, and a plantation in fair condition which he wants to tend to and improve. 

His goal is to increase his harvests and generate more income to give his family a better quality of life on a daily basis.  

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken other loans previously from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to tend to his coffee crops.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced and has 3 children who all go to school. She sells charcoal which she works seven days a week. 

She has requested  for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO from to buy more bags of charcoal Her business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of charcoal and the rainy season. Her goal is to educate her children up to the university level and also to start going to villages for charcoal. 

She lives in her own house and the family has no access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Veronica Mwezu

texts.en:
Veronica is a 57-year-old widowed woman with four children ranging in age from 18 to 30. She describes herself as someone who enjoys sharing ideas with others. Veronica runs rental housing and lodging services for travelers. Her biggest business challenge is an area water shortage. 

Veronica is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase a plastic water tank to increase her water storage capacity. She hopes that in five years she will own an estate in town and have the young children in her family complete school and own their own property in future.

loans.use: to purchase a plastic water storage tank

loans.name: 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama 3 de Mayo está conformado por la señora Tomasa va a comprar con su préstamo un comal de gas, carne, tortillas, platos y vasos, la señora Yolanda Cleofás va a comprar refrescos por caja, la señora Maribel va a comprar leña por carga, la señora Cleotilde va a comprar pollo por kilo, la señora Cristina va a comprar maíz por carga. La señora Yolanda Cleofás tiene 45 años de edad, ella es casada tiene un niño de 2 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el tercer año de primaria, ella vende refrescos, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar refrescos, jugos y botellas de agua, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años de poquito en poquito, su negocio es importante porque va teniendo ingresos para comprar la comida, ella se siente orgullosa de vender refrescos y darles fiados los refrescos a sus clientes y el día sábado pasan a pagarle, ella está planeando vender maíz y leña y lo piensa lograr con el préstamo, ella está feliz con este préstamo por que se va a surtir de refrescos de diferentes sabores y botellitas de agua purificada para proporcionar mejor servicio al cliente, sus sueños y esperanzas son si Dios le presta vida poner una tienda de abarrotes, espera que su niño crezca sano y poderle dar estudios. Las integrantes del grupo le dan las gracias a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad por el apoyo  que les dan, con estos préstamos les favorecen a crecer sus negocio y seguir trabajando para mejorar las familias.
texts.en: This solidarity group is called the 3 de Mayo. It consists of Senora Tomasa who with her loan is going to buy a gas griddle, meat, tortillas, plates and glasses; Senora Yolanda who will buy soft drinks by the case; Senora Maribel who is going to buy firewood by the truckload; Senora Cleotilde who is going to buy chicken by the kilo; Senora Cristina who is going to buy corn by the truckload. Senora Yolanda Cleofás is 45 years old, married and has a 2 year old son. She studied until the thrid grade. She sells soft drinks, fruit juices and bottles of water. She started her business 3 years ago little by little. Her business is important because it provides her with an income with which to buy food. She feels proud of selling drinks and that she can trust her clients to come and pay her on Saturdays. She is planning on selling corn and firewood and is hoping to achieve this with this loan. She is happy with this loan as it will enable her to stock soft drinks of different flavours and bottles of purified water to provide her clients with a better service. Her hopes and dreams are that if 'Dios le presta vida' (God gives her life) to set up a grocery store. She hopes her son will grow up healthy and also hopes to give him an education. The members of the group thank Kiva and the Fundacion Realidad for the support they provide. These loans will encourage them to grow their businesses and continue working to improve their families.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and bottles of water.

loans.name: Julia Isabel

texts.es: La señora Julia  es cliente antigua de nuestra institución  ella vive en la casa de su mamá quien también es nuestra cliente ambas trabajan con puntualidad en sus pagos, La familia de la Sra. Julia esta integrada por  dos niños en edad escolar su esposo trabaja en provincias aledañas de La ciudad de La Paz (yungas), la señora se dedica a la venta de comida y venta de refrescos desde hace bastante tiempo, ella vende por su zona donde hay una cancha césped sintético y también en las fiestas que hay por la zona, ella requiere el préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de un cuarto ya que vive solo en un cuarto bastante estrecho y una cocina pequeña y con la construcción desea brindar comodidad a su familia  motivo por cual se les solicita el financiamiento Kiva.
texts.en:
Julia’s a longstanding client of our institution.  She lives in her mother’s house who is also a client of ours.  They both make their payments punctually.  

Julia’s family consists of two young, school age, children and her husband who works in provinces (Yungas) adjacent to the city of La Paz.

She has been working selling food and soft-drinks for quite some time now.  She sells in her neighborhood where there is a synthetic grass playing field and also at the local festivals in her area.

She needs the loan to buy building materials and supplies to build a room because she lives in a cramped single room with just a very small kitchen.  With this construction she hopes to provide her family with more comfort and this is why she’s asking for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Hussnieh

texts.en:
Hussnieh is a 46-year-old married woman from A. Russeifeh, Jordan with five children.

Hussnieh is selling blankets from her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase more blankets to meet the increased demands for her products.

Hussnieh is looking to increase her living income so that she can finance the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more blankets to sell

loans.name: Tiền

texts.en:
Tiền is a 56-year-old woman living in a town in Yen Phong district - Bac Ninh province.  She is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Tiền owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Tiền has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Tiền joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tiền has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,288,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  Tiền is now requesting a new loan of 9,184,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  This will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Tiền plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tiền là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yen Phong - distict - Bac Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, Tiền Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Tiền thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tiền kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, Tiền đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tiền đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.184.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Tiền dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en:
Banzragch is a loving father of four who is disabled. His wife is a janitor. His eldest daughter works in city, his middle two are college students, and his youngest child is unemployed. Banzragch started his carpentry business in 1985 at home. He makes gers (Mongolian yurts), wooden walls, and Mongolian traditional furniture. Now that winter is approaching, he needs to update his equipment due to high business demand. 

Banzragch is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy timber and other materials. He is a strong and hardworking man who says, “I have four wonderful children. I will do everything I can in order to get them educated.”

loans.use: to buy timber and other materials

loans.name: Heliconias Group

texts.es:
El grupo D. Heliconias(Flores silvestres) esta integrado por 10 personas las cuales viven en una comunidad que se caracteriza por que su gente es muy humilD. y trabajadora y su principal actividad economica es el cultivo D. naranja y cafe.

La señora Lidia es uno D. los integrantes D. este grupo, ella tiene la edad D. 31 años, estudio hasta el segundo semestre D. preparatoria y esta casada con el señor Plutarco que trabaja en el campo como jornalero y tiene una pequeña hija.

Doña Lidia es una mujer muy trabajadora y platica que desD. hace mas D. 11 años rento un pequeño local en el cual inicio a vender verduras poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo inicio a vender tambien un poco D. ropa galletas y regalos.

Ella platica que su negocio ha crecido a base del esfuerzo y empeño que ella ha puesto, tambien nos comenta que sale a vender sus productos a las comunidades en una camioneta y se venD. bastante. ella dijo: "Trabajo siempre va a haber y a mi me sobran ganas D. salir adelante"

Eela invertira su credito en la compra D. flor, pan, galletas, ropa(playeras, short, camisas, vestidos), frutas, verduras y refrescos.

Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere y asi pueda dar a su hija una mejor calidad D. vida y en un futuro pueda asistir a la universidad.

"muchas gracias"

los demas integrantes del grupo son:

Carmen venta D. ropa
Hilaria venta D. ropa
Grisel venta D. catalago 
Arisbeth venta D. ropa
Rosa Imelda venta D. ropa 
Monica estetica
Magdalena taqueria
Xichil Papeleria
Adilene zapateria
texts.en:
The “Heliconias” (wild flowers) group has 10 members who live in a community noted for its residents who are very humble and hardworking; the main economic activity is growing oranges and coffee.

Lidia is one of the group members.  She’s 31 years old and finished second semester of high school.  She’s married to Plutarco who works as a day laborer in the fields and she has a little girl.

Lidia is a very hardworking woman who relates that she rented a small locale 11 years ago and started selling vegetables.  Little by little and with much effort she also started to sell a bit of clothes, cookies and gifts.

She relates that the business has grown based on effort and dedication she’s put into it.  She also tells us that she goes out to other communities to sell her wares in a pick-up truck and she sells quite a bit.  She said: “There will always be work and I have more than enough desire to get ahead.”

She will use the loan to buy flowers, bread, cookies, clothes (t-shirts, shorts, shirts and dresses), fruit, vegetables and soft-drinks.  She hopes that with this investment her business will prosper so that she can give her daughter a better quality of life and in future she can attend university.

“Thank you very much”

The other group members are:

Carmen – clothing sales
Hilaria – clothing sales
Grisel – catalogue sales
Arisbeth – clothing sales
Rosa Imelda – clothing sales
Monica – beauty salon
Magdalena – taco stand
Xochil – stationery shop
Adilene – shoe store

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, flowers, clothes and cookies.

loans.name: Tserenbyamba

texts.en: Tserenbyamba is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. Her eldest kid is a school student, and her youngest one goes to kindergarden. She started her car-part retailing business in 2006 by renting a container in a local market. Her business has gone well, so she decided to expand her business by renting another container in the market. She already rented another container. However, her supplies are not sufficient to run a whole container. Therefore, she is requesting 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase oil and spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase oil and spare parts

loans.name: Sevelina

texts.en:
Sevelina is aged 31, single and a mother of 2 adult children. She has been in farming for 15 years with her produce of eggs going to the local market.

Sevelina has made a loan request with Juhudi Kilimo for 50,000 KES to help her boost her poultry business by buying more birds. She says this will boost her farming to large scale and allow her to enjoy the economies of this scale. She adds that her first loan with Juhudi Kilimo of a similar amount made life bearable and she remains optimistic about her future in farming and income in general. She notes, however, with regret, the high costs of feeds.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is aged sixty-two and produces tea, milk and coffee in her home area of Muranga for the local market.  She has forty-five years of experience in farming and is married with eight grown-up children.

Lucy has made a loan request of KES 53,000 to buy and insure a dairy cow.  She says the additional dairy income will make her family more secure financially.  She hopes the her milk output will grow to one hundred litres per day.

Lucy appreciates Juhudi Kilimo loan services but she states that recurrent drought is a challenge to farmers in the area.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 25 year old married woman with three children. Two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling bread in kator south Sudan for four years.
