Margret is requesting this loan through BRAC south Sudan to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Leonila has a shop that sells fish like sardines, trout & mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.
Leonila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leonila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Gnarisso Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe  Gnarisso Benkadi  4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles traditionnelles à  Soké, un des villages de San, 4ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : l’arachide  avec  SALI ,1ere assise en écharpe noire à la tête,  sur  la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter, des petits matériels agricoles, des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir : 0,5 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village et au marché de San, après la récolte, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Gnarisso Benkadi 4 group are married women who average 38 years of age and 6 children each. They all live in traditional families in Soké, one of the villages of the commune of San (fourth administrative region of Mali).

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to bring their farming activities to a successful conclusion during the rainy season.

This is their second loan with the institution. Previous loans have been duly repaid.

Sali cultivates groundnuts. In the photo, she is in the front row, first from the right, and has a black shawl wrapped around her. 

With her loan, Sali is planning to buy some light farming equipment, agricultural inputs and seeds. She will also pay for the cost of plowing on 0.5 hectare of land.

Production will be sold after the harvest, at the village level and at the San market, to a customer base which consists of men and women.

Sali is expecting average profits to reach 85,000 CFA francs per season. These profits will help her to repay her loan and to support her husband in taking care of the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of plowing, to buy agricultural inputs, light farming equipment and seeds.

loans.name: Burungu Tukwatanize Group

texts.en:
Sylivia is a 31-year-old woman with three children living in Fort Portal,Uganda. She has a personal goal of educating her children and upgrading her studies.

Sylivia has been farming for the last 2 years and used her personal savings to buy land. She faces hardships of seasonal weather and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. She has a vision of expanding her farming activities to new areas and venturing into mechanized agriculture.

Sylivia needs a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers. She is a member of the above mentioned group, where each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan.Out of the sixteen members only ten took the only and the rest had to appear in the photo as per the group policy.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Pedro Luis

texts.es:
Pedro es un joven emprendedor, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Sunampe junto a su familia. Tiene un hijo quien es su mayor motivación en la vida y por quien lucha constantemente para salir adelante. Desde hace más de 3 años trabaja transportando a personas a diferentes lugares de la ciudad en una mototaxi que tiene. Es una persona con muchos deseos de superación y quiere brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Pedro está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá remodelar su vivienda, como pintarrajear las paredes, y comprar un juego de comedor para su casa. De esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y vivir de manera cómoda.
texts.en:
Pedro is a young entrepreneur. He is 21 years old, single, and lives in Sunampe with his family. He has a son who is his primary motivation in life and for whom he strives constantly to get ahead. For more than three years, he has worked transporting people to different places in the city in his mototaxi. He is a person with dreams of getting ahead and he wants to afford his family with a better quality of life. 

Pedro is thankful for the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, he will be able to remodel his home including plastering the walls and purchasing a dining set for his house. This way he will improve his quality of life and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to remodel his home.

loans.name: Yelba Emilia

texts.es:
Doña Yelba tiene 60 años de edad, es muy reconocida en la zona donde vive ya que trabajo durante 22 años en la Alcaldía  como secretaria, debido a su experiencia y años de trabajar manejando materia judicial le asignaron casos penales, contravencionales y de pensiones; por recomendación médica ella debió retirarse del puesto para lograr nuevamente un equilibrio en su vida. Después de pensionarse ella quería invertir su liquidación en algo realmente importante, fue ahí donde recordó que su esposo iba abandonar la talabartería que tanto le había costado iniciar ya hace 10 años, pero por falta de capital fijo no podía continuar, en ese momento doña Yelba pensó en invertir su liquidación en la compra de equipo para la talabartería familiar. Desde el momento que ella se involucró más en la actividad notaron mejoras y aumento de clientela ya que lo que le corresponde realizar a doña Yelba hasta el día de hoy son las negociaciones, compra de materia prima y las giras para entregar la mercadería.La talabartería tiene 20 años de funcionar y doña Yelba participa activamente en ella desde hace 10 años. Necesita invertir el monto solicitado en la compra de materia prima ya que la última inversión que se realizo fue para comprar una troqueladora Industrial que les facilitara el trabajo y para trabajar con mayor rapidez, porque los clientes demandan mayor cantidad de productos. Y la materia prima con la que cuentan es para confeccionar unos asientos que le solicitaron y no para los artículos de souvenirs que tanto vende.Este negocio de la talabartería siempre ha sido de calidad y con un excelente acabado ya que cuentan con las máquinas necesarias que logran ese acabado, sus productos son muy variados y siempre llevan un sello costarricense ya que reflejan nuestra cultura con su arte, confeccionan desde aretes, llaveros, monederos, bolsos, fajas, pulseras y demás productos de cuero. Estos productos los venden especialmente en los lugares turísticos de Costa Rica.
En esta talabartería los encargados de confeccionar los productos son el esposo de doña Yelba y dos de sus hijos, en época alta como lo son estos meses contratan a dos vecinos nicaragüenses que ya cuentan con la suficiente experiencia para colaborar. Además cuentan con contador que les lleva todas las cuentas cuando lo solicitan. Doña Yelba agradece si se le apoya con rapidez ya que estos meses son los de mayor demanda y aún no cuenta con materia prima para confeccionar lo que le han solicitado.
texts.en:
69-year old Sra. Yelba is well known in the community where she lives as she worked as a secretary in the town hall for 22 years. Because of her experience and years of dealing with judicial material, she was given criminal, controversial, and pension cases. As a result of a medical recommendation, she had to retire and return to a calmer life.

After retiring, Yelba wanted to use the money she was given for something really important. She explained that her husband was going to quit the leather goods shop which had cost a lot to set up ten years earlier. Because of a lack of capital, he couldn't continue. So Yelba decided to spend her retirement money on machinery for the family leather goods store.

As soon as she became involved in the business, they observed improvements and an increase in customers. Now she runs the business, buys supplies, and delivers the products. The store has been running for twenty years, and Yelba has been involved for the last ten.

She is seeking a loan to buy supplies as the last loan was used to buy an industrial press to make the work easier and faster as customers were asking for a larger quantity of products.

As well, the materials they had were for seats and not for the souvenirs they sell so many of. Their merchandise has always been of high quality with fine finishings since they have the machines that do this work. They make a wide range of products which always carry a Costa Rican stamp reflecting the local culture and art. Among the products they make are leather ear rings, key rings, wallets, bags, belts, and bracelets.
The items are sold in tourist places in Costa Rica.

In this particular leather store the people who make the products are Yelba's husband and two of their children. In the high season two experienced Nicaraguan neighbors are hired. As well they have an accountant who deals with the finances. Sra. Yelba would be  grateful for a quick response to her request for a loan as this is the time of year when there is a high demand for their products. They do not have enough supplies on hand to fulfill the orders they have.

loans.use: Buy supplies for their leather goods business

loans.name: Socorro Maribel

texts.en: Mi nombre es Socorro Z., me dedico a la produccion y venta de tortillas de maiz, tengo mi negocio hace 5 años Y mis hijos me ayudan a la venta, tengo clientes muy buenos y fijos ya que mis clientes son mis vecinos y tambien hago contrato con mercaditos y pulperias para la venta de las tortillas, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion y con las utilidades que tenga deseo hacer mejoras a mi casa, criar a mis hijos y sustentar de mi hogar

loans.use: Compra de harina de maiz, sal, cal, leña, fosforos, carbon, agua,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: para poder comprar: víveres y embutidos

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe is a native of Garcia, in the state of Nuevo León. She has three children who currently attend school. She was laid off from her job due to personnel cuts. She decided to use her severance pay to start her own business selling fabric and footwear, with the goal of providing for her children's needs and improving her family's quality of life.

Maria would like to allow her business to grow. She now needs a loan of $275 to purchase a copy machine, as she knows that offering this service will increase her sales and achieve greater profitability. You can be a fundamental part of the lives of Maria and her family by helping her in the growth of her business. Don’t hesitate any longer.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Guadalupe es originaria de García, del estado de Nuevo León, tiene tres hijos, que se encuentran estudiando, ella fue despedida de su trabajo por recorte de personal, con su liquidación ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio, con la venta de mercería y calzado, con el objetivo de dales lo necesario a sus hijos y mejora las calidad de vida de su familia.

Maria desea que su negocio pueda crecer, ahora necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $275 dólares que empleará en la compra de una copiadora, porque sabe que al ofrecer este servicio se incrementaran sus ventas y podrá obtener una mayor utilidad. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en la vida de Maria y de su familia, apoyándola en el crecimiento de su negocio, no lo pienses más.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan is married and has three little children with the youngest child being in kindergarten. His wife helps him with his grocery story business. He started his business because he had to buy medicine for his mother who was sick. Previously he worked as a driver and his salary was not enough to cover their expenses, so he decided to start his own business. Three years ago he began his business because a neighbor said he could sell him a grocery store. Juan saw that it would be a good opportunity and bought it.

Juan is requesting a loan of $375 to purchase merchandise and supply a greater assortment of products to his clients. He is offering to repay this loan in 6 months. He and his family thank you for the support that you give him.

Translated from the original Spanish by Admic Nacional staff

Juan esta casado y tiene 3 hijos pequeños, estando el menor en el kinder, su esposa lo ayuda en el negocio de abarrotes que tiene. Él inicio su negocio por la necesidad de ayudar a su mamá con los medicamentos que tenía que tomar, ya que la tenía enferma, y el antes trabajaba como chofer y sus ingresos no cubrían esta necesidad, por ello es que decidió poner su propio negocio. Hace tres años atrás fue cuando el empezó con su negocio que fue una oportunidad, ya que una vecina le dijo que le podía vender su negocio de abarrotes y Juan vio que sería una buena opción y la tomó.

Juan esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para comprar mercadería y así abastecer su negocio y poder tener mayor surtido de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and supply his clients with a great assortment of products

loans.name: Mery

texts.en:
Mery Mamani Torrez, is a member of the Rocío de la Mañana Association from Villa Adela, in the city of El Alto and she works as a Secretary of Acts for this association. Married and mother of two children, Mery dedicates her work to manufacturing and selling children’s clothing, dresses and jackets, products that she will start to sell early in the morning in different fairs. With the purpose of earning more profits, Mery travels regularly to Desaguadero, a location where she has a set clientele that buys her products. Her tailoring and clothing workshop has been operating for the last five years and was inherited from her family, from whom she learned her profession. Currently, she owns a thriving workshop that she administers along with her husband and they have all the machinery necessary for this activity. Mery requires capital in order to penetrate the tailoring and manufacturing of jeans, which generates more profits, but at the same time requires a solid investment.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer

Mery Mamani Torrez, pertenece a la Asociación Rocío de la Mañana de Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto, cumpliendo funciones de Secretaria de Actas de dicha asociación. Casada, y madre de dos hijos, Mery se dedica a la confección y venta de ropa para niños, vestidos y chamarras, los que comercializa muy temprano en la mañana en diferentes ferias. Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos, Mery viaja constantemente a la localidad de Desaguadero, donde ya cuenta con clientela fija que compra sus productos. Su taller de costura y confección funciona hace 5 años, fue heredado de su familia, de quienes aprendió el oficio. En la actualidad cuenta con un prospero taller que administra al lado de su esposo, y cuentan con maquinaria necesaria para esta actividad. Mery precisa de capital para poder incursionar en la costura y confección de jeans, producto que genera muchas más ganancias, pero que al mismo tiempo requiere de una fuerte inversión.

loans.use: Mery requires capital in order to penetrate the tailoring and manufacturing of jeans, which generates more profits, but at the same time requires a solid investment.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is divorced with one daughter. She lives in Zaporozhye, Ukraine and works in one of the local markets selling pet foods and accessories. There are very few other vending kiosks selling the same type of products. Oksana has been in this trade for 7 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about $10000. Her monthly net profit is about $1000.

Oksana is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a third vending facility and expand her business in the market. She is committed to the success of her venture and is willing to learn and work hard to be better at what she does. We think Oksana’s ability to find her niche, put her customers' needs first and take care of them will be instrumental to her businesses' success.

loans.use: Oksana would like to purchase a third vending kiosk selling pet food & accessories.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia’s desire of improving her life has endowed her with many abilities. Day after day she works incessantly selling food and managing her little grocery kiosk, which is installed on the corner in her hometown of Saños Grande, so that she may offer daily food to her family. When she was eighteen, her mother granted her so many lessons and developed in her sales talents. Celia feels very satisfied to be an important provider for the household economy and she works hard to support the wellbeing of her family. Her oldest son would like to contribute to her goal by adding a bakery in her little stand to supply fresh bread daily. They plan to continue working to save up and make their new investment idea happen.

For this goal, Celia requests a loan to buy a greater quantity of everyday goods. Support Celia; she awaits your important decision.

Translated from Spanish by Jian and Ryan of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteers

Los deseos de superación de Celia la han dotado de muchas habilidades. Día a día trabaja incesantemente para poder brindarle el sustento a su familia vendiendo comidas y atendiendo su pequeño kiosco de abarrotes instalado en una esquina de su comunidad natal de Saños Grande, desde hace dieciocho años, cuando su mamá le otorgó estas enseñanzas y desarrolló en ella la habilidad comercial. Celia se siente muy satisfecha de ser una protagonista importante en la economía de su hogar y se esfuerza por mantener el bienestar dentro de su hogar. Su hijo mayor deseoso de contribuir con esta tarea le ha propuesto implementar una panadería en su pequeña vivienda para abastecer a su localidad con el pan diario y se ha propuesto seguir trabajando para ahorrar y con ello emprender la materialización de su nueva inversión.

Con este fin solicita un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de artículos de primera necesidad; apoya a Celia, ella aguarda tu importante respuesta.

loans.use: Buy a greater quantity and variety of groceries.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene is a hard-working family woman who, in spite of her partner’s abandonment, has fought hard to work her way forward. Her role is making crates to sell to area fruit sellers; additionally, she is supported by a small store she has set up that sufficiently meets her household expenses. In spite of having an enormous responsibility, she has not stopped devoting herself to her work and to her daughters. She has also begun to plant coffee, but she is only able to do this sporadically as a substitute for other activities. Her three daughters are her main motivation, and being with them is the most important thing to her. That’s why she wants to remodel her crate-making facility and expand her store. Let’s help with this request so that her load is lightened, and all that she proposes can become reality.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Marlene, es una trabajadora madre D. familia que a pesar del abandono D. su pareja a luchado para progresar a base D. mucho esfuerzo, desempeñando el oficio D. elaboración D. cajones para ofertarlos a los comerciantes D. frutas D. su localidad, como un apoyo más ha acondicionado una pequeña bodega L. cual le ayuda a sostener satisfactoriamente los gastos del hogar.A pesar D. tener Una inmensa responsabilidad no deja D. consagrarse a sus trabajos y a sus hijas y también empezó a sembrar café, pero esta labor L. realiza esporádicamente para suplir algunas otras necesidades. Las tres hijas que tiene son su principal motivo trabajo y el estar con ellas es lo más importante, por esta razón desea remodelar su cajonería y ampliar su tienda. Colaboremos con su petición para que su carga se aliviane y concrete todo lo que se ha propuesto.

loans.use: Remodeling her crate-making business and purchasing a greater quantity of highly needed goods for her small store.

loans.name: Bimal

texts.en:
Bimal Dongol lives in a single family with her husband and a son in Khogana, Lalitpur. Khogana village is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Her husband, Mr. Raju Dongol, is a carpenter in his own furniture shop. Due to economic problems, her son went to Malaysia to earn money.

Mrs. Dongol is a farmer in Thecho Village. She prefers to grow seasonal vegetables on her own land. She sells her vegetables in the local market in the morning and in the evening.

Now she is requesting her fifth loan of Rs 30000 to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en:
I am Parween A. from the small city of Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. I have four children: three girls and one boy. All of my children attend school except for my youngest daughter who is not of school-going age yet. I send my children to school so that they can become good citizens. This is my third loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. My husband operates a wholesale business of sweets and candies. He hopes to improve his business by obtaining a loan to invest in his business. My group members who are also in need of loans are:

Basheera B., who wants to buy a cow; and

Khursheed B., who is borrowing to expand her fruit business.

loans.use: To improve my sweets and candies business

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith is a diligent mother. She and her husband make an excellent pair, who with effort and work want to improve their financial situation. For her part, she has dedicated her attention to a Cybercafe which they established in their own home. They achieved this dream thanks to a loan which they received through a group of partners. She feels very fortunate, due to the fact that her children have become her “right-hand man” and the force that drives her forward. She wishes to improve her establishment by implementing a telephone shop also in the Cybercafe. Meanwhile, her urgent needs are to improve some of the computers that worn out over time and need repair and immediate attention.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

es una madre de familia diligente; ella y su esposo hacen una dupla excelente, con empeño y trabajo quieren mejorar cada día la economía de su hogar, ella por su parte está dedicada a la atención de una cabina de internet, que instaló en su propia casa. Este sueño lo consiguió gracias a un préstamo al que accedió a través de un grupo de socios. Se siente muy afortunada, debido a que sus hijos ahora se han convertido en su brazo derecho y la fuerza que la impulsa a seguir adelante. Desea mejorar su establecimiento implementando en ese mismo lugar un locutorio telefónico, pero mientras tanto sus necesidades urgentes están en mejorar algunas computadoras que con el tiempo se han desgastado y necesitan de reparación y mantenimiento inmediato.

loans.use: Repair her work’s tools.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel B. is forty-eight years old and a businessman. He says with the help of Sinapi he now has his own shop. He is a retailer of used tires of various sizes and has been for the last year. He is a father of three children and the children are currently in school. He wants to use the new loan to expand his operation to include brand new tires to increase his income and also to provide decent shelter for his family. Daniel has a personal guarantor to secure the loan in to repay the loan in case of default.

loans.use: To buy more vehicular tires.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 26 year-old Agatha M., who is widowed and has two children aged 4 and 8. She has one other dependent living with her who attends school in town. In 2000, Agatha established her general store which she operates six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day. She now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of oil, sugar, salt, and soap in bulk. In the future, Agatha plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of oil, sugar, salt, and soap in bulk.

loans.name: Artimiza Fabiao M.

texts.pt:
Artimiza was born in Gaza, is 42 years old, is married, and went to school until fourth grade in the old system, when conditions did not permit her to continue her studies. Mother of one 14-year-old child who is in ninth grade, she is also responsible for her nephew and her parents, who live in Gaza. She sends them 500mt [meticals] every three weeks. In 1980 she moved from the Gaza province to Maputo's Namaacha district to live with her brother who works in the district. In 1992 she married a man who lives with her brother in his own house.

In order to help her husband with the household expenses, Artimiza decided to run her own business. Today she rents two stalls, one in the Namaacha town market and the other in the Boane market. She has two employees who work from 8:00am to 10:00pm and each earn 800mt monthly. The most popular products are 2M national beer, purchased for 230mt per box and sold for 300mt, and box wine stocked at 960mt and sold at 1200mt. Her monthly earnings range from 3000 to 4000mt depending on the seasonal weather and weekends. This allows her to save 1000mt per month.

This is her second loan with Hluvuku [MFI Field Partner] and first with Kiva. The first loan was for 10,000mt that was used to buy merchandise for her stall. She paid back the loan early and requested this second one for the same purpose. As soon as Artimiza finishes this loan, she intends to request a third to build a new stall and make a wall for her home.

Translated from Portuguese by April Newman, Kiva Volunteer.

Artimiza nasceu em Gaza, tem 42 anos de idade e é casada, estudou até 4ªClasse do antigo sistema teve que parar pois as condições já não lhe permitiam continuar mais com os estudos. Mãe de 1 filho de 14 anos de idade que esta frequentar 9ªclasse, responsabiliza se pelo seu sobrinho e seus pais que vivem em Gaza mandando-lhes 500,00mt em cada 3 meses. Em 1980 mudou se da província de Gaza para Maputo distrito de Namaacha para viver com o seu irmão que trabalha neste distrito e em 1992 ela casou se com o marido que vive com ele em sua casa própria.

Artimiza para poder ajudar o seu marido as despesas da casa decide fazer negocio hoje aluga duas barracas, uma cita no mercado da vila da Namaacha e outra no mercado de Boane. Tem dois empregados e trabalham das 8:00h as 22:00h e auferem mensalmente 800,00mt por pessoa. Os produtos com mais saída são as bebidas nomeadamente: 2M Cerveja nacional adquirida por 230,00mt a caixa e vende a 300,00mt, vinho a caixa adquire por 960,00mt e vende por 1200,00mt. Tem rendimento mensal de 3000,00mt a 4000,00mt dependendo da estação do tempo ou final de semana, consegue poupar por mês 1000,00mt.

Este é o segundo empréstimo da Artimiza na Hluvuku e o primeiro no Kiva. O primeiro empréstimo foi de 10000,00mt qual usou para compra de mercadoria para sua barraca e conseguiu pagar antes do prazo estabelecido e pede este segundo para o mesmo fim. Assim que Artimiza concluir pretende pedir o terceiro para construir a sua barraca e fazer um murro em sua casa.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to increase her inventory

loans.name: Mujeres En Ritmo Group

texts.es:
The ladies consisting of this committee are dedicated to various activities, among which we can cite the sale of various merchandise like clothes, shoes, arts, charcoal, cleaning products, makeup, foods, fruits and vegetables, among others.

Because of their limited chances of receiving capital to start their small businesses, now that the financial institutions generally ask for a business reference to give credit, they have applied to the Paraguay Foundation, which not only helped them get capital, but also gave them classes that will help them be better administrators.

So that their children don’t face the same economic and academic limitations that they had when they were younger, these beautiful ladies fight day to day to be able to obtain the financial ability to improve the quality of life for their families.

With the credit they take, they will purchase various merchandise and supplies for their businesses and will raise their incomes. The merchandise to be acquired is: charcoal, fruit, meat, sugar, dairy, cleaning products, art, vegetables, medicinal muds, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Frey, Kiva volunteer.

Las señoras pertenecientes a este comité se dedican a diversas actividades, entre las que podemos citar la venta de mercaderías varias como ropas, zapatos, artesanías, carbón, artículos de limpieza, maquillaje, comidas, frutas y verduras, entre otros.

Debido a que sus posibilidades de conseguir capital para empezar sus pequeños emprendimientos, ya que las entidades financieras por lo general solicitan una basta referencia comercial para otorgar créditos, ellas acudieron a la Fundación Paraguaya que no solo accedió a ayudarlas si no que a la vez reciben capacitaciones que les ayuda a ser mejores administradoras.

Para que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones tanto económicas como académicas que ellas tuvieron de jóvenes, estas bellas mujeres luchan día a día para lograr obtener el ingreso económico suficiente que permita mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Con el crédito que llevarán compraran mercaderías e insumos varios para sus negocios y así lograr aumentar sus ingresos. Las mercaderías a ser adquiridas son: carbón, frutas, carnes, azúcar, lácteos, productos de limpieza, artesanías, verduras, productos de limpieza, barros medicinales, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and supplies

loans.name: Edma Clarisa

texts.es:
Edma is unmarried and is 84 years old, she lives with her brother. She sells general merchandise including clothing, footwear, perfumes, and cosmetics; she travels to Panama and Guatemala to obtain supplies and makes dozens of deliveries to her permanent customers. Ms. T. is not responsible for anyone because she was never married, but she says that one of her greatest dreams is to be able to acquire enough capital in the event that she can no longer continue traveling, and fix her house. 
 Translated from Spanish by Jennie R. Campos, Kiva Volunteer. 

La señora Edma es soltera tiene 84 años de edad vive con un hermano , ella se dedica a la venta de mercaderia en general ropa calzado perfumes cosmeticos y otros viaja a panama y Guatemala a abastecerse y entrega por docena en el mercado teniendo clientes fijos , la señora T. no tiene a cargo a nadie ya que ella nunca se caso, pero manifiesta que uno de sus grandes sueños es poder reunir suficiente capital para el momento en que ella ya no pueda seguir viajando, y acondicionar su casa.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Emereciana Idelfonsa

texts.es:
La señora Emereciana Idelfonsa  C. D. M. vive y tiene su negocio en la Avenida Simón Bolívar Manzana P lote 10 Semirustica  el Bosque Trujillo La Libertad Perú.
A la señora Emereciana a quien con cariño la llaman Chana y tiene 55 años.
Ella recuerda con gratitud a su querida Carabamba, tierra donD. nació y donD. estudió primaria completa, no siguió estudiando porque sus padres pensaban que las mujeres no debían educarse,  eso era cosa D. hombres.
Chana se casó a los 20 años con Amaro Jacobo M. Arroyo  y tuvieron 6 hijos D. los cuales solo 2 dependen D. ella, su esposo no pueD. trabajar por encontrarse delicado D. salud, ahora ayuda a su esposa en el pequeño restaurant.
Ella trabaja en este tipo D. negocio desD. que era soltera, en Carabamba también vendía comida, quesos, quesillos, carne y papas, “Allá también pertenecía a un Banco Comunal” nos dice; “y aquí yo les animé a las señoras para formarlo”.
“Me acuerdo mucho  que con el primer préstamo que me dio Manuela D. 300 soles compré verduras para llevar a Carabamba “comenta  con mucho entusiasmo.
Actualmente venD. 70 almuerzos diarios y cuida mucho la calidad D. su trabajo.
Con este préstamo D.  S/. 1500 soles  que los devolverá en 4 meses, comprará 80  a  100 kilogramos D. pollo y gallina que enviará a Carabamba para ser vendidos y poder tener más capital para su negocio.
Su actual sueño es agrandar su negocio y hacer un gran restaurant con personal capacitado.Emereciana es tesorera en su Banco Comunal Trabajo y Amor.
texts.en:
Ms. Emereciana Idelfonsa C. D. M. lives and runs her business on Simón Bolívar Venue, block P, lot 10 Semirustica Trujillo Forest La Libertad, Perú. Emereciana, whom people lovingly call Chana, is 55 years old. She gratefully remembers her beloved Carabamba, the place where she was born and where she completed elementary school. She did not continue with her studies because her parents believed that women did not need to be educated; that was a man’s thing. Chana got married at the age of 20 with Amaro Jacobo M. Arroyo, and together they had 6 children, two of which are still their dependants. Her husband is unable to work because he is ill, so he now helps his wife with her small restaurant. She has been working in this type of business since she was single. In Carabamba, she also sold food, cheese, milk curd, meat, and potatoes. “I was also a member of a microfinance institute there, and here I motivated the women to start one,” she tells us. “I remember that I purchased vegetables to sell in Carabamba with the first loan of 300 PEN that Manuela gave me,” she comments with much enthusiasm. She currently sells 70 lunches daily, and she is very attentive to her quality of work. With this loan of 1,500.00 PEN, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase 80 to 100 kilograms of chicken, which she will send to Carabamba to be sold so that she can have more business capital. Her current dream is to expand her business and create a big restaurant with a trained staff. Emereciana is treasurer of the Labor and Love microfinance institute.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wholesale poultry (chicken and hens)

loans.name: Rosario De Jesus

texts.es:
Rosario tiene mas de 7 años dedicada a la elaboración y venta de hamacas, ella empezó su negocio ya que necesitaba ganar dinero para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de sus 2 hijos dado que esta actividad se la enseño su mama desde temprana edad decidió a ponerla en practica y así ayudar a mejorar su economía.

Ella solicita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar material de mejor calidad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda ella saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Rosario has been making and selling hammocks for 7 years, she started her business as she needed to earn money to help her husband with the household costs and of her 2 kids. Her mother taught her this activity from an early age and she decided to put it into practice and thereby improve her finances.

She would like a $200 loan, which she will repay over a period of 3 months, to buy better quality material to be able to offer her clients. With your help she will move forward.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wrok materials/comprar material de trabajo

loans.name: Annie Kandy

texts.es:
La señora Annie pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Águilas, ubicado el la Av. Faustino Sánchez Carrión Mz. A Lt. 31, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años de edad, aún no tiene hijos, es casada y su esposo es independiente en su trabajo. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de comida. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de ladrillos al por mayor y para ello tiene el apoyo de su esposo, ambos trabajan y administran el negocio.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará 10 millares de ladrillos. 

Annie esta contenta porque su negocio ha crecido y agradece a Dios por permitirle compartir momentos agradables a lado de su querido esposo.
texts.en:
Ms. Annie P. is a member of the Las Águilas (The Eagles) microfinance institute, located on Faustino Sánchez Carrión Avenue, block A, lot 31, in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 37 years old and does not have any children yet. She is married and her husband is self-employed. She decided to invest the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from Manuela Ramos in food sales. She has been working with this microfinance institute for 5 years. She currently sells bricks wholesale, with the help of her husband. Both of them work and manage the business. With this 3,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will purchase 10 thousand bricks. Annie is happy because her business has grown. She thanks God for allowing her to share pleasant moments alongside her beloved husband.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ten thousand bricks

loans.name: Hang

texts.vi: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007. Hiện nay công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi và dịch vụ làm đầu, chăm sóc sắc đẹp cho chị em phụ nữ. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm một số trang thiết bị đầu tư cho cửa hàng
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Hang is 26 years old, and joined TYM fund in 2007. Presently the main sources of income for her family are raising farm animals, and a beauty salon to do hair and make-up for women. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 550 USD to purchase additional beauty supplies for her salon.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Soolefai

texts.en:
Soolefai H., 24, is single with no children. She has several years' experience in the Elei (handmade traditional printed cloth) business. She sells to young people and the general public 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.

Soolefai expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Soolefai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy fabric paints, brushes, printing boards and fabrics to run the business.

loans.use: Purchase rollers, fabric paint, brushes, printing boards, and fabrics

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La señora Andrea es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Brisas del Rio Blanco”, reside en el Barrio Chipana, Av. 19 de Setiembre, distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 47 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene cinco hijos, asimismo posee estudios de primaria completa.
Trabaja desde hace tres años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, se dedica en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes; su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que destinó a la compra de mas mercadería para su tienda.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles le servirá como capital adicional para poder completar la mercadería en su tienda, es decir comprar bebidas, arroz en saco, azúcar, enlatados, etc.; los ingresos surgidos de su negocio lo viene invirtiendo en la educación superior de uno de sus hijos y el sustento familiar diario; agradece a Manuela Ramos por su confianza y apoyo y se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo en cinco cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Andrea is a member of "Las Brisas del Río Blanco" Communal Bank. She lives on Avenida 19 de Septiembre in the Chipana neighborhood, located in the Pilcuyo district of El Collao province in the state of Puno. She is 47 years old, married with five children and has a 6th grade education. She has worked for three years with the Manuela Ramos Movement and has a general store. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy merchandise for her store. This loan of 3,000 soles will serve as additional capital to be used to purchase more merchandise for the store; in other words to buy soft drinks, bags of rice, sugar, canned goods, etc. The income generated from the business is invested in the higher education of one of her children and used to pay her family's daily expenses. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for their trust and support. She promises to repay the loan on time in five monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a general store

loans.name: Koem Sieng

texts.en: Mrs. Koem Sieng C. lives in Boeung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land used to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Dorn Sina, is a popular musician who is hired to perform at wedding ceremonies, parties, and so on. They do not earn enough money to build a kitchen. Therefore, Mrs. Koem Sieng C. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings in order to build the kitchen for her family. She is 45 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory and the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a kitchen for her family.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is a vendor of vegetables and traditional snacks and delicacies in their village in Uddiawan Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. Her husband Crisanto is working as a farmer. She and her husband are striving to live a progressive life by improving their small enterprises. She usually roams around their place going from one house to another to sell her products and earns a weekly income of PHP 600 that she uses as rolling capital in making traditional snacks. She dreams of buying her own pedicab (a bike with three wheels) that will be of great help to her vending business. However, she lacks capital for her business improvement, thus she is hoping to borrow PHP 5,000.

“If there’s no pain, there’s no gain,” Elizabeth said. She has proven this quotation in the past years in which she really had a hard time sending her three children to school, but with the cooperation of her husband and children, she has been able to send them to school and have them finish their studies which are their greatest accomplishment.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Asana

texts.en:
Asana H. is a 29 year old woman, and is married with two kids. All her children are in school. Asana is a Muslim by birth and a very resourceful mother. Her daily dream is to be able work hard to provide her kids with a quality education for better future careers. She believes this will happen, as she is determined to support her children. Her husband is a government worker. They live together in Eguase in the central region of Ghana.

She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc. to increase her stock. She hopes to save more to finance her kids’ school fees. She will be grateful for your loan support. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Kronkronye Name’ which literally means ‘God’s Holiness’.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil, etc.

loans.name: Bigué

texts.fr: Bigué S. est une femme mariée, âgée de 44 ans. Elle envisage avec ce prêt de renforcer son petit commerce de fruits pour mieux augmenter ses revenus et contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Bigué S. is a married woman who is 44 years old. She envisions using this loan to bolster her small fruit business in order to increase her revenues and to help with day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell fruit

loans.name: Ni Wayan Joli

texts.en:
Ni Wayan Joli is a 53-year-old woman who lives in the town of Manistutu-Melaya. She is married and has one adult child. To making a living, Ni Wayan Joli raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Ni Wayan Joli has been engaged in this business for more than eight years and earns approximately 300,000-400,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Wayan Joli joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Wayan Joli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Ni Wayan Joli is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be the fourth one she has taken out from DINARI. Ni Wayan Joli plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small-business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Wayan Joli - (DNR.M-0658) merupakan 53 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia dewasa. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Wayan Joli memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Wayan Joli sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 8 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Wayan Joli menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 - 400,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Wayan Joli bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Wayan Joli meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 4th pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Wayan Joli berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk meningkatkan kondisi kehidupan secara umum keluarga peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. sells smoked fish in Terterim. Cecilia has received schooling through junior high. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter on a small income which cannot support the family.

Cecilia has been selling smoked fish since 2002 and supports her husband in paying the children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke and resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke and resell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa S. is a 47-year-old woman from the coastal town of Cardona, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. She is a mother to two children. The eldest, Francis, is 24 years old and a college graduate. Her daughter, Riocyrell, is 23 years old and also a college graduate. Both of her children are unemployed. She is married to a fisherman, Francisco, who is 45 years old.

For her loan, she is requesting 15,000 pesos as additional capital for her fish pond and fish-vending business. From the fish pond, she delivers different types of fish to nearby towns, where it is consumed by customers.

In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI aand Kiva partner in the Philippines. She was full of determination to uplift her family from poverty. Now that she has the chance to fulfill her dreams, she hopes to have more fish ponds to produce more fish to sell in the nearby towns.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish pond and fish-selling business

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 45 years old and already a widow.  She makes her income from vending different merchandise to support the needs of her four children. Her eldest child is helping her to earn a living to support the education of her three children who are all in high school.  They are living in the large village of Research Minante 1 of Cauayan City, Isabela.
	
At the moment, she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP8,000.  She plans to use the loan to purchase more products that she can sell in their village.  She usually roams inside or outside their village by walking just to sell her products.  She does not care how hard it is, she just wants to provide a better life for her children.  She hopes that Kiva will give her the opportunity to make her business grow and become progressive.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.en:
Yuriy is married with three grown-up children. He owns a car repair business. Yuriy used to work in this business as an employee. Then he purchased it and became the owner. Yuriy’s son, who is 22 years old, helps him a lot. Yuriy can say now that he runs a family business. 

Having a large experience Yuriy knows this business well and has many repeat clients. Yuriy's purpose is to develop this business further by purchasing necessary equipment and learning to fix new cars and leave it for his son to continue when he retires.

loans.use: to purchase equipment

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.
Delfina es casada, tiene 60 años y 3 hijos, Delfina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, además el esposo D. Delfina realiza trabajos en plata y Delfina se encarga D. las ventas.
Delfina necesita un préstamo D. 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Los sueños D. Delfina son tener una tienda por mayor y mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Kusiky Community Bank. “Kusiky” means “be happy” in quechua. Delifina is married and 60 years old with three children. She has a shop in her house where she sells general groceries, vegetables and fruits. Delfina’s husband carries out short term jobs, and Delfina is in charge of sales.

Delfina needs a loan of 1800 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and oil. Delfina’s dreams are to have a wholesale shop and to improve her welfare.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena T. is from the village of Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old, and is married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Nena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Nena has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Nena joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nena is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Nena plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Narzullo

texts.en:
B. Narzullo is 46 years old. He has lived for 20 years with the mother of his three children. His parents taught him the art of cultivating the land and he has always tried to sow his hectares so that he would have a crop in every season.

At this time Narzullo is sowing potatoes and wheat. He says that agricultural work needs much patience and luck, because there are seasons where there is no profit and other seasons are very good but either way he has to keep sowing, profitable or not.

Narzullo is a client who is now working for the third time with IMON International, being very responsible in his payments. He asked for a loan of 2000 USD that will be invested in his crop supplies. Be an important part of the growth of Narzullo’s business!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn B. is 53 years old and is nearly married for 30 years. She has three children that no longer living with them. Her dream is to grow her business more because the farm is what she only rely on for food and income to pay for the expenses at home.

She would like to request for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the farming necesities tpo gorw her harvest.

It was August 22, 2208 that she first joined the CEVI credit program. She likes the porgram a lot and tayed as CEVI client until now.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefania tiene un puesto donde vende verduras, su esposo es chofer de minibus, ellos tienen un terreno donde producen verduras y flores además tienen dos vacas, la leche que extraen la convierten en queso, tienen dos hijos los cuales están en colegio. Viven en casa propia que esta ubicada en la población de El Palomar de La Ciudad de La paz.
 
El crédito es para  compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad, para aumentar su producción de leche para ser convertida en queso y vender más..
 
Es el segundo crédito, su crédito anterior fue cancelado puntualmente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Estefania.

loans.use: compra de una vaca lechera para conseguir más leche y así producir más queso para su venta.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 32 year-old married mother of two children. She runs a retail shop called Kisekini Shop in Machakos, a busy market town near Nairobi. She sells household goods and has been in this business for four years. She also earns extra income from small-scale farming. She is requesting a loan for Kes. 30,000 to purchase supplies of sugar, wheat flour, and cooking fat. In the future, she hopes to expand her shop into wholesale and employ people both in her business and in her home. She describes herself as hardworking.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase stock of sugar, wheat flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Meri

texts.es: La señora Meri, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Patrón San Roque”, Distrito de Sacanche, Provincia de Huallaga, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años y es madre de 03 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella  y son su impulso, para seguir adelante.Meri, es una mujer eficiente, que viéndose en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos, decidió implementar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, empezó poco a poco y ahora ya se encuentra mejorada y con productos surtidos y al alcance de sus clientes y amas de casas, donde encuentran lo que necesitan. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas para de esta manera satisfacer y brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes. Meri, se siente una mujer muy satisfecha con lo que ha  logrado. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y a cumplir sus sueños y metas y otras  mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Meri, 48, is a member of the “Patrón San Roque” communal bank, Sacanche district, Huallaga Province, San Martín department. She is married and the mother of 3 children, two of whom still depend on her and are the motivating force for her to continue forward. Meri is an efficient woman who, needing to produce her own income, started to run a grocery store in her home. She started small and little by little has been improving and has a more varied inventory available for her customers and housewives who find what they need here. Currently, she runs the same business and she tells us that she does quite well. With this 1,000 sol loan, she intends to buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of pasta, milk, preserved fish in boxes and of various brands, household cleaning supplies, personal hygiene items, packages of soft-drinks in various flavors and brands in order to better satisfy and offer better service to her customers. Meri is very satisfied with what she has accomplished. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her business and to have her dreams and goals become realities as well as other women who want to grow in business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare her popsicles.

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr: P. Fatimata est née en 1961 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Fatimata vit depuis environs 30 ans à Djèrègbé, sur la route de Porto-Novo. Mariée à KIKI Nicodème, un mécanicien, Fatimata est mère de deux enfants. Un parmi les deux enfants est scolarisé. Les deux enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Fatimata n’a pas été à l’école. Il y a de cela 10 ans que Fatimata mène comme activité, la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine (bols en séries, glacières, plastiques, bassines, casseroles, assiettes en séries, etc.) à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin que Fatimata s’approvisionne. Fatimata a obtenu déjà, deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. En vue d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’agrandir davantage sa marchandise, pour mieux écouler ses produits en période de fêtes de fin d’année, Fatimata sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
P. Fatimata was born in 1961 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin.  She has been living for about thirty years in Djèrègbé, on the road to Porto-Novo.  Married to KIKI Nicodème, a mechanic, she is the mother of two children.  One of them is in school.  The two children live together with their parents.  The couple supports the family jointly.  Fatimata did not go to school.  For ten years, she has been running a business selling kitchen utensils (nested bowls, insulated containers, plastic ware, tubs, pots and pans, nested dishes and plates, etc.) at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  She supplies herself from Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin.  She has already obtained two loans from ALIDé and has repaid them.  With the aim of augmenting her working capital and to expand her inventory further, in order to sell more goods during this year-end holiday period, she's requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen utensils (bowls, nested dishes, coolers)

loans.name: Zudaida Benedito

texts.pt:
Zubaida Benedito V. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, tem 22 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 1 filho de 2 anos de idade. Frequenta 11ª classe numa Escola ( Orfanato Casa Do Gaiato). Vive na casa própria com a sua família, o marido é facilitador neste orfanato. Sustenta a sua tia que vive com ela em Boane no Bairro da Massaca.

 Nunca saiu da Província de Maputo, vive e trabalha no Distrito de Boane desde a sua infância. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 6 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e faz cerca de 10 horas de trabalho por dia. Vende mais cerveja e refrescos, consegue um rendimento de cerca de 2.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amiga e colega que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (vinhos, cervejas refrescos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 11.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 
Tem como objectivo diversificar o produto para a satisfação da sua clientela assim como aumento da sua renda. 
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para iniciar com a criação de frangos de corte e abrir uma mercearia.
texts.en:
Zubaida Benedito was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name. She is 22 years old and the married mother of a two year old. She is in the 11th grade at the school of the Casa do Gaiato Orphanage. She lives with her family in her own house. Her husband is a facilitator at the Orphanage. She supports her aunt who lives with her in the Boane district, in the Massaca neighborhood.

She has never left the Maputo province, having lived and worked in the Boane district her whole life. She has had her own business for more than six years. She has no employees and works around ten hours a day. By selling mostly beer and sodas she makes around 2.500.00mt per month which goes toward household expenses and savings.

She has never had loans from other banks. She discovered Hluvuku through a colleague and friend who is also a member. This will be her second loan. She requests 15.000.00mt to buy supplies (wine, beer, sodas and others) in order to increase her inventory. The previous loan was for 11.000.00mt and was used for the same activity.

Her goal is to diversify her inventory to please her clientele and also to increase her income. She would like to request more loans in the future to start breeding chickens for sale and to open a general store.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of sodas, beer and other products

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr:
Madame Maty  M.  est une femme mariée  âgée  de 34 ans qui habite dans la localité de Camberene et qui est sociétaire  a la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2003.Elle a déjà  bénéficié de 4 prêts  antérieurs. Elle a 3 enfants. Elle évolue dans la vente de tissus d’habits pour enfants et de petit déjeuner .depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle a juste choisi cette activité pour gagner des bénéfices  car mon mari a des revenus faibles par rapport  aux charges familiales. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs en vue  de renforcer son stock de tissus d’habits pour enfants et acquérir  des chaussures pour diversifier ses marchandises. Ainsi  elle pourra répondre  a la forte demande de veille des fêtes de sa clientèle.
Madame M. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye.  Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies.  Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires.  Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs
texts.en:
Mrs. Maty M. is a married woman, 34 years of age, who lives in Camberene [by Dakar] and is a member of U-IMCEC fund since November 2003. She had already taken out 4 loans in the past. She has three children. Her business is selling fabric for children’s clothing and breakfast foods. She has been doing it for more than 20 years. She has chosen this activity in order to increase her income since her husband’s income is insufficient to support the family. She is seeking a credit of 150,000 francs [about 350 USD] in order to build up her merchandise stock: to buy more fabric for children’s clothing and also to buy some shoes to diversify her selection. This will enable her to satisfy increased customer demand in the holiday season. Mrs. M. is the beneficiary of a collaborative project between U-IMCEC and PDEF, the Program for Child Development and the Family (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. The goal of PDEF is to reduce poverty in the community and especially to protect children from impoverished families. Thanks to this cooperation, parents of such families can obtain credit at more flexible conditions than ordinarily. Since the program was launched in December 2008, 120 parents have received financing, ranging in size from 50,000 to 150,000 francs. Madame Maty M. est une femme mariée âgée de 34 ans qui habite dans la localité de Camberene et qui est sociétaire a la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2003.Elle a déjà bénéficié de 4 prêts antérieurs. Elle a 3 enfants. Elle évolue dans la vente de tissus d’habits pour enfants et de petit déjeuner .depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle a juste choisi cette activité pour gagner des bénéfices car mon mari a des revenus faibles par rapport aux charges familiales. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs en vue de renforcer son stock de tissus d’habits pour enfants et acquérir des chaussures pour diversifier ses marchandises. Ainsi elle pourra répondre a la forte demande de veille des fêtes de sa clientèle. Madame M. est une bénéficiaire du protocole entre U-IMCEC et le Programme de Développement de l'Enfant et de la Famille (PDEF) Seydina Issa Laye. Le PDEF cherche à réduire la pauvreté au sein de la communauté et surtout à protéger les enfants issus des familles démunies. Grâce a cette coopération, les parentes de ces derniers peuvent profiter de crédit à des conditions plus souples par rapport aux crédits ordinaires. Depuis le démarrage du protocole en Décembre 2008, 120 parents ont reçu un financement pour des montants qui varient entre 50.000 et 150.000 frs

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: building up merchandise stock

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: La señora María Leticia G. es casada con el señor Roberto Vega Moreno quien labora para un taxi donde el es propietario; ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano, son clientes distinguidos de nuestra institución ya que anteriormente se les había otorgado un crédito para cambiar el techo de su casa colocando una losa de concreto, actualmente esta solicitando para la impermeabilización de su hogar ya que con esta temporada de lluvias se ha deteriorado el techo.
texts.en:
María Leticia G. is married to Roberto Vega Moreno. He works as a taxi driver, and is the owner of his own taxi company. She has a business selling second hand clothes. They are distinguished clients of our institution. They previously received a loan to change the ceiling on their house and install a concrete slab. She is currently requesting a loan to waterproof her home because this rainy season has deteriorated the roof.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproof the roof of her house

loans.name: Vatt

texts.en: Mrs. Vatt C. and her family are villagers in Ping Pong village in Takeo province. She has 23 years old. She is a fruits seller to follow a season and her husband, Mr. Neat Kev, is a farmer who owns 1.3-hectare of land to cultivate rice to support his family living. This family has some problem because their rice field is infertile soil, it is far from irrigation system, and it has a lot of insects, but they did not have money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Vatt C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and rest of the loan she would like to buy fuel and pesticide. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in local public school, while the other is too small to work or study.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and rest of the loan she would like to buy fuel and pesticide.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy has been selling foodstuffs for three years. She enjoys her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She works for long hours to make her business sustainable. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. 

She is married with a child. Her husband is a building agent, and he also supports the home. Christy is itching for progress in her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia G. tiene ya más de un años dedicándose a la venta de productos de belleza y del hogar por catalogó.
Alicia también es empleada de una fabrica en el departamento de producción, con sus compañera de trabaja vende los productos, para tener mas ingreso a su familia. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar mercancía ya que tiene varios pedidos pendientes para entregar y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para surtir.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que con el ingreso de su trabajo pagara los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia G. has been selling beauty and home products by catalog for more than one year. Alicia also is employed in a manufacturing plant in the production department, and she sells to her colleagues at work in order to generate more income for her family. She seeks a long to be able to buy merchandise as she has several pending orders and doesn’t have the necessary money to buy the products. She plans on repaying the loan with the profits from her business, because with her job’s income she pays her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Delfín.
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 3 hijos, Vilma tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras. Además Vilma siembra papa que luego comercializa en la ciudad de Lima
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Vilma son construir su casa con material noble y tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Delfín communal bank. She is 31 years old, married, and has three children. She runs a small grocery and vegetable store out of her home. Vilma also raises potatoes which she sells in Lima. Vilma needs a loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) which she will invest in rice and sugar. She hopes to build her own house someday.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Agnes Salome

texts.en:
Agnes is 36 years old, married and a mother of four children. She runs a beauty salon at Umoja market. Her customers are from Umoja and its environs.

Agnes was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a member. She has a credit history with other organizations but had already cleared the loan before joining KADET.  This will be her first loan with KADET. 

With this loan, Agnes wants to bring electricity to her salon so she can offer good and quality services to her clients.

Her husband, Jason, works as a driver who supplements the family’s income. Agnes hopes to buy a piece of land and construct rental houses. This loan will bring the family extra income.

loans.use: Bring electricity to her business premises.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florah J. is a 50-year-old woman who is married to Abraham Kosgei, a farmer. They are blessed with two beautiful children. Florah lives in Iten in Eldoret, and she owns a boutique shop in Iten market. She buys women's clothes and handbags for resale, and has been in business for seven years. Her customers are mostly ladies who come to the market from the nearby villages.

Florah came to know about KADET through a marketing promotion done in Iten market by Kadet staff. This will be her fourth loan in KADET, and she plans to use the loan amount to add more inventory of clothes and bags in her boutique shop.

She hopes that KADET will continue to fund her business so that she can expand her business, buy a plot in Iten town and build rental houses to increase her family income.

loans.use: To add more inventory of clothes and handbags for resale

loans.name: Cristo La Solucion 4,5 Group

texts.en:
Regina is the coordinator of her group Cristo L. Solucion 4,5 (Christ is the Solution), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding L. Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with with her long term partner and two children.

Regina is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a "fantasia" (fantasy), a variety store catered to women, by purchasing sandals, blouses and perfumes. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. She feels at that, at this stage, growing her business to be sustainable is more important than using the profits on other purchases. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase sandals, blouses and perfumes to sell.

loans.name: Arciliano

texts.es:
El Sr. Arciliano  esta casado con la Sra. Acelina hace varios años tienen 4 hijos menores que aún están cursando la escuela primaria.
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que esta ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como asalariados.
Además de la despensa tienen venta de Combustible al menudeo en su casa ya que en la zona no cuentan con estaciones de servicio es una manera de tener más ingresos.
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando Educan a sus hijos y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar.
El ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, arroz, jabones, y otros.
El ya tuvo otros créditos con nosotros y cumplió en forma excelente con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Arciliano has been married to Acelina for several years; they have four minor children who are in elementary school. Together they set up a general store in their home located in a very crowded neighborhood in the area; they started out with a small capital investment which they had earned working as salaried employees. In addition to the groceries they also sell fuel at retail in their home because the area they live in doesn’t have any gas stations and this is a way for them to earn extra income. Thanks to the work they do they are educating their children and they are able to buy all the basics for their home. He has shown himself to be very responsible and honest in his commitments. On this occasion he is asking for funds to buy sugar, rice, soaps and other items. He has had loans with us in the past and he met his obligations excellently.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer
