loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: One Family Group

texts.en:
Eyea G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called One Family. She is 50 years old, married and has two children, who are 12 and 24 years old. She was not privileged to attend school due to poverty. She cares for two siblings. 

For 10 years, she has been selling alcoholic drinks in Jacob's Town Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 10,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 37,000-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more alcoholic drinks to sell. 
 
Her goals are to improve her business, to build a house and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more alcoholic drinks to sell

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita M. is from the village of Lower Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 63 years old, a widow and has six adult children. To make a living, Conchita owns a general store. Conchita has been engaged in her business for 21 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Conchita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Conchita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 
       
About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
 
*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy products to sell

location.town: Sindangan-Lower Inuman, Sindangan, Zamboanga del N

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Якубова Гулнора проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет 7 детей. Образование среднее. Муж с сыновьями в Росии на заработках. Сама Гулнора занимается растениеводством. Ей приходится много работать, чтобы прокормить семью. При доме имеет земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян, т.е. для повторного посева.
texts.en:
Gulnora Y. lives in Yavan. She is 43 years old, married, and has seven children. She has a high school education. Her husband and her sons work in Russia. Gulnora farms. She has to work very hard to support her family. The plot of land she uses to grow vegetables is near her home. She has been doing this work for more than five years. She is taking out a loan to buy seeds to replant her crops.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seed

loans.name: Reak Smey

texts.en:
Mrs. Reak Smey S., age 45, lives in Kampong Samnanh village in Kandal province. She is widow with a child who is age 4 and is not yet in school.

Mrs. Reak Smey S. is a seamstress in a garment factory and she also sells groceries in the local market. With both of these occupations, she is able to earn a small income to support her family.

In order to support her grocery business, Mrs. Reak Smey S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities

loans.name: Gbodeaman Group

texts.en:
Edwin G., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Gbodeaman. Edwin is 45 years old, married, and has four children who range from 4 to 24 years old. He was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to lack of financial support.

For four years, he has been selling milk, candles, soap, toothpaste, canned juice and soft drinks in Redlight Market, on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 15,000 LRD portion of this 53,000 LRD group loan to buy more cartons of milk, candles, soap, toothpaste, canned juice and soft drinks to sell.

His dream is to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of milk, candles, soap, toothpaste, canned juice and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Belen Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Belen inicia su ciclo 12 con 14 socias que realizan diferentes negocios.
Como es el caso D. la señora Rocío que es la tesorera por segunda vez D. su Banco Comunal, durante este tiempo a través D. las capacitaciones aprendió a administrar su negocio.
Rocio es soltera y vive con sus padres, Rocio tiene un pequeño taller D. confección D. prendas D. vestir en su casa, cuenta con una sola maquina, pero su mayor sueño es tener maquinas modernas, Rocio brinda servicios D. composturas y ropa a medida. Además Rocio trabaja en una empresa D. confección D. polos, actividad que realiza por las mañanas. Los sueños D. Rocio son tener su propia empresa D. confección, ampliar su taller y construir su casa.
Rocio solicita un préstamo D. 600 para la compra D. hilos y telas.
texts.en:
The Belen (Bethlehem) Communal Bank has begun its 12th loan cycle with 14 members who are involved in different businesses. That is the case with Rocio (Dew) who is treasurer of the communal bank for the 2nd time. During this time, by means of the training classes, she has learned to administer her business. Rocio is single and lives with her parents. She operates a small dressmaking shop in her home. She can only count on one sewing machine and her main dream is to have modern machines. Rocio offers services such as mending and clothing maD. to measure. In addition, Rocio works mornings in a polo shirt making enterprise Rocio dreams of having her own dressmaking enterprise, expanding her shop and constructing her own house. She is requesting a loan of 600 [dollars] to buy thread and cloth.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING THREAD AND CLOTH FOR HER DRESSMAKING SHOP

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred L. is from the village of Salamague Lamut, Ifugao. She is 50 years old, married, and has five adult children. To make a living, Mildred raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding. Mildred has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 8,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mildred joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mildred is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to build a shelter for her livestock. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mildred from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To build shelter for livestock

loans.name: Terere Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
34-year-old N. Kulusumu belongs to Terere Development group-Mukono. She runs a pharmacy, which she started after she finished school. Her business has been in existence for 10 years. She also runs a commercial motorcycle business that helps increase her income. 

Hard work and determination have been her trump card. She makes 130,000 shillings a week. With this loan, this mother of two says she is going to buy more drugs for her pharmacy.

loans.use: To purchase drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase parts for the car

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a skilled seamstress. She lives and works in Dushanbe, manufacturing clothing and offering tailoring services. She is married, and her husband is very supportive of her business endeavors, which are her greatest hobby as well. All her products are very well sewn and relatively affordable, which is why Munira's goods are always in high demand. She has been in this business for 16 years and has learned some valuable lessons about overcoming challenges and hard times. Munira's business has another big advantage, as it provides jobs to other people, helping fight the unemployment rates which have always been a problem in Tajikistan. This time Munira is seeking a loan of 6,000 Somoni to purchase an embroidery machine and accessories to improve the quality of items she offers for sale and to facilitate some working procedures for her employees. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and accessories

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOC RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Susana; tiene 42 años de edad, y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de caldos que atiende desde las 6:00 p.m hasta las 3:00 a.m, ella prepara diferentes caldos como de pollo y carne y los vende en un puesto de venta de comida, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio. La  socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar los caldos.

La socia agradece el préstamo solicitado  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Susana belongs to the “Mosoc Runa” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Susana is 42 years old and is single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling soups where she serves from 6.00pm to 3.00am.  She prepares different soups such as chicken and meat and sells them from a food stall.  She would like to improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients for cooking soups.

She is grateful for the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cooking soups

loans.name: Blanca Lucila

texts.es:
la señora Blanca Lucia C. M. tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y dependen de ella dos hijos, una esta en el colegio y su hijo que se va a graduar de la universidad. Blanca vive en el barrio Victoria, tiene e 25 años de vivir en ese lugar y en donde se a desarrollado en el comercio.
Blanca a vendido oro, cosmeticos, perfumes. ahora se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Blanca es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, tiene casa propia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su negocio y asi tener mas ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos.
su meta es que sus dos hijos se graduen de la universidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca Lucia C. M. is 45 years old, a single mother with two dependent children:  a daughter in high school, and her son, who will graduate from college.  Blanca has lived in the Victoria neighborhood for 25 years, where she has developed her business. Blanca has sold gold, cosmetics, and perfume.  She now sells general goods, and has a store in her home.  Blanca is an enterprising, hard-working woman.  She has her own house.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her shelves and thus increase her earnings, which she needs in order to cover household expenses and her children’s studies.  
Her goal is for her two children to graduate from college.

loans.use: To buy beans, rice, sugar, flour, bread, soft drinks, fritters, pastas, sauces, cereal, oats, toilet paper, tooth paste, juices, candles, batteries, matches, coffee

loans.name: Kipkirui

texts.en:
Thirty-four-year-old Kipkirui is a dairy farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley Kenya. He is married with one child, age 10, who attends school. He has been farming for the last ten years and sells his milk through Cherobu dairy plant in Litein town. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea which he sells locally.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of 70,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow and expand his poultry farm. The extra income from the sale of milk and eggs will help him meet the needs of his family. He says that his major challenge has been lack of enough storage facilities for animal feed. He hopes that he will be selling at least 30 litres of milk daily in the near future. He is also requesting Juhudi to hold trainings especially on poultry and dairy feeds.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and expand his poultry farm

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Suy R., 51, is a grocery seller, earning an income of 7 USD per day. R. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend 45 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, and 20 USD on other necessary expenses every month. R. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Vetchy Joy

texts.en:
Vetchy Joy F. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 32 years old. Vetchy Joy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Vetchy Joy owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating service based like tricycle transport services. Vetchy Joy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Vetchy Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vetchy Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Vetchy Joy is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better services. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Vetchy Joy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide tricycle transport service

loans.name: Hannah Hati

texts.en:
Hannah had practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last four years. She is 46 years old, married to Remmi Mohamed and they have three children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

In the future, Hannah hopes to practice large scale farming and increase her income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 48 años de edad, es casada  y vive junto a su esposo y  sus hijos en el caserío CP ubicado en el distrito de las Lomas, una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Cristina se dedica desde hace muchos años a la confección de vestidos y blusas. El confecciona estas prendas para luego vendérselas a un comerciante mayorista que le hace pedidos por temporadas, este negocio es una fuente importante de ingreso a la economía de su familia, Debido a que realiza su trabajo con muy buena calidad su negocio ha ido creciendo y sus pedidos han aumentado considerablemente.

Cristina desea adquirir materiales y equipos para seguir aumentando su producción y poder ofrecer a sus clientes diseños nuevos y de buen acabado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar nuevamente a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

El mayor anhelo de Cristina es sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida, por ello siempre se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Cristina, 48, is married living with her husband and children in the CP settlement located in Las Lomas district, a farming zone in Piura province, Piura region, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

Cristina has been a dressmaker for many years.  She makes dresses and blouses to sell to a wholesaler who places seasonal orders with her.  This business is an important source of family income.  Because she does high quality work, the business has been growing and her orders have increased considerably.

Cristina wants to acquire equipment and materials to continue increasing production and offer her customers new, nicely finished styles.  Because of this she has deemed it advisable to request a new, 2000 new sol loan, from Edpyme Alternativa.

Cristina’s greatest wish is to support her family and improve their quality of life.  Because of this she exerts the maximum effort in her work.

loans.use: To acquire equipment and materials for her business.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa P. is from Kanitoan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Josefa owns a retail store selling ready-to-wear clothing and shoe products from NATASHA & AVON. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Josefa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI and is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional products like t-shirts & blouses to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Josefa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like t-shirts & blouses to sell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is married to a farmer, and they have two children. Educated up to junior high school, Afia has spent the past six years selling kenkey, a staple in the Ghanaian diet made of fermented maize dough, in the Jukwa Market (near Abura in Cape Coast). 
Afia’s family relies on her income to pay for school fees and household utilities. She is keen to expand her business with the loan, which she’ll use to purchase more maize to increase the production of kenkey. She plans to save up the extra profits she makes.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to increase the production of kenkey.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 39 years old and has 5 children between 1 and 17 years old.  All but one of Francoise’s children are in school.  Francoise’s husband is a civil servant, and Francoise owns a shop in which she sells, rice, sugar, Vaseline, soap, eggs,various cookies and some food stuffs such as Irish potatoes. Francoise has owned this business for one year.  She requests this loan to buy sugar,Vaseline,soap etc for her shop. With the profits, Francoise intends to pay for her school fees, and to purchase a few domestic animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy vaseline,sugar,soap and food stuffs.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era un niño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, con el tiempo logró heredar terrenos de cultivo por parte de sus padres, desde entonces siembra maíz y papa, para él esta actividad le llena de satisfacción y más cuando su familia participa también de esta actividad. Es así que cada mañana muy temprano, se dirige para cuidar de sus plantaciones y procurar que tengan un buen desarrollo. Al ser cosechado estos productos son llevados al mercado central que se encuentra en la ciudad. Hoy el trabajo es de mayor esfuerzo, por ello debe contratar personal para que le ayuden en la siembra en todo el perímetro posible que tiene por cultivar.  Es su primer crédito con MFP,  esta muy entusiasmada en saber que tiene una oportunidad  buena para mejorar su actividad económica, a su vez se compromete en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar.
texts.en:
Pablo is 43 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a home of his own.  He's been farming since he was a boy.  He eventually inherited the land from his parents and has been raising corn and potatoes ever since.  This activity fills him with satisfaction.  Every morning he rises early and goes out to care for his crops and eventually takes his harvests to the central market.

There is a lot of work to do now, so he must hire farm hands to help with the planting.  This will be his first loan through MFP and he is very excited to know that he has an opportunity to improve his financial status.  He is committed to making his payments on time.  He will use the money from this loan to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Benediction Group

texts.fr:
BENEDICTION est un groupement constitué de quinze personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a le doigt levé sur la photo) est nommée Eugenie. Les membres du groupe se connaissent parce qu'ils ont l'habitude de faire des cotisations dans le même quartier à Abomey Calavi. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
Née le 05 Avril 1961 à Dassa-Zoumè dans le département des Collines, Eugenie vit depuis dix ans à Tankpè, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Eugenie est mariée à un monsieur nommé Placide et a un enfant, qui est scolarisé. En dehors de son enfant, Eugenie a un autre enfant à charge. Eugenie assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Eugenie a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Depuis une quinzaine d'année, Eugenie vend divers produits (maïs, haricot, riz, conserves, savons, etc.) dans sa boutique size à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Eugenie achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et au marché de Houègbo au Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Eugenie et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu. Dans l'avenir, Eugenie ambitionne construire une maison et la mettre en location.
texts.en:
"Benediction" is a group composed of 15 people whose president (the one with the raised finger in the photo) is named Eugenie. The group members know each other because they usually run their businesses in the same area of Abomey Calavi. With the goal of increasing its working capital, this group is seeking its first loan through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners).
Born on 5 April 1961 in Dassa-Zoumè in the department of Les Collines, Eugenie has lived for ten years in Tankpè, in the town of Abomey Calavi. She is married to a gentleman named Placide and has one child, who currently attends school. In addition to her own child, Eugenie has another child in her care. Eugenie and her husband take care of the various household expenses together. Eugenie ended her studies at the secondary level. For about fifteen years, she has sold various items (maize, beans, rice, canned goods, soap, etc.) at her store located in her home. This business provides her with an income that helps her contribute to the family's expenses. Eugenie buys her goods at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin, and at the Houègbo market in Benin. This first loan will definitely allow Eugenie and her group to raise the level of their businesses and increase their clientele and income. In the future, Eugenie's ambition is to build a house and rent it out.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, maize, beans, manioc flour, and soap.

loans.name: Abenawa

texts.en:
Abenawa A. is married to a farmer and they have four children. 

Abenawa has been a petty trader in the village of Besease (near Elmina) for the past two years. She sells items like shea butter, powder, steel wool and soap. Her income helps pay for some of the household expenses. 

In order to grow her business, Abenawa needs a loan from Kiva to purchase more shea butter and steel wool to increase her sales. She plans to save up any additional income for her children’s future education.

loans.use: Abenawa needs a loan from Kiva to purchase more shea butter and powder to increase her sales.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica trabaja en servicios domestico, como madre quiere el porvenir para sus dos hijos, su esposo esta laborando como mecánico, y junto esperan hacer las mejora a su vivienda.

Pues gracias Afodenic han logrado la mayor parte de construcción de su casa, siendo el séptimo ciclo que será para el comienzo de un muro en la parte de atrás de la casa, ya que el invierno las correntada le inundan su patio de agua y quiere mejorar esta condición evitando malas higiene, lo que espera cerrarlo por completo a la largo plazo ya que sus capacidad de pago es poca ya que tiene que a sumir otros gastos.

Materiales a comprar: bloques, hierro, arena, cemento, tablas, clavos para iniciar la obra.
texts.en:
Verónica works as a housekeeper and wants the best for her two children.  Her husband works as a mechanic and together they want to make home improvements.

Thanks to Afodenic they have been able to build most of their house.  Their seventh loan will be used to begin building a wall in the backyard because of the water damage in the patio following the winter season.  She wants to improve the situation to avoid bad hygiene and hopes to complete the wall in the future.  Currently she is lacking payment capacity because of other expenses.

The materials to buy are blocks, iron, sand, cement, boards, and nails to begin construction.

loans.use: To build a wall in the backyard to avoid water leakage into the patio for which she will buy blocks, sand, cement and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is an 18-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and four siblings. He started his career at a very young age, working as a plumber. His work is specialized in installing toilets, faucets etc. He works on a freelance basis sticking with multiple projects and private businesses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional materials for his work such as pipes, bathroom fixtures, etc. He says that these purchases will allow him to better serve his clients.  In the future, he is willing to expand his business operation into wider areas.

loans.use: to purchase pipes, bathroom fixtures, etc for his plumbing business

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: La señora Olga tiene 2 hijos  menores D. edad,   su negocio es la venta y cultivo D. flores  desD.  hace 5 años  también se  dedica a la elaboración D.  bordados D. blusas y  tejidos D. güipiles   necesita un crédito para la inversión  D. flores  que son los respaldos  D. los arreglos floreales   y ahora en el mes del D. mayo  ella tiene bastante demanda en sus ventas, también se va a dedicar a la venta D. arreglos   en su casa  y D. algunos pedidos, otra parte del crédito lo va invertir en la compra D. hilos   para los güipiles que realiza    y para  la compra D. telas para bordar  su mayor deseo es poder sacar a delante  a sus hijos  y poder cultivar mas flores como la compra D. una bomba para su cultivo.
texts.en:
Sra. Olga has two young children. For the past five years, she has managed a business of growing and selling flowers. She also makes embroidered blouses and woven skirts. Olga needs a loan to invest in flowers for making floral arrangements. She has plenty of demand for her products in the month of May, so she plans to sell arrangements at home and from a few orders. Part of her loan will be invested in the purchase of thread for making skirts and fabrics for her embroideries.

Her greatest wishes incluD. moving her children forward, cultivating more flowers, and purchasing a water pump for her flower business.

loans.use: to purchase thread for weaving, fabrics for embroidering, and flowers for floral arrangements.

loans.name: Isaura

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, povincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique solteira e mãe de 1 filho de 2 anos de idade. Concluiu a licenciatura. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e  sustenta os seus pais que vivem com ela.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, e funcionaria permanente na escola comunitaria casa d gaiato a mais de 13 anos e tem um rendimento de 21.198.10mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Fez emprestimo no BIM no valor de 90.000.00mt destinado a construção da sua casa. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de vizinhas que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este e o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para concluir a sua obra (pedra, ferro, areia, e outros ).
sonho e conluir a sua casa, e mobiliar  e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Isaura was born in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of one 2-year-old son.  She finished her bachelor's degree.  She lives in her own home with her family and also supports her parents who live with her.

She never left Maputo.  She has been a full-time employee in the community elementary school, "Casa de gaiato," for more than 13 years.  She makes a monthly income of 21,198.10 meticals, which she puts towards her home's expenses.  She also saves some in her bank account in the BIM bank.

She had a loan with BIM for 90,000 meticals, which she put towards building her home.  She became familiar with Hluvuku through neighbors that are also clients of the institution.  This is her first loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which she will use to buy construction materials to finish her home (stone, iron, sand, etc.).

She dreams about finishing her home and furnishing it, for which she plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish her house (stone, iron, sand, etc.)

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is forty years old, married and has two children. For five years he has been operating a cafe to earn a living. He has employed two people to assist him in the business. He also has a transport business and sells firewood for extra income.

John was able to start his transport business after getting a loan from Faulu Kenya. He has now requested a loan of 70,000 KES to buy ingredients such as maize flour, cooking fat, baking flour, sugar, maize and beans for his cafe. He hopes to open another outlet in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for his cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a greater variety of products like: rice, beans, candy, sweet bread, detergent, oil, etc.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Monsefú que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Miguel desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado de Chiclayo, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados para que se incremente la producción de la leche de vaca y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Miguel es una persona trabajadora y dedicada que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca para que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Miguel, 46, lives with his wife and children in their own house with the only utility being electricity.  It is located in the rural area of the Monsefú District which belongs to the province of Chiclayo.  The activities in this area are mainly agriculture, livestock farming and handicrafts.

For several years Miguel has been raising and selling cattle.  He has a barnyard behind his house where he provides the cows with balanced feed and natural fodder so they can produce good milk.  He sells the milk to the locals in his area as well as at the market in Chiclayo.  He has a fixed customer base because of the quality of the milk he sells.  He uses his income to take care of household expenses.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 2,500 PEN which will be used to buy more balanced feed to increase dairy production.  This way he will be able to offer a better price which will facilitate payng back the loan and improving his family's lifestyle.  Miguel is a hard worker and very dedicated.  His main goal is to grow his business so his children can have better opportunities than he had.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Ita

texts.en:
Ita has been an animal trader for the past fifteen years. He is married and supports six people in his family. He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. He has been loaned KES 70,000. This is  his second loan which he plans  to purchase more animals.

With the anticipated profit he plans to  reinvest in the business. In the near future he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Jones Kitheka

texts.en:
Jones is a 35-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. He describes himself as quiet. He operates a greengrocery store. He has been involved in this business for three years. He describes his biggest business challenges to be shortage of commodities, for example oranges, and lack of enough funds to purchase more fruit.

 He will use the Kes 10,000 loan to introduce pineapples into his selection of goods for sale in his business. His business goal is to become a wholesaler supplying pineapples and other fruits within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be able to support his children to complete school, and he will own a house.

loans.use: to buy pineapples to add to his selection of goods.

loans.name: Rosiris Margoth

texts.es:
Rosiris de 42 años y en condiciones de viuda vive en San Jacinto, con sus 4 hijos, en las edades de 6 a 21 años, tres de los cuales estudian y el mayor trabaja; allí en esta tierra donde sobreabundan las artesanías en tejido vertical, Rosiris  se dedica justamente a la producción Hamacas, Bolsos y fajones, actividad que aprendió por tradición familiar, y desde que quedó viuda, se concentró más en ella. Así es que durante el día trabaja tejiendo las hamacas y en la noche teje fajones por servicio o tejida y se gana en cada fajón $2.000 COP  y ella teje un mínimo de 3 por noche. Viven en su propia casa, cerca de su madre y de otros hermanos Su familia es muy solidaria con Rosiris, pues desde que  murió su esposo,  apoyaron la crianza de sus hijos y aún   siguen haciéndolo. Hoy da gracias a Dios, porque  tiene un hijo que trabaja y aporta para los gastos del hogar. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará   hilazas de algodón para lograr una producción mayor.  Ella se siente muy segura y supone una inversión exitosa, porque conoce esta actividad perfectamente, ha tenido la experiencia crediticia, siempre ha pagado puntualmente con la producción de sus hamacas y adicionalmente tiene el gran apoyo de su madre, quien trabaja con ella las artesanías. 
En la actualidad Rosiris ha recibido 2 financiamiento de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, durante dos años; con  ellos logró comprar materiales para hacer hamacas y mochilas y también compró animales de especies menores, como cerdo y gallina y ella dice que cuando terminaba de pagarle  a la Fundación, le quedaba un cerdo o dos, y sus gallinas de ganancia. Sus sueños o metas  en cuanto al negocio es  capitalizarlo para tener más productos y en cuanto a su hogar, es  mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios de secundaria y continúen carreras universitarias. Mientras Rosiris trabaja para lograr sus sueños, genera un Margen de Contribución  de 45.9%, una  Rotación de Inventarios de  15 días y una  Rotación de cuentas por cobrar  de 1 día, es decir todo lo que vende a crédito, se lo pagan al día siguiente. Desde estos indicadores financieros proyectamos su crecimiento potencial y auguramos una inversión exitosa con su credikiva.
texts.en:
Rosiris, 42, is a widow who lives in San Jacinto with her four children, ages six through 21.  Three of them study and the eldest works.  In a land where vertical weaving is an abundant craft, Rosiris earns a living making hammocks, bags and bands, which is a trade she learned as a family tradition.  When she became a widow she began to focus more on the activity.  During the day she makes hammocks and at night she makes bands to order earning 2,000 COP per band.  She makes a minimum of three per night. They live in their own house close to her mother and two siblings.  Her family is very supportive of Rosiris and ever since her husband passed away they have helped out raising the children.  And thankfully there is one son who works and contributes to the household expenses.

This is her first credikiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation and she plans to buy cotton yarn to increase production.  She is very sure that the investment will be successful because she is perfectly familiar with the business and has had loan experience.  She has always paid them back on time through her hammock production and she also has the support of her mother who helps her make the crafts.

Rosiris has received two loans through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in the past two years.  With them she has been able to buy materials to make hammocks and back-packs, as well as small animals such as pigs and hens.  When she finished paying back the Foundation she still had a couple of pigs and hens as a profit.  Her goal is to capitalize her business so she can add more products.  She also wants to improve her house and insure her children finish their secondary education and get a university degree.  While Rosiris works toward her goal, she generates a contribution margin of 45.9%, an inventory turnover of 15 days and an accounts receivable turnover of one day, so what she sells on credit is paid the next day.  These are the financial indicators that we have used to project growth potential and we forecast a successful investment with her credikiva.

loans.use: To buy cotton yarn to increase production.

loans.name: Rosa Edith

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Estrella Solidaria.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, todos son mayores de edad e independientes aunque viven en su casa pero en departamentos independientes. Su esposo es Abogado.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta se dedica a la venta de sabanas y productos Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana y su hija le da vendiendo a sus compañeras de trabajo, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Las sabanas las compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita o tiene pedidos. Tiene tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y sabanas. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy responsable y unido. 

Su meta es tener un bazar.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Nueva Estrella Solidaria meet every two weeks in the municipal community of the city of Portoviejo, the Manabi capital of Manabi for many years as the city of royal tamarinds.

This is where we met Mrs. Rosa, 55, who is married and has four children, all of whom are adults and live independently in different parts of the house.  Her husband is a lawyer.

In order to earn her own income, she sells bed sheets and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and ladies' accessories).  She works three days a week and her daughter sells to her colleagues at work.  She delivers her products on a credit basis and collects payment every week.  Whenever she has orders for sheets she travels to Guayaquil to buy them.  For three years she has been in business and it is going well for her.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and sheets.  This is her second term with the communal bank and she is pleased that the group is so responsible and united.

Her goal is to have a bazaar one day.

loans.use: To buy creams,  and bed sheets.

loans.name: Motuya Plus Group

texts.en:
Motuya Plus is a group of 12 owners of small businesses chaired by Thérèse. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC to grow their businesses.

Thérèse is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She sells "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) and plastic items at the market located mid-east of Kinshasa. She became a micro-entrepreneur in 1974. 

Thérèse received already four loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy more "pagnes" and resell them at  a profit. Currently she earns a profit of US $30 a week. She will seek to make more profit by importing her products herself. Her dream is to become a "pagne" wholesaler. 

Thérèse is 56 years old, married, and the mother of four children aged between 18 and 31 years old. Two of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying more lengths of African print cloth.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Она трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Более 19 лет она занимается купля продажей овощей на местном рынке. Она хочет улучшить свое жилищное условие и обеспечить своих детей, с этой целью она работает усердно с утра до вечера. Насиба хотела бы получит займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки овощей с целью расширения своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Nasiba is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She is a hardworking and conscientious woman.  She has been involved in buying and selling vegetables at the local market for over 19 years.  Nasiba wants to improve her living conditions and provide for her children, and this is why she diligently works from dawn until dusk.  Nasiba wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 4000 Somoni for the purchase of vegetables in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Mawar Grace Group

texts.en:
Lasmiatun is 48 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are still going to school. Her first daughter, Yustin, has already finished high school.  She wants to go to University but they don't have enough money so she has found a job. Lasmiatun's business is making and selling gado-gado (Indonesian dish). She has been doing this since 2007. She works with her husband. This is her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She wants to use this loan to pay for more vegetables to make gado-gado and pay for school fees for her other two children. Now she has three competitors around her neighborhood so she needs more money to buy ingredients to expand her business. She hopes she can also find a more strategic place to do this business.

Some of the other group members will use their loans to improve their businesses, which include selling fruit, selling Indonesian dishes, and teaching aerobics.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to make gado-gado (Indonesian dish) and pay for school fees for children

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés es un hombre laborioso, a sus 52 años de edad ha visto a sus 5 hijos crecer y tener sus propias familias. Se separó de su esposa y ahora vive solo en su casa propia en el centro poblado Las Palmas Ipoki en el distrito de Pichanaki. Gracias al clima y a los suelos fértiles de su localidad, siembra kión y café. Pero su prioridad son los kiones con 3 parcelas enteras de este producto. “En esta zona, los kiones crecen grandes y se venden bien en la ciudad de Pichanaki”, comenta. A su vez, cuenta con 1 lote de 20 por 15 metros cuadrados en los que sembró café.  Menciona que, el café también es rentable, pero necesita más cuidados y mayor inversión. Por esa razón empezará una nueva siembra de este, internacionalmente exigido, fruto.
Para tal proceso, trabaja con personal operario a quien paga al día o por contrato.
Andrés espera continuar con la faena en el campo, ampliando sus cosechas de kión e incursionando en la producción de café en mayor escala. De esa manera podrá adquirir algunos muebles para su rústico hogar y así brindarse una ancianidad segura y una calidad de vida más cómoda. Impulsado por recomendaciones de amigos, Andrés desea trabajar con MFP, sería su primer préstamo. Por esa razón promete ser preciso en el pago de sus cuotas. Está emocionado por iniciarse dentro de “San Pablo de Shima”, su banco comunal.
De obtener el dinero del crédito, podrá comprar abonos para los sembríos de kión y café, así como pagar la mano de obra de operarios.
texts.en:
Andrés is a hard-working man.  At 52 years of age, he has seen his 5 children grow up and start their own families.  Andrés is separated from his wife and  now lives alone in his own home which is located in the village of Las Palmas Ipoki, in Pichanaki district.  Thanks to the climate and the fertile soils of his area, he is able to grow ginger and coffee.  However, his priority is the ginger, which he grows on 3 whole plots.  "In this region, ginger grows well and it sells well in the city of Pichanaki", he comments.  He mentions that coffee is profitable too but it needs more care and more investment.  He will start sowing a new lot of this product which is in demand internationally.  To do this he works with staff who he pays by the day or by contract.

Andrés hopes to continue with his farm work, expanding his ginger harvests and starting to produce coffee on a larger scale.  In this way, he will be able to buy some items of furniture for his basic house and thereby provide himself with a secure old age and a more comfortable quality of life.  Driven by recommendations from friends, Andrés would like to work with MFP.  This will be his first loan and he pledges to be punctual in making his repayments.  He is excited to be starting work with 'San Pablo de Shima', his community bank.  With the loan money, he will be able to buy manure for his ginger and coffee crops and to pay laborers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure and to hire laborers

loans.name: Leonides

texts.en:
45-year-old Leonides earns a living running a tailoring business at her home. She is married and has three school-aged children. Leonides and her family live in the town of Baclayon, Bohol.

Leonides has had her tailoring business for almost ten years. She makes uniforms and provides alterations to clothing. Each month, Leonides earns 15000 PHP with her business.
 
She plans to use her loan to purchase tailoring materials such as cloth, thread, and needles. She will use her profit to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials such as cloth, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Kalukhila A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Kalukhila A Group in Western Kenya! Hellen is the facilitator of the Kalukhila A group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Hellen takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Hellen had an excellent maize yield harvesting 21 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Hellen was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Hellen and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Hellen will educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Kalukhila A group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Las Glorias Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Glorias está conformado por tres personas trabajadora y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Gloria Elena quien se dedica a la venta de fresco, gaseosa, leche y helados desde hace 6 años. Ella tiene seis hijos ya mayores quienes la apoyan y ayudan.
Las otras integrantes son Eveling quien vende ropa desde hace 2 años y Sheila vende ropa y productos Avon desde hace 6 años.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Glorias" is comprised of three hard-working entrepreneurs, one of whom is Mrs. Gloria Elena who has been selling softdrinks, sodas, milk and ice cream for six years.  She has six children who are adults and help and support her.

The other members of the group are Eveling, who has been selling clothing for two years, and Sheila, who has been selling clothing and Avon products for six years.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as fruit, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ameeran Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran bibi is 44 years old, a widow and operates a grocery store in her community. She has been operating it for over five years.  

She as the head of her household works to achieve a better future for her family.  She is the mother of six children who are 17, 12, 10, 7, 5 and 4 years old. Her eldest daughter knows the responsibilities of her mother and also understands her position. That is why Ameeran's daughter tries to provide comfort to her mother by supplementing Ameeran's income through her sewing works.

Ameeran dreams of continuing to grow so she can go on helping her family in that way.

Ameeran has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy groceries, beverages and bakery products for her store to increase her sales.

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ameeran bibi”.

loans.use: To buy groceries, beverages and bakery products for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a 54-years-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children. One of them is studying while the others are working. They are a united family seeking to enhance their way of living. 

Saada started her own home business as tailor. She also visits her customers at their homes in order to respond rapidly to their demands. As for her husband, he has been working as taxi driver. 

Today, she’s requesting to borrow $900 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new textiles designs for her business. In that way, she will be following all styles and also increasing her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase new textiles designs for her business.

loans.name: Alberto Manuel

texts.es: Alberto de 25 años de edad tiene un negocio de peluquería, que inició desde hace 8 años, cuando cortando el cabello gratis a sus amigos y familiares, fue adquiriendo su propia clientela, y también mucha experiencia, con la que hoy trabaja y le permite generar sus propios ingresos. Su actividad la desarrolla en su domicilio, ubicado al suroccidente de la ciudad, desde los lunes hasta los domingos, en un horario que inicia a  las 10 de la mañana y termina a las 8 de la noche y muchas veces hasta más tarde, pues se ajusta a las necesidades e intereses de su clientela. Como toda la comunidad de su barrio lo conoce y la de los alrededores también, son muchos los clientes que llegan a su negocio para acceder a sus servicios y muchas veces se siente sin las condiciones  para responderles, por eso su meta mas adelante es tener un local adecuado y continuar apoyando a su madre, que es manicurista y también está en el sector de la belleza estética. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  una maquina para cortar cabello, pues es la herramienta con la cual se desempeña y necesita tener la mejor y con ello lograr mayor calidad en su desempeño, atrayendo así la atención de su clientela.
texts.en:
Alberto, 25, has a beauty salon. He started this line of work eight years ago, cutting his friends’ and relatives’ hair for free. He began to build up a good customer base and experience, which is how he can work now and generate his own income.

Alberto works at home, south-west of the city, from Monday to Sunday. He starts working at 10 am and finishes at 8 pm, although he stays later many times since he is flexible and wants to adapt to his clients’ needs and interests.

Everyone in his community and the surroundings knows him and this is why many clients come to his shop and pay for his services. Many times, he cannot cope with the demand, and this is why his goal in the future is to improve his establishment and continue supporting his mother, who offers pedicure and other beauty-related services.

Alberto is now requesting a credikiva for the first time with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. It will help him to buy a hair clipper, which is his primary tool. He needs to have the best one possible in order to provide a better service and attract more clients.

loans.use: to buy a hair clipper.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.en:
Mathias is 41 years old. He is married with five children aged between 6 and 17 years, They all go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 6 years. His wife is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to pay medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary wants to purchase blow driers and hairdressing materials.

loans.name: Batura

texts.en: Batura S. owns a small clothing stand in the town of Devech’s Bazaar. Devechi is located just south of Khachmaz in the North Eastern part of Azerbaijan. Batura wants to increase the diversity and quality of her inventory so that she can attract more customers to her stand in the Bazaar.

loans.use: To increase the diversity and quality of her inventory so that she can attract more customers.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel has run a confectionary and yogurt store from her home for 5 years. She began this activity with savings and a small loan. Her husband and children help her tend to customers between 6am and 8pm at night.

Marbiel has indicated that with a loan she can buy between 2-4 liters of yogurt and confectionary items. It is now the school year and mothers use the yogurts to pack in school lunches. Maribel also knows that the investment will allow her to earn higher profits to contribute to her family and will also be able to meet her customers' demands.

Maribel is 39 and married with 4 children, who help her along with her husband in her activity. Her husbands says he is happy with his wife and considers her a hard working woman who looks after the well-being of the family.Maribel is confident that the additional earnings will help her to continue making additions to her home, which will provide her children with added security.

Translated by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor, from Spanish.

Maribel tiene negocio de venta de confites y yogurt en su domicilio desde hace 5 años. Se inicio en esta actividad con ahorro y un préstamo pequeño. Su esposo e hijos la apoyan en su negocio con la a atención al publico desde la 6AM a 20PM.

Maribel indica que con el préstamo comprara mas yogurt de 2 y 4 litros y confites. Es época escolar y las madres de familias lo utilizan para el lunch de sus hijos. Maribel además sabe que incrementando su negocio sus ventas también se suben y a su vez generara mas ingresos para la familia y cumplirá con la demanda de sus clientes

Maribel es casada tiene 39 años, 4 hijos su esposo la apoya al igual que sus hijos en su negocio. Su esposo indica que esta contento con su esposa ya que la considera una persona trabajadora que busca el bienestar de su familia. Maribel tiene la confianza que con la generación de estos ingresos ayudara en seguir adecuando su vivienda y así dar una mejor seguridad a su hijos.

loans.use: To purchase yogurts.

loans.name: Chok

texts.en: Mrs. Chok S. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She makes her living by building rooms and renting them to the nearby garment workers. She can typically make around $2 each day, while her husband works at a private company as a driver and makes around $5/day. Additionally, 2 of her children work at a private company, and the other attends school. Due to the increase in the number of her tenants, Chok S. is currently asking for $1000 to build more rooms to rent out. In the future, she would like to be able to build as many rooms as she could to generate more income.

loans.use: To build more rooms to rent out.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
One of the main sources of revenue for Mrs. Yawa A. has been the sale of “gari” (manioc flour). At 45 years of age, Yawa is married and mother of five children. She is also responsible for caring for the six children of her co-spouse (another of her husband’s wives) who is deceased.

In view of this unusually difficult situation, none of the children has really been enrolled in school. The girls have been married off young and the boys are in apprenticeships. Even managing to supply daily meals is difficult for Yawa, who has at present no way to purchase manioc to transform into gari, and thus no income.

In order to try to remedy this dire situation, Yawa is asking for a loan of US$ 800 which will allow her to plant a field of manioc. Part of this field’s yield will be sold and the other part turned into gari, a staple of the Togolese diet. Yawa has the advantage of having a good deal of experience in her chosen work, which should prove a trump card in assuring the success of her endeavor.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

L’une des principales sources de revenu de Madame A. Yawa est la vente du gari, (farine à base du manioc). Agée de 45 ans elle mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Outre ses propres enfants, elle prend en charge les six (6) enfants de sa coépouse décédée.

Face à cette situation, aucun des enfants n’a réellement été scolarisé. Les filles précocement mariées et les garçons sont en apprentissage. Le repas quotidien est assuré difficilement. Elle n’a plus de moyen pour s’acheter du manioc en vue de la fabrication et la vente de gari.

Face à cette situation, Madame A. Yawa sollicite un crédit de $800 pour faire un champ de manioc. Une partie de ce champ sera destiné à la vente et l’autre partie à la fabrication du gari. L’expérience dont dispose Madame A. est un atout pour le succès de cette activité.

loans.use: plant a field of manioc to use to make manioc flour to sell

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en: Madeline E. is a very active and enterprising woman. She is married and has 5 children, and she sells goats. According to her, this period of Christmas is the period when people buy more goats for celebration. Due to this Madeline is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 800 to enable her buy more live goats to fatten for sale. She has been with LAPO for the past 4 years. She has about 17 years' experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy more livestock (goats) to raise

loans.name: Jesús Isidoro

texts.es:
Jesús is a hardworking man. He was born into and grew up in an agricultural family. Even till now, he's been involved in agricultural activities. He sows potatoes, peas, and wheat as well as raises and fattens his livestock. In addition, he also sells firewood to families in his community. Each and every one of his activities help him and his three children, who no longer live with him and are independent. His love as a father motivates him to be on the lookout for them. He finds some problems in farming due to increased fertilizer costs. In fact, this year, prices have doubled. Even so, he will continue as before because he wishes to sell his products directly without any intermediaries. He seeks your help to buy some necessary fertilizer for his land and thanks you in advance for your noble support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Jesús, es un hombre trabajador. él nació y creció en una familia netamente agricultora y es por ello que hasta ahora se sigue dedicando a las actividades agrícolas; siembra papa, arveja y trigo y también se dedica a la crianza y engorde de su ganado; adicionalmente a estas dos actividades oferta leña a las familias de su comunidad.Todas y cada una de estas actividades las desarrolla para colaborar con sus tres hijos que aunque ya no viven con él y pueden valerse por si mismos, su amor de padre lo impulsa a seguir al pendiente de ellos.La situación de la actividad agrícola que realiza se ha visto un poco perjudicada con el incremento de los precios de los abonos, que para este año se han duplicado, aún así él continuará con su desempeño ya que desea comercializar sus producto directamente sin necesidad de intermediarios.Solicita tu ayuda para adqurir los abonos necesarios para sus campos de cultivo y por anticipado agradece tu la ayuda de tu noble corazón.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his land

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es:
Doña Clarisa is an enterprising woman. As a result of her husband abandoning her, she had to go live at her brother's house, who received her with much affection and happiness. He helps her with the costs of educating and taking care of her children. Since her brother doesn't have a family, the arrival of Clarisa and her children has filled him with a lot of joy. Today she does agricultural work, with which she is familiar because she has helped her parents with their work since she was very little. Thanks to the unconditional support of her beloved brother and her efforts, things for her and her family have improved a lot. Nevertheless, she still needs fertilizers for the maintenance and protection of her products. She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers and other instruments that she needs. You can help her.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Clarisa, es una mujer emprendedora que a raíz del abandono de su pareja tuvo que ir a vivir a casa de su hermano, quien la acogió con mucho aprecio y regocijo y le ayuda con los gastos que genera la ecuación y bienestar de sus queridos sobrinos, debido a que su querido hermano no tiene familia la llegada de Clarisa y de sus sobrinos lo ha llenado de mucha dicha.Hoy ella se dedica a la agricultura, labor que ya le es conocida por que desde muy niña ayudaba a su padre en estas labores y gracias al apoyo incondicional de su querido hermano y a su esfuerzo, las cosas para ella y su familia han mejorado mucho; sin embargo aún requiere de abonos y fertilizantes para la manutención y protección de sus productos.Solicita para comprar sus fertilizantes y demás instrumentos que le hacen falta. Usted puede ayudarla.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.ru:
Abduvahob A. is 53 years old. He has a higher education. He is married and has 9 children. Currently, Abduvahob works as a school teacher. He also raises and sells livestock. He has been raising and selling livestock for the past three years. With the proceeds from his loan, Abduvahob intends to purchase more livestock to resell in the future. Since the schoolteacher’s salary is very small, Abduvahov spends his weekends buying and selling livestock. This loan will give him a chance to increase his profits from his sales. Abduvahov plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Алимардонов Абдувахоб, возраст – 53 года, образование – высшее, по специальности педагог, женат, имеет 9-х детей. В настоящее время он работает в школе преподователем. Абдувахоб также занимается разведением и продажей мелкого рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести несколько голов мелкого рогатого скота для дальнейшей продажи. Так как в школе он получает маленькую зарплату он по воскресеньям и субботам дополнительно занимается продажей скота. Данный кредит даст ему возможность получать дополнительный доход от торговли. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Breading and selling livestock

loans.name: Manzar

texts.en:
G. Manzar sells fruit and vegetables in a shop that is close to her house. She lives with her son and her husband. She has been in this business for 7 years and this is the first time that she has needed a loan. Her son has an old car that they use when they go to wholesale points of the city. Her husband retired and he just joined her in trying to improve their business together.

They need funds to repair the fruit shop from the inside and outside so it looks nice. They also would like to add a couple of shelves. People that live near her buy fruits and vegetables only from her to support her business.

loans.use: To repair and improve her fruit and vegetable shop

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria is 36 years old. She has been selling fish now for quite a long time. She sells her products outside her domicile and she offers a good service to all of her clients. Perhaps for this reason she doesn’t worry about having to sell on the market since all of her main clients are those who live in her own area. Maria is a mother of 5 children, 2 of them are already independent, and the remaining three children are in elementary school. Her dear husband supports her very much. He is a fisherman so he is in charge of bringing the fish to Maria. She really likes this business, so she decided to refit the small space where she sells her products, for this reason she needs a bigger working capital to fulfill her wishes as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria de 36 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pescado desde hace ya mucho tiempo, oferta sus productos fuera de su domicilio y brinda a todos sus clientes una buena atención quizá por esa razón no se preocupa por ir a vender en el mercado ya que todos sus clientes principales son los de su propia zona. Maria es madre de 5 hijos siendo 2 de ellos ya independientes, quedando sus tres últimos niños que cursan el nivel primario. Su querido esposo la apoya mucho, pues él es pescador y el encargado de traer a Maria el pescado que degustan muchas personas. A ella le gusta mucho este negocio es por eso que decidió implementar más su pequeño espacio de ventas y requiere de un capital de inversión lo más pronto posible para cumplir su propósito.

loans.use: Refit the space where she sells her products.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is an entrepreneur from Kahovka, a city on the wide Dnepr River that runs through the middle of Ukraine. Married with two children, Nataliya helps support her family with a small business selling cosmetics and personal care items. She has been in business for over eight years and currently makes about $200 in profit each month.

Nataliya has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven (US$ 525) to purchase new inventory to sell. The type of business Nataliya has selling small items involves a fairly high product turnover rate. This loan will increase the amount of inventory she can buy and will help her continue to make a profit.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 25 year-old Amina M., who is married and has four children aged between 3 and 9. In 2006, Amina established her used clothing business which, with the assistance of her husband, she operates six days a week, 9 to 12 hours a day. Amina now requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of used clothing in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately $90. In the future, Amina plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything Western or modern. While there are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of used clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama started her local restaurant twenty years ago at Obuasi, where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the popular food vendors in her neighborhood. Ama is 50 years old and married with three children currently in school.

She serves many kinds of local dishes: fufu, rice balls, banku, and ampesi, among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, and taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Ampesi is a boiled plantain or yam and it is taken with stew.

Ama wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. Ama hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children’s education.

Ama is a member of the community group called "Blessing Trust Group." In this group, members assist one another to provide support in handling loan repayments.

This photograph of Ama was taken during a group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials: bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona is 60 years old, married, and without an education. However, her business has allowed her to become more familiar with numbers and counting. She is a mother of seven children and in her care is a son, a daughter and an orphaned niece.

She is a member of the Communal Bank "Nueva Horizonte" of the Centro village of the Caritamaya sector Marquiri in the district of Acora, province and region of Puno. She decided to belong to this with the aim of launching a business that buys and sells sheep in the weekly Saturday markets in the city of Acora. This has, from the beginning, increased her capital and economic resources.

With the loan of S/. 500.00 Peruvian Soles ($ 200.00), which will be repaid in four months time, she will purchase sheep in order to sell them in the markets.

She is very happy, and being a member of the Communal Bank has taught her to be responsible, be happy, manage well her money and to support the other women. Her dream is to continue with this business, and see her children and niece become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Petrona tiene 60 años D. edad, casada, no estudió pero sin embargo con el negocio logró conocer los números y firmar, es madre D. 07 hijos y a su lado están un hijo, una hija y una nieta huérfana. Es socia del Banco Comunal Nuevo Horizonte del Centro poblado D. Caritamaya sector Marquiri del distrito D. Acora, provincia y región D. Puno. Ella decidió pertenecer con fin D. emprender el negocio D. compra y venta D. ganado ovino en las ferias semanales del día sábado en la ciudad D. Acora, ya que con los primeros préstamos aumento su capital e ingreso económico. Con este préstamo D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, el cual serà cancelando en cuatro meses, comprarà ganado para luego venderlos en las ferias. Ella, está feliz, ya que en el Banco Comunal aprendió ser responsable, estar alegre, administrar bien el dinero y ser solidaria con las otras mujeres. Su deseo granD. es continuar con el negocio, sea profesional sus hijos y su nieta.

loans.use: Purchasing sheep

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en: H. Ismoil is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children. His wife works as a housekeeper. Ismoil owns a minivan, and provides transportation services to the residents of Khujand. Initially, Isomil began his business using a car, but after accumulating his earnings, he was able to afford a minivan. His dedication and responsible work ethic has established him a good reputation. Ismoil’s minivan is in need of a major repair, and he is now requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase spare parts for his car. He and his family thank you in advance for your support.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and repair his minivan

loans.name: Eleuteria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Eleuteria Isabel Z. E.  tiene cincuentaidos años vive en la Avenida Primavera  sin  número del distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Eleuteria estudió educación primaria completa pero ya no siguió estudiando porque, sus padres eran muy pobres y no pudieron apoyarla.
Se casó de treinta años con el señor Fernando Javier Rafael Vidal, con el que tienen dos hijos, de los cuales uno es trabajador independiente y el otro todavía es estudiante.
Eleuteria se dedica a la compra venta de quesillo, verdura, cuyes y gallinas, sus actividades las realiza en su casa.
No recuerda desde hace cuanto tiempo pertenece a Manuela Ramos pero si recuerda que su primer préstamo de 300 soles los utilizó en comprar dos cerdos y una oveja, el préstamo fue devuelto en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2300 soles, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, comprará una vaca de 1300 soles y el resto lo empleará en comprar material para la fabricación de teja (material para construcción).
Sueña en viajar a ver a sus hermanos que viven en el extranjero y pasar unos días con ellos.
Eleuteria pertenece al Comedor Popular María Victoria y al Banco Comunal Mujeres de Trabajo.
texts.en:
