Mrs. Eleuteria Isabel Z. E. is 52 years old and lives on Primavera Avenue in the Mache District of Otuzco Province in the La Libertad Department of Peru. Eleuteria completed primary school, but could not continue her education because her parents were very poor and could not support her any more. When she was 30 years old, she married Mr. Fernando Javier Rafael Vidal, with whom she has two children, one of whom works and is independent, while the other is still in school.

Eleuteria buys and sells quesillo (a soft, mild cheese), vegetables, guinea pigs and hens from her home. She cannot remember how long she has been a client of Manuela Ramos, but she does remember that she used her first loan of 300 soles to buy two pigs and a sheep and repaid the loan in four months. With her current loan of 2300 soles (about $800) she will buy a cow for 1300 soles and will use the remaining 1000 soles to buy materials to make roof tiles.

She dreams of travelling to spend time with her brothers, who live outside Peru. Eleuteria belongs to the Maria Victoria working-class eatery and the Mujeres de Trabajo Communal Bank (a group loan).

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow, materials to make roof tiles

loans.name: Eddy

texts.es: Eddy tiene 28 años y un hijo de 6 años, su  esposo dice que es muy responsable, la ha apoyado para que tenga su negocio de carnicería. Se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para ir a comprar carne en una zona alta, las 8 ya está de regreso, otros días, alternados, va a comprar pescado al por mayor, en cambió, el pollo, le abastecen a su puesto. Luego de la compra se dedican a vender, de acuerdo las exigencias del cliente, ya sea pescado, carne o pollo. Le gusta mucho estar en contacto con la gente, por ello que en las tardes se dedica a vender tamales, gaseosas o frutas.  Su esposo trabaja en Gabiones, es una especie de defensa en el río, con piedras. Su anhelo es remodelara su puesto con material noble (cemento), apropiado para su negocio. Eddy no toma su labor como un trabajo, porque se divierte mucho con sus clientes, por ello se esfuerza en tener surtida su carnicería con todas las variedades de carne, por ende mejorar y ampliar su puesto, para dar un buen servicio al público. Con el dinero del préstamo, invertirá en javas de pescados, asimismo en la compra de carnes rojas, y sobre todo, para reparar su congeladora que tiene fallas en la conservación de la carne. Cree que con el tiempo, va a ir mejorando.
texts.en:
Eddy is 28 years old and has one son that is 6 years of age. Her husband states that she is very responsible, and has supported her so that she could have her butcher business. She rises at 5 a.m. in the morning to go to purchase meat, and she returns by 8 a.m. Every other day, she goes to purchase fish at wholesale and, alternatively, the poultry is supplied to her location. After the buying, she dedicates herself to selling in accordance with the customers’ demands, be it fish, beef or poultry. She likes very much being in contact with people, which is why in the afternoons she dedicates herself to selling tamales, sodas or fruit. Her husband works in gabiones (anchored stone dams) which help protect river beds. Her dream is to remodel her post with better materials (cement) appropriated for her business. Eddy doesn’t view her labor as work because she enjoys her time with customers so much, which is why she puts forth great effort to have her butcher’s shop well-stocked with a variety of types of meat. She wants to improve and expand her location, so she can provide good service to the public. She will invest the funds from the loan into the purchase of fish, red meat and, most importantly, into the repair of her freezer which she needs to preserve her products. She thinks that, with time, things will improve for her.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of all types of meats, as well as to repair freezer.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a member of the Lirio (“Iris”) Village Bank.  She is 60 years old, separated, and has seven children. She runs a stO. from her home in the Jesus Nazareno district of Ayacucho, where she sells dry goods, fruits, vegetables, and gifts. She works seven days a week, and her daughter helps her with the stO..  Adela needs a loan of 600 soles to buy rice and sugar.  Adela dreams that her children will have everything they need in life. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Adela Es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Adela es separada, tiene 60 años y 7 hijos, Adela tiene una tienda en su casa, ubicada en el distrito de Jesús Nazareno, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, artículos de regalos, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija.
Adela necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Adela sueña con que sus hijos tengan todo lo necesario en sus vidas.

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun H., 47, is single and lives with her nieces and newphews. Two of them attend school and the other one is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a small village off of National Road No. Two, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. H. has been a village leader for 6 years. Currently, she and her family members live in an old, small house. She wants to build new house for them but lacks the money. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to combine with her own money to purchase construction materials for a new house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for building her new house.

loans.name: M/mpya E Group

texts.en:
Monica has owned a small charcoal store in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for the last 20 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of 250 USD. Every day she works for 12 hours in her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Monica is 29 years old, married, and has two children aged three and eight years old; she also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Anna, Fatuma, Halima and Stella. Each woman also has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to increase her current stock
